154 namespace io
155 {
156 
157 template<>
158 std::string enum_to_string<overmap_special_subtype>( overmap_special_subtype data )
159 {
160  switch( data ) {
161  // *INDENT-OFF*
162  case overmap_special_subtype::fixed: return "fixed";
163  case overmap_special_subtype::mutable_: return "mutable";
164  // *INDENT-ON*
165  case overmap_special_subtype::last:
166  break;
167  }
168  cata_fatal( "Invalid overmap_special_subtype" );
169 }
170 
171 template<>
172 std::string enum_to_string<om_direction::type>( om_direction::type d )
173 {
174  switch( d ) {
175  // *INDENT-OFF*
176  case om_direction::type::north: return "north";
177  case om_direction::type::east: return "east";
178  case om_direction::type::south: return "south";
179  case om_direction::type::west: return "west";
180  // *INDENT-ON*
181  case om_direction::type::invalid:
182  case om_direction::type::last:
183  break;
184  }
185  cata_fatal( "Invalid om_direction" );
186 }
187 
188 template<>
189 std::string enum_to_string<cube_direction>( cube_direction data )
190 {
191  switch( data ) {
192  // *INDENT-OFF*
193  case cube_direction::north: return "north";
194  case cube_direction::east: return "east";
195  case cube_direction::south: return "south";
196  case cube_direction::west: return "west";
197  case cube_direction::above: return "above";
198  case cube_direction::below: return "below";
199  // *INDENT-ON*
200  case cube_direction::last:
201  break;
202  }
203  cata_fatal( "Invalid cube_direction" );
204 }
205 
206 } // namespace io

208 namespace om_lines
209 {
210 
211 struct type {
212  uint32_t symbol;
213  size_t mapgen;
214  MULTITILE_TYPE subtile;
215  int rotation;
216  std::string suffix;
217 };
218 
219 static const std::array<std::string, 5> mapgen_suffixes = {{
220  "_straight", "_curved", "_end", "_tee", "_four_way"
221  }
222 };
223 
224 static const std::array < type, 1 + om_direction::bits > all = {{
225  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XXXX_S ), 4, unconnected, 0, "_isolated" }, // 0 ----
226  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XOXO_S ), 2, end_piece, 2, "_end_south" }, // 1 ---n
227  { UTF8_getch( LINE_OXOX_S ), 2, end_piece, 1, "_end_west" }, // 2 --e-
228  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XXOO_S ), 1, corner, 1, "_ne" }, // 3 --en
229  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XOXO_S ), 2, end_piece, 0, "_end_north" }, // 4 -s--
230  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XOXO_S ), 0, edge, 0, "_ns" }, // 5 -s-n
231  { UTF8_getch( LINE_OXXO_S ), 1, corner, 0, "_es" }, // 6 -se-
232  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XXXO_S ), 3, t_connection, 1, "_nes" }, // 7 -sen
233  { UTF8_getch( LINE_OXOX_S ), 2, end_piece, 3, "_end_east" }, // 8 w---
234  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XOOX_S ), 1, corner, 2, "_wn" }, // 9 w--n
235  { UTF8_getch( LINE_OXOX_S ), 0, edge, 1, "_ew" }, // 10 w-e-
236  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XXOX_S ), 3, t_connection, 2, "_new" }, // 11 w-en
237  { UTF8_getch( LINE_OOXX_S ), 1, corner, 3, "_sw" }, // 12 ws--
238  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XOXX_S ), 3, t_connection, 3, "_nsw" }, // 13 ws-n
239  { UTF8_getch( LINE_OXXX_S ), 3, t_connection, 0, "_esw" }, // 14 wse-
240  { UTF8_getch( LINE_XXXX_S ), 4, center, 0, "_nesw" } // 15 wsen
241  }
242 };
243 
244 static const size_t size = all.size();
245 static const size_t invalid = 0;
246 
247 static constexpr size_t rotate( size_t line, om_direction::type dir )
248 {
249  if( dir == om_direction::type::invalid ) {
250  return line;
251  }
252  // Bitwise rotation to the left.
253  return ( ( line << static_cast<size_t>( dir ) ) |
254  ( line >> ( om_direction::size - static_cast<size_t>( dir ) ) ) ) & om_direction::bits;
255 }
256 
257 static constexpr size_t set_segment( size_t line, om_direction::type dir )
258 {
259  if( dir == om_direction::type::invalid ) {
260  return line;
261  }
262  return line | 1 << static_cast<int>( dir );
263 }
264 
265 static constexpr bool has_segment( size_t line, om_direction::type dir )
266 {
267  if( dir == om_direction::type::invalid ) {
268  return false;
269  }
270  return static_cast<bool>( line & 1 << static_cast<int>( dir ) );
271 }
272 
273 static constexpr bool is_straight( size_t line )
274 {
275  return line == 1
276  || line == 2
277  || line == 4
278  || line == 5
279  || line == 8
280  || line == 10;
281 }
282 
283 static size_t from_dir( om_direction::type dir )
284 {
285  switch( dir ) {
286  case om_direction::type::north:
287  case om_direction::type::south:
288  return 5; // ns;
289  case om_direction::type::east:
290  case om_direction::type::west:
291  return 10; // ew
292  case om_direction::type::invalid:
293  case om_direction::type::last:
294  debugmsg( "Can't retrieve a line from the invalid direction." );
295  }
296 
297  return 0;
298 }
299

431 
432 std::string overmap_land_use_code::get_symbol() const
433 {
434  return utf32_to_utf8( symbol );
435 }
436 
437 void overmap_land_use_code::load( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string &src )
438 {
439  const bool strict = src == "dda";
440  assign( jo, "land_use_code", land_use_code, strict );
441  assign( jo, "name", name, strict );
442  assign( jo, "detailed_definition", detailed_definition, strict );
443 
444  optional( jo, was_loaded, "sym", symbol, unicode_codepoint_from_symbol_reader, NULL_UNICODE );
445 
446  if( symbol == NULL_UNICODE ) {
447  DebugLog( D_ERROR, D_GAME ) << "`sym` node is not defined properly for `land_use_code`: "
448  << id.c_str() << " (" << name << ")";
449  }
450 
451  assign( jo, "color", color );
452 
453 }
454 
455 void overmap_land_use_code::finalize()
456 {
457 
458 }
459 
460 void overmap_land_use_code::check() const
461 {
462 
463 }
464 
465 void overmap_land_use_codes::load( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string &src )
466 {
467  land_use_codes.load( jo, src );
468 }
469 
470 void overmap_land_use_codes::finalize()
471 {
472  for( const overmap_land_use_code &elem : land_use_codes.get_all() ) {
473  const_cast<overmap_land_use_code &>( elem ).finalize(); // This cast is ugly, but safe.
474  }
475 }
476 
477 void overmap_land_use_codes::check_consistency()
478 {
479  land_use_codes.check();
480 }
481 
482 void overmap_land_use_codes::reset()
483 {
484  land_use_codes.reset();
485 }

488 {
489  return land_use_codes.get_all();
490 }

492 void overmap_specials::load( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string &src )
493 {
494  specials.load( jo, src );
495 }
496 
497 void city_buildings::load( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string &src )
498 {
499  // Just an alias
500  overmap_specials::load( jo, src );
501 }
502 
503 void overmap_specials::finalize()
504 {
505  for( const overmap_special &elem : specials.get_all() ) {
506  const_cast<overmap_special &>( elem ).finalize(); // This cast is ugly, but safe.
507  }
508 }
509 
510 void overmap_specials::finalize_mapgen_parameters()
511 {
512  for( const overmap_special &elem : specials.get_all() ) {
513  // This cast is ugly, but safe.
514  const_cast<overmap_special &>( elem ).finalize_mapgen_parameters();
515  }
516 }
517 
518 void overmap_specials::check_consistency()
519 {
520  const size_t max_count = ( OMAPX / OMSPEC_FREQ ) * ( OMAPY / OMSPEC_FREQ );
521  const size_t actual_count = std::accumulate( specials.get_all().begin(), specials.get_all().end(),
522  static_cast< size_t >( 0 ),
523  []( size_t sum, const overmap_special & elem ) {
524  size_t min_occur = static_cast<size_t>( std::max( elem.get_constraints().occurrences.min, 0 ) );
525  const bool unique = elem.has_flag( "UNIQUE" ) || elem.has_flag( "GLOBALLY_UNIQUE" );
526  return sum + ( unique ? 0 : min_occur );
527  } );
528 
529  if( actual_count > max_count ) {
530  debugmsg( "There are too many mandatory overmap specials (%d > %d). Some of them may not be placed.",
531  actual_count, max_count );
532  }
533 
534  overmap_special_migration::check();
535  specials.check();
536 
537  for( const overmap_special &os : specials.get_all() ) {
538  overmap_special_id new_id = overmap_special_migration::migrate( os.id );
539  if( new_id.is_null() ) {
540  debugmsg( "Overmap special id %s has been removed or migrated to a different type.",
541  os.id.str() );
542  } else if( new_id != os.id ) {
543  debugmsg( "Overmap special id %s has been migrated. Use %s instead.", os.id.str(),
544  new_id.str() );
545  }
546  }
547 }
548 
549 void overmap_specials::reset()
550 {
551  specials.reset();
552 }
553 
554 const std::vector<overmap_special> &overmap_specials::get_all()
555 {
556  return specials.get_all();
557 }
558 
559 overmap_special_batch overmap_specials::get_default_batch( const point_abs_om &origin )
560 {
561  std::vector<const overmap_special *> res;
562 
563  res.reserve( specials.size() );
564  for( const overmap_special &elem : specials.get_all() ) {
565  if( elem.can_spawn() ) {
566  res.push_back( &elem );
567  }
568  }
569 
570  return overmap_special_batch( origin, res );
571 }
572 
573 bool is_river( const oter_id &ter )
574 {
575  return ter->is_river();
576 }
577 
578 bool is_lake_or_river( const oter_id &ter )
579 {
580  return ter->is_river() || ter->is_lake() || ter->is_lake_shore();
581 }
582 
583 bool is_water_body( const oter_id &ter )
584 {
585  return ter->is_river() || ter->is_lake() || ter->is_lake_shore() || ter->is_ocean() ||
586  ter->is_ocean_shore();
587 }
588 
589 bool is_ocean( const oter_id &ter )
590 {
591  return ter->is_ocean() || ter->is_ocean_shore();
592 }
593 
594 bool is_ot_match( const std::string &name, const oter_id &oter,
595  const ot_match_type match_type )
596 {
597  static const auto is_ot = []( const std::string & otype, const oter_id & oter ) {
598  return otype == oter.id().str();
599  };
600 
601  static const auto is_ot_type = []( const std::string & otype, const oter_id & oter ) {
602  // Is a match if the base type is the same which will allow for handling rotations/linear features
603  // but won't incorrectly match other locations that happen to contain the substring.
604  return otype == oter->get_type_id().str();
605  };
606 
607  static const auto is_ot_subtype = []( const std::string & otype, const oter_id & oter ) {
608  // Is a match if the base type and linear subtype (end/straight/curved/tee/four_way) are the same which will allow for handling rotations of linear features
609  // but won't incorrectly match other locations that happen to contain the substring.
610  return otype == oter->get_mapgen_id();
611  };
612 
613  static const auto is_ot_prefix = []( const std::string & otype, const oter_id & oter ) {
614  const size_t oter_size = oter.id().str().size();
615  const size_t compare_size = otype.size();
616  if( compare_size > oter_size ) {
617  return false;
618  }
619 
620  const auto &oter_str = oter.id();
621  if( oter_str.str().compare( 0, compare_size, otype ) != 0 ) {
622  return false;
623  }
624 
625  // check if it's a full match
626  if( compare_size == oter_size ) {
627  return true;
628  }
629 
630  // only okay for partial if next char is an underscore
631  return oter_str.str()[compare_size] == '_';
632  };
633 
634  static const auto is_ot_contains = []( const std::string & otype, const oter_id & oter ) {
635  // Checks for any partial match.
636  return strstr( oter.id().c_str(), otype.c_str() );
637  };
638 
639  switch( match_type ) {
640  case ot_match_type::exact:
641  return is_ot( name, oter );
642  case ot_match_type::type:
643  return is_ot_type( name, oter );
644  case ot_match_type::subtype:
645  return is_ot_subtype( name, oter );
646  case ot_match_type::prefix:
647  return is_ot_prefix( name, oter );
648  case ot_match_type::contains:
649  return is_ot_contains( name, oter );
650  default:
651  return false;
652  }
653 }
654 
655 /*
656  * load mapgen functions from an overmap_terrain json entry
657  * suffix is for roads/subways/etc which have "_straight", "_curved", "_tee", "_four_way" function mappings
658  */
659 static void load_overmap_terrain_mapgens( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string &id_base,
660  const std::string &suffix = "" )
661 {
662  const std::string fmapkey( id_base + suffix );
663  const std::string jsonkey( "mapgen" + suffix );
664  register_mapgen_function( fmapkey );
665  if( jo.has_array( jsonkey ) ) {
666  for( JsonObject jio : jo.get_array( jsonkey ) ) {
667  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-use-named-point-constants)
668  load_and_add_mapgen_function( jio, fmapkey, point_zero, point( 1, 1 ) );
669  }
670  }
671 }
672 
673 namespace io
674 {
675 template<>
676 std::string enum_to_string<oter_flags>( oter_flags data )
677 {
678  switch( data ) {
679  // *INDENT-OFF*
680  case oter_flags::known_down: return "KNOWN_DOWN";
681  case oter_flags::known_up: return "KNOWN_UP";
682  case oter_flags::river_tile: return "RIVER";
683  case oter_flags::bridge: return "BRIDGE";
684  case oter_flags::has_sidewalk: return "SIDEWALK";
685  case oter_flags::no_rotate: return "NO_ROTATE";
686  case oter_flags::should_not_spawn: return "SHOULD_NOT_SPAWN";
687  case oter_flags::ignore_rotation_for_adjacency: return "IGNORE_ROTATION_FOR_ADJACENCY";
688  case oter_flags::line_drawing: return "LINEAR";
689  case oter_flags::subway_connection: return "SUBWAY";
690  case oter_flags::requires_predecessor: return "REQUIRES_PREDECESSOR";
691  case oter_flags::water: return "WATER";
692  case oter_flags::lake: return "LAKE";
693  case oter_flags::lake_shore: return "LAKE_SHORE";
694  case oter_flags::ocean: return "OCEAN";
695  case oter_flags::ocean_shore: return "OCEAN_SHORE";
696  case oter_flags::ravine: return "RAVINE";
697  case oter_flags::ravine_edge: return "RAVINE_EDGE";
698  case oter_flags::generic_loot: return "GENERIC_LOOT";
699  case oter_flags::risk_high: return "RISK_HIGH";
700  case oter_flags::risk_low: return "RISK_LOW";
701  case oter_flags::source_ammo: return "SOURCE_AMMO";
702  case oter_flags::source_animals: return "SOURCE_ANIMALS";
703  case oter_flags::source_books: return "SOURCE_BOOKS";
704  case oter_flags::source_chemistry: return "SOURCE_CHEMISTRY";
705  case oter_flags::source_clothing: return "SOURCE_CLOTHING";
706  case oter_flags::source_construction: return "SOURCE_CONSTRUCTION";
707  case oter_flags::source_cooking: return "SOURCE_COOKING";
708  case oter_flags::source_drink: return "SOURCE_DRINK";
709  case oter_flags::source_electronics: return "SOURCE_ELECTRONICS";
710  case oter_flags::source_fabrication: return "SOURCE_FABRICATION";
711  case oter_flags::source_farming: return "SOURCE_FARMING";
712  case oter_flags::source_food: return "SOURCE_FOOD";
713  case oter_flags::source_forage: return "SOURCE_FORAGE";
714  case oter_flags::source_fuel: return "SOURCE_FUEL";
715  case oter_flags::source_gun: return "SOURCE_GUN";
716  case oter_flags::source_luxury: return "SOURCE_LUXURY";
717  case oter_flags::source_medicine: return "SOURCE_MEDICINE";
718  case oter_flags::source_people: return "SOURCE_PEOPLE";
719  case oter_flags::source_safety: return "SOURCE_SAFETY";
720  case oter_flags::source_tailoring: return "SOURCE_TAILORING";
721  case oter_flags::source_vehicles: return "SOURCE_VEHICLES";
722  case oter_flags::source_weapon: return "SOURCE_WEAPON";
723  // *INDENT-ON*
724  case oter_flags::num_oter_flags:
725  break;
726  }
727  cata_fatal( "Invalid oter_flags" );
728 }
729 
730 } // namespace io
731 
732 std::string oter_type_t::get_symbol() const
733 {
734  return utf32_to_utf8( symbol );
735 }
736 
737 namespace io
738 {
739 template<>
740 std::string enum_to_string<oter_travel_cost_type>( oter_travel_cost_type data )
741 {
742  switch( data ) {
743  // *INDENT-OFF*
744  case oter_travel_cost_type::other: return "other";
745  case oter_travel_cost_type::road: return "road";
746  case oter_travel_cost_type::field: return "field";
747  case oter_travel_cost_type::dirt_road: return "dirt_road";
748  case oter_travel_cost_type::trail: return "trail";
749  case oter_travel_cost_type::forest: return "forest";
750  case oter_travel_cost_type::shore: return "shore";
751  case oter_travel_cost_type::swamp: return "swamp";
752  case oter_travel_cost_type::water: return "water";
753  case oter_travel_cost_type::air: return "air";
754  case oter_travel_cost_type::impassable: return "impassable";
755  // *INDENT-ON*
756  case oter_travel_cost_type::last:
757  break;
758  }
759  cata_fatal( "Invalid oter_travel_cost_type" );
760 }
761 } // namespace io
762 
763 void oter_type_t::load( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string &src )
764 {
765  const bool strict = src == "dda";
766 
767  optional( jo, was_loaded, "sym", symbol, unicode_codepoint_from_symbol_reader, NULL_UNICODE );
768 
769  assign( jo, "name", name, strict );
770  assign( jo, "see_cost", see_cost, strict );
771  assign( jo, "extras", extras, strict );
772  assign( jo, "mondensity", mondensity, strict );
773  assign( jo, "entry_eoc", entry_EOC, strict );
774  assign( jo, "exit_eoc", exit_EOC, strict );
775  assign( jo, "spawns", static_spawns, strict );
776  assign( jo, "color", color );
777  assign( jo, "land_use_code", land_use_code, strict );
778 
779  if( jo.has_member( "looks_like" ) ) {
780  std::vector<std::string> ll;
781  if( jo.has_array( "looks_like" ) ) {
782  jo.read( "looks_like", ll );
783  } else if( jo.has_string( "looks_like" ) ) {
784  const std::string one_look = jo.get_string( "looks_like" );
785  ll.push_back( one_look );
786  }
787  looks_like = ll;
788  } else if( jo.has_member( "copy-from" ) ) {
789  looks_like.insert( looks_like.begin(), jo.get_string( "copy-from" ) );
790  }
791 
792  const auto flag_reader = typed_flag_reader<oter_flags>( "overmap terrain flag" );
793  optional( jo, was_loaded, "flags", flags, flag_reader );
794 
795  optional( jo, was_loaded, "connect_group", connect_group, string_reader{} );
796  optional( jo, was_loaded, "travel_cost_type", travel_cost_type, oter_travel_cost_type::other );
797 
798  if( has_flag( oter_flags::line_drawing ) ) {
799  if( has_flag( oter_flags::no_rotate ) ) {
800  jo.throw_error( R"(Mutually exclusive flags: "NO_ROTATE" and "LINEAR".)" );
801  }
802 
803  for( const auto &elem : om_lines::mapgen_suffixes ) {
804  load_overmap_terrain_mapgens( jo, id.str(), elem );
805  }
806 
807  if( symbol == NULL_UNICODE ) {
808  // Default the sym for linear terrains to a specific value which
809  // has special behaviour when using fallback ASCII tiles so as to
810  // cause it to draw using the box drawing characters (see
811  // load_ascii_set).
812  symbol = LINE_XOXO_C;
813  }
814  } else {
815  if( symbol == NULL_UNICODE && !jo.has_string( "abstract" ) ) {
816  DebugLog( D_ERROR, D_MAP_GEN ) << "sym is not defined for overmap_terrain: "
817  << id.c_str() << " (" << name << ")";
818  }
819  if( !jo.has_string( "sym" ) && jo.has_number( "sym" ) ) {
820  debugmsg( "sym is defined as number instead of string for overmap_terrain %s (%s)", id.c_str(),
821  name );
822  }
823  load_overmap_terrain_mapgens( jo, id.str() );
824  }
825 }
826 
827 void oter_type_t::check() const
828 {
829 
830 }
831 
832 void oter_type_t::finalize()
833 {
834  directional_peers.clear(); // In case of a second finalization.
835 
836  if( is_rotatable() ) {
837  for( om_direction::type dir : om_direction::all ) {
838  register_terrain( oter_t( *this, dir ), static_cast<size_t>( dir ), om_direction::size );
839  }
840  } else if( has_flag( oter_flags::line_drawing ) ) {
841  for( size_t i = 0; i < om_lines::size; ++i ) {
842  register_terrain( oter_t( *this, i ), i, om_lines::size );
843  }
844  } else {
845  register_terrain( oter_t( *this ), 0, 1 );
846  }
847 }
848 
849 void oter_type_t::register_terrain( const oter_t &peer, size_t n, size_t max_n )
850 {
851  cata_assert( n < max_n );
852  cata_assert( peer.type_is( *this ) );
853 
854  directional_peers.resize( max_n );
855 
856  if( peer.id.is_valid() ) {
857  directional_peers[n] = peer.id.id();
858  debugmsg( "Can't register the new overmap terrain \"%s\". It already exists.", peer.id.c_str() );
859  } else {
860  directional_peers[n] = terrains.insert( peer ).id.id();
861  }
862 }
863 
864 oter_id oter_type_t::get_first() const
865 {
866  cata_assert( !directional_peers.empty() );
867  return directional_peers.front();
868 }
869 
870 oter_id oter_type_t::get_rotated( om_direction::type dir ) const
871 {
872  if( dir == om_direction::type::invalid ) {
873  debugmsg( "Invalid rotation was asked from overmap terrain \"%s\".", id.c_str() );
874  return ot_null;
875  } else if( dir == om_direction::type::none || !is_rotatable() ) {
876  return directional_peers.front();
877  }
878  cata_assert( directional_peers.size() == om_direction::size );
879  return directional_peers[static_cast<size_t>( dir )];
880 }
881 
882 oter_id oter_type_t::get_linear( size_t n ) const
883 {
884  if( !has_flag( oter_flags::line_drawing ) ) {
885  debugmsg( "Overmap terrain \"%s \" isn't drawn with lines.", id.c_str() );
886  return ot_null;
887  }
888  if( n >= om_lines::size ) {
889  debugmsg( "Invalid overmap line (%d) was asked from overmap terrain \"%s\".", n, id.c_str() );
890  return ot_null;
891  }
892  cata_assert( directional_peers.size() == om_lines::size );
893  return directional_peers[n];
894 }
895 
896 oter_t::oter_t() : oter_t( oter_type_t::null_type ) {}
897 
898 oter_t::oter_t( const oter_type_t &type ) :
899  type( &type ),
900  id( type.id.str() ),
901  symbol( type.symbol ),
902  symbol_alt( type.land_use_code ? type.land_use_code->symbol : symbol ) {}
903 
904 oter_t::oter_t( const oter_type_t &type, om_direction::type dir ) :
905  type( &type ),
906  id( type.id.str() + "_" + io::enum_to_string( dir ) ),
907  dir( dir ),
908  symbol( om_direction::rotate_symbol( type.symbol, dir ) ),
909  symbol_alt( om_direction::rotate_symbol( type.land_use_code ? type.land_use_code->symbol :
910  type.symbol, dir ) ),
911  line( om_lines::from_dir( dir ) ) {}
912 
913 oter_t::oter_t( const oter_type_t &type, size_t line ) :
914  type( &type ),
915  id( type.id.str() + om_lines::all[line].suffix ),
916  symbol( om_lines::all[line].symbol ),
917  symbol_alt( om_lines::all[line].symbol ),
918  line( line ) {}
919 
920 std::string oter_t::get_mapgen_id() const
921 {
922  return type->has_flag( oter_flags::line_drawing )
923  ? type->id.str() + om_lines::mapgen_suffixes[om_lines::all[line].mapgen]
924  : type->id.str();
925 }
926 
927 oter_id oter_t::get_rotated( om_direction::type dir ) const
928 {
929  return type->has_flag( oter_flags::line_drawing )
930  ? type->get_linear( om_lines::rotate( this->line, dir ) )
931  : type->get_rotated( om_direction::add( this->dir, dir ) );
932 }
933 
934 void oter_t::get_rotation_and_subtile( int &rotation, int &subtile ) const
935 {
936  if( is_linear() ) {
937  const om_lines::type &t = om_lines::all[line];
938  rotation = t.rotation;
939  subtile = t.subtile;
940  } else if( is_rotatable() ) {
941  rotation = ( 4 - static_cast<int>( get_dir() ) ) % 4;
942  subtile = -1;
943  } else {
944  rotation = 0;
945  subtile = -1;
946  }
947 }
948 
949 int oter_t::get_rotation() const
950 {
951  if( is_linear() ) {
952  const om_lines::type &t = om_lines::all[line];
953  // It turns out the rotation used for linear things is the opposite of
954  // the rotation used for other things. Sigh.
955  return ( 4 - t.rotation ) % 4;
956  }
957  if( is_rotatable() ) {
958  return static_cast<int>( get_dir() );
959  }
960  return 0;
961 }
962 
963 bool oter_t::type_is( const int_id<oter_type_t> &type_id ) const
964 {
965  return type->id.id() == type_id;
966 }
967 
968 bool oter_t::type_is( const oter_type_t &type ) const
969 {
970  return this->type == &type;
971 }
972 
973 bool oter_t::has_connection( om_direction::type dir ) const
974 {
975  // TODO: It's a DAMN UGLY hack. Remove it as soon as possible.
976  if( id == oter_road_nesw_manhole ) {
977  return true;
978  }
979  return om_lines::has_segment( line, dir );
980 }
981 
982 bool oter_t::is_hardcoded() const
983 {
984  // TODO: This set only exists because so does the monstrous 'if-else' statement in @ref map::draw_map(). Get rid of both.
985  static const std::set<std::string> hardcoded_mapgen = {
986  "ants_lab",
987  "ants_lab_stairs",
988  "ice_lab",
989  "ice_lab_stairs",
990  "ice_lab_core",
991  "ice_lab_finale",
992  "central_lab",
993  "central_lab_stairs",
994  "central_lab_core",
995  "central_lab_finale",
996  "tower_lab",
997  "tower_lab_stairs",
998  "tower_lab_finale",
999  "lab",
1000  "lab_core",
1001  "lab_stairs",
1002  "lab_finale",
1003  "slimepit",
1004  "slimepit_down"
1005  };
1006 
1007  return hardcoded_mapgen.find( get_mapgen_id() ) != hardcoded_mapgen.end();
1008 }
1009 
1010 void overmap_terrains::load( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string &src )
1011 {
1012  terrain_types.load( jo, src );
1013 }
1014 
1015 void overmap_terrains::check_consistency()
1016 {
1017  for( const oter_type_t &elem : terrain_types.get_all() ) {
1018  elem.check();
1019  if( elem.static_spawns.group && !elem.static_spawns.group.is_valid() ) {
1020  debugmsg( "Invalid monster group \"%s\" in spawns of \"%s\".", elem.static_spawns.group.c_str(),
1021  elem.id.c_str() );
1022  }
1023  }
1024 
1025  for( const oter_t &elem : terrains.get_all() ) {
1026  const std::string mid = elem.get_mapgen_id();
1027 
1028  if( mid.empty() ) {
1029  continue;
1030  }
1031 
1032  const bool exists_hardcoded = elem.is_hardcoded();
1033 
1034  if( has_mapgen_for( mid ) ) {
1035  if( test_mode && exists_hardcoded ) {
1036  debugmsg( "Mapgen terrain \"%s\" exists in both JSON and a hardcoded function. Consider removing the latter.",
1037  mid.c_str() );
1038  }
1039  check_mapgen_consistent_with( mid, elem );
1040  } else if( !exists_hardcoded ) {
1041  debugmsg( "No mapgen terrain exists for \"%s\".", mid.c_str() );
1042  }
1043  }
1044 }
1045 
1046 void overmap_terrains::finalize()
1047 {
1048  terrain_types.finalize();
1049 
1050  for( const oter_type_t &elem : terrain_types.get_all() ) {
1051  const_cast<oter_type_t &>( elem ).finalize(); // This cast is ugly, but safe.
1052  }
1053 
1054  if( region_settings_map.find( "default" ) == region_settings_map.end() ) {
1055  debugmsg( "ERROR: can't find default overmap settings (region_map_settings 'default'), "
1056  "Cataclysm pending. And not the fun kind." );
1057  }
1058 
1059  for( auto &elem : region_settings_map ) {
1060  elem.second.finalize();
1061  }
1062 
1063  set_oter_ids();
1064 }
1065 
1066 void overmap_terrains::reset()
1067 {
1068  terrain_types.reset();
1069  terrains.reset();
1070 }
1071 
1072 const std::vector<oter_t> &overmap_terrains::get_all()
1073 {
1074  return terrains.get_all();
1075 }
1076 
1077 static bool is_amongst_locations( const oter_id &oter,
1078  const cata::flat_set<string_id<overmap_location>> &locations )
1079 {
1080  return std::any_of( locations.begin(), locations.end(),
1081  [&oter]( const string_id<overmap_location> &loc ) {
1082  return loc->test( oter );
1083  } );
1084 }
1085 
1086 bool overmap_special_locations::can_be_placed_on( const oter_id &oter ) const
1087 {
1088  return is_amongst_locations( oter, locations );
1089 }
1090 
1091 void overmap_special_locations::deserialize( const JsonArray &ja )
1092 {
1093  if( ja.size() != 2 ) {
1094  ja.throw_error( "expected array of size 2" );
1095  }
1096 
1097  ja.read( 0, p, true );
1098  ja.read( 1, locations, true );
1099 }
1100 
1101 void overmap_special_terrain::deserialize( const JsonObject &om )
1102 {
1103  om.read( "point", p );
1104  om.read( "overmap", terrain );
1105  om.read( "flags", flags );
1106  om.read( "locations", locations );
1107 }
1108 
1109 overmap_special_terrain::overmap_special_terrain(
1110  const tripoint &p, const oter_str_id &t, const cata::flat_set<string_id<overmap_location>> &l,
1111  const std::set<std::string> &fs )
1112  : overmap_special_locations{ p, l }
1113  , terrain( t )
1114  , flags( fs )
1115 {}
1116 
1117 cube_direction operator+( const cube_direction l, const om_direction::type r )
1118 {
1119  return l + static_cast<int>( r );
1120 }
1121 
1122 cube_direction operator+( const cube_direction d, int i )
1123 {
1124  switch( d ) {
1125  case cube_direction::north:
1126  case cube_direction::east:
1127  case cube_direction::south:
1128  case cube_direction::west:
1129  return static_cast<cube_direction>( ( static_cast<int>( d ) + i ) % 4 );
1130  case cube_direction::above:
1131  case cube_direction::below:
1132  return d;
1133  case cube_direction::last:
1134  break;
1135  }
1136  constexpr_fatal( cube_direction::last, "Invalid cube_direction" );
1137 }
1138 
1139 cube_direction operator-( const cube_direction l, const om_direction::type r )
1140 {
1141  return l - static_cast<int>( r );
1142 }
1143 
1144 cube_direction operator-( const cube_direction d, int i )
1145 {
1146  switch( d ) {
1147  case cube_direction::north:
1148  case cube_direction::east:
1149  case cube_direction::south:
1150  case cube_direction::west:
1151  return static_cast<cube_direction>( ( static_cast<int>( d ) - i + 4 ) % 4 );
1152  case cube_direction::above:
1153  case cube_direction::below:
1154  return d;
1155  case cube_direction::last:
1156  break;
1157  }
1158  constexpr_fatal( cube_direction::last, "Invalid cube_direction" );
1159 }
1160 
1161 tripoint displace( cube_direction d )
1162 {
1163  switch( d ) {
1164  case cube_direction::north:
1165  return tripoint_north;
1166  case cube_direction::east:
1167  return tripoint_east;
1168  case cube_direction::south:
1169  return tripoint_south;
1170  case cube_direction::west:
1171  return tripoint_west;
1172  case cube_direction::above:
1173  return tripoint_above;
1174  case cube_direction::below:
1175  return tripoint_below;
1176  case cube_direction::last:
1177  break;
1178  }
1179  cata_fatal( "Invalid cube_direction" );
1180 }
1181 
1182 struct special_placement_result {
1183  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> omts_used;
1184  std::vector<std::pair<om_pos_dir, std::string>> joins_used;
1185 };
1186 
1187 struct overmap_special_data {
1188  virtual ~overmap_special_data() = default;
1189  virtual void finalize(
1190  const std::string &context,
1191  const cata::flat_set<string_id<overmap_location>> &default_locations ) = 0;
1192  virtual void finalize_mapgen_parameters(
1193  mapgen_parameters &, const std::string &context ) const = 0;
1194  virtual void check( const std::string &context ) const = 0;
1195  virtual std::vector<overmap_special_terrain> preview_terrains() const = 0;
1196  virtual std::vector<overmap_special_locations> required_locations() const = 0;
1197  virtual int score_rotation_at( const overmap &om, const tripoint_om_omt &p,
1198  om_direction::type r ) const = 0;
1199  virtual special_placement_result place(
1200  overmap &om, const tripoint_om_omt &origin, om_direction::type dir, bool blob,
1201  const city &cit, bool must_be_unexplored ) const = 0;
1202 };
1203 
1204 struct fixed_overmap_special_data : overmap_special_data {
1205  fixed_overmap_special_data() = default;
1206  explicit fixed_overmap_special_data( const overmap_special_terrain &ter )
1207  : terrains{ ter }
1208  {}
1209 
1210  void finalize(
1211  const std::string &/*context*/,
1212  const cata::flat_set<string_id<overmap_location>> &default_locations ) override {
1213  // If the special has default locations, then add those to the locations
1214  // of each of the terrains IF the terrain has no locations already.
1215  for( overmap_special_terrain &t : terrains ) {
1216  if( t.locations.empty() ) {
1217  t.locations = default_locations;
1218  }
1219  }
1220 
1221  for( overmap_special_connection &elem : connections ) {
1222  const overmap_special_terrain &oter = get_terrain_at( elem.p );
1223  if( !elem.terrain && oter.terrain ) {
1224  elem.terrain = oter.terrain->get_type_id(); // Defaulted.
1225  }
1226 
1227  // If the connection type hasn't been specified, we'll guess for them.
1228  // The guess isn't always right (hence guessing) in the case where
1229  // multiple connections types can be made on a single location type,
1230  // e.g. both roads and forest trails can be placed on "forest" locations.
1231  if( elem.connection.is_null() ) {
1232  elem.connection = overmap_connections::guess_for( elem.terrain );
1233  }
1234 
1235  // If the connection has a "from" hint specified, then figure out what the
1236  // resulting direction from the hinted location to the connection point is,
1237  // and use that as the initial direction to be passed off to the connection
1238  // building code.
1239  if( elem.from ) {
1240  const direction calculated_direction = direction_from( *elem.from, elem.p );
1241  switch( calculated_direction ) {
1242  case direction::NORTH:
1243  elem.initial_dir = cube_direction::north;
1244  break;
1245  case direction::EAST:
1246  elem.initial_dir = cube_direction::east;
1247  break;
1248  case direction::SOUTH:
1249  elem.initial_dir = cube_direction::south;
1250  break;
1251  case direction::WEST:
1252  elem.initial_dir = cube_direction::west;
1253  break;
1254  default:
1255  // The only supported directions are north/east/south/west
1256  // as those are the four directions that overmap connections
1257  // can be made in. If the direction we figured out wasn't
1258  // one of those, just set this as invalid. We'll provide
1259  // a warning to the user/developer in overmap_special::check().
1260  elem.initial_dir = cube_direction::last;
1261  break;
1262  }
1263  }
1264  }
1265  }
1266 
1267  void finalize_mapgen_parameters( mapgen_parameters &params,
1268  const std::string &context ) const override {
1269  for( const overmap_special_terrain &t : terrains ) {
1270  if( !t.terrain.is_valid() ) {
1271  if( oter_str_id( t.terrain.str() + "_north" ).is_valid() ) {
1272  debugmsg( "In %s, terrain \"%s\" rotates, but is specified without a "
1273  "rotation.", context, t.terrain.str() );
1274  } else {
1275  debugmsg( "In %s, terrain \"%s\" is invalid.", context, t.terrain.str() );
1276  }
1277  }
1278  std::string mapgen_id = t.terrain->get_mapgen_id();
1279  params.check_and_merge( get_map_special_params( mapgen_id ), context );
1280  }
1281  }
1282 
1283  void check( const std::string &context ) const override {
1284  std::set<oter_str_id> invalid_terrains;
1285  std::set<tripoint> points;
1286 
1287  for( const overmap_special_terrain &elem : terrains ) {
1288  const oter_str_id &oter = elem.terrain;
1289 
1290  if( !oter.is_valid() ) {
1291  if( !invalid_terrains.count( oter ) ) {
1292  // Not a huge fan of the the direct id manipulation here, but I don't know
1293  // how else to do this
1294  // Because we try to access all the terrains in the finalization,
1295  // this is a little redundant, but whatever
1296  oter_str_id invalid( oter.str() + "_north" );
1297  if( invalid.is_valid() ) {
1298  debugmsg( "In %s, terrain \"%s\" rotates, but is specified without a "
1299  "rotation.", context, oter.str() );
1300  } else {
1301  debugmsg( "In %s, terrain \"%s\" is invalid.", context, oter.str() );
1302  }
1303  invalid_terrains.insert( oter );
1304  }
1305  }
1306 
1307  const tripoint &pos = elem.p;
1308 
1309  if( points.count( pos ) > 0 ) {
1310  debugmsg( "In %s, point %s is duplicated.", context, pos.to_string() );
1311  } else {
1312  points.insert( pos );
1313  }
1314 
1315  if( elem.locations.empty() ) {
1316  debugmsg( "In %s, no location is defined for point %s or the "
1317  "overall special.", context, pos.to_string() );
1318  }
1319 
1320  for( const auto &l : elem.locations ) {
1321  if( !l.is_valid() ) {
1322  debugmsg( "In %s, point %s, location \"%s\" is invalid.",
1323  context, pos.to_string(), l.c_str() );
1324  }
1325  }
1326  }
1327 
1328  for( const overmap_special_connection &elem : connections ) {
1329  const overmap_special_terrain &oter = get_terrain_at( elem.p );
1330  if( !elem.terrain ) {
1331  debugmsg( "In %s, connection %s doesn't have a terrain.",
1332  context, elem.p.to_string() );
1333  } else if( !elem.existing && !elem.terrain->has_flag( oter_flags::line_drawing ) ) {
1334  debugmsg( "In %s, connection %s \"%s\" isn't drawn with lines.",
1335  context, elem.p.to_string(), elem.terrain.c_str() );
1336  } else if( !elem.existing && oter.terrain && !oter.terrain->type_is( elem.terrain ) ) {
1337  debugmsg( "In %s, connection %s overwrites \"%s\".",
1338  context, elem.p.to_string(), oter.terrain.c_str() );
1339  }
1340 
1341  if( elem.from ) {
1342  // The only supported directions are north/east/south/west
1343  // as those are the four directions that overmap connections
1344  // can be made in. If the direction we figured out wasn't
1345  // one of those, warn the user/developer.
1346  const direction calculated_direction = direction_from( *elem.from, elem.p );
1347  switch( calculated_direction ) {
1348  case direction::NORTH:
1349  case direction::EAST:
1350  case direction::SOUTH:
1351  case direction::WEST:
1352  continue;
1353  default:
1354  debugmsg( "In %s, connection %s is not directly north, "
1355  "east, south or west of the defined \"from\" %s.",
1356  context, elem.p.to_string(), elem.from->to_string() );
1357  break;
1358  }
1359  }
1360  }
1361  }
1362 
1363  const overmap_special_terrain &get_terrain_at( const tripoint &p ) const {
1364  const auto iter = std::find_if( terrains.begin(), terrains.end(),
1365  [ &p ]( const overmap_special_terrain & elem ) {
1366  return elem.p == p;
1367  } );
1368  if( iter == terrains.end() ) {
1369  static const overmap_special_terrain null_terrain{};
1370  return null_terrain;
1371  }
1372  return *iter;
1373  }
1374 
1375  std::vector<overmap_special_terrain> preview_terrains() const override {
1376  std::vector<overmap_special_terrain> result;
1377  std::copy_if( terrains.begin(), terrains.end(), std::back_inserter( result ),
1378  []( const overmap_special_terrain & terrain ) {
1379  return terrain.p.z == 0;
1380  } );
1381  return result;
1382  }
1383 
1384  std::vector<overmap_special_locations> required_locations() const override {
1385  std::vector<overmap_special_locations> result;
1386  result.reserve( terrains.size() );
1387  std::copy( terrains.begin(), terrains.end(), std::back_inserter( result ) );
1388  return result;
1389  }
1390 
1391  int score_rotation_at( const overmap &om, const tripoint_om_omt &p,
1392  om_direction::type r ) const override {
1393  int score = 0;
1394  for( const overmap_special_connection &con : connections ) {
1395  const tripoint_om_omt rp = p + om_direction::rotate( con.p, r );
1396  if( !overmap::inbounds( rp ) ) {
1397  return -1;
1398  }
1399  const oter_id &oter = om.ter( rp );
1400 
1401  if( ( oter->get_type_id() == oter_type_str_id( con.terrain.str() ) ) ) {
1402  ++score; // Found another one satisfied connection.
1403  } else if( !oter || con.existing || !con.connection->pick_subtype_for( oter ) ) {
1404  return -1;
1405  }
1406  }
1407  return score;
1408  }
1409 
1410  special_placement_result place(
1411  overmap &om, const tripoint_om_omt &origin, om_direction::type dir, bool blob,
1412  const city &cit, bool must_be_unexplored ) const override {
1413  special_placement_result result;
1414 
1415  for( const overmap_special_terrain &elem : terrains ) {
1416  const tripoint_om_omt location = origin + om_direction::rotate( elem.p, dir );
1417  if( !( elem.terrain == oter_str_id::NULL_ID() ) ) {
1418  result.omts_used.push_back( location );
1419  const oter_id tid = elem.terrain->get_rotated( dir );
1420  om.ter_set( location, tid );
1421  if( blob ) {
1422  for( int x = -2; x <= 2; x++ ) {
1423  for( int y = -2; y <= 2; y++ ) {
1424  const tripoint_om_omt nearby_pos = location + point( x, y );
1425  if( !overmap::inbounds( nearby_pos ) ) {
1426  continue;
1427  }
1428  if( one_in( 1 + std::abs( x ) + std::abs( y ) ) &&
1429  elem.can_be_placed_on( om.ter( nearby_pos ) ) ) {
1430  om.ter_set( nearby_pos, tid );
1431  }
1432  }
1433  }
1434  }
1435  }
1436  }
1437  // Make connections.
1438  for( const overmap_special_connection &elem : connections ) {
1439  if( elem.connection ) {
1440  const tripoint_om_omt rp = origin + om_direction::rotate( elem.p, dir );
1441  cube_direction initial_dir = elem.initial_dir;
1442 
1443  if( initial_dir != cube_direction::last ) {
1444  initial_dir = initial_dir + dir;
1445  }
1446  if( cit ) {
1447  om.build_connection( cit.pos, rp.xy(), elem.p.z, *elem.connection,
1448  must_be_unexplored, initial_dir );
1449  }
1450  // if no city present, search for nearby road within 50 tiles and make
1451  // connection to it instead
1452  else {
1453  for( const tripoint_om_omt &nearby_point : closest_points_first( rp, 50 ) ) {
1454  if( om.check_ot( "road", ot_match_type::contains, nearby_point ) ) {
1455  om.build_connection(
1456  nearby_point.xy(), rp.xy(), elem.p.z, *elem.connection,
1457  must_be_unexplored, initial_dir );
1458  break;
1459  }
1460  }
1461  }
1462  }
1463  }
1464 
1465  return result;
1466  }
1467 
1468  std::vector<overmap_special_terrain> terrains;
1469  std::vector<overmap_special_connection> connections;
1470 };
1471 
1472 struct mutable_overmap_join {
1473  std::string id;
1474  std::string opposite_id;
1475  cata::flat_set<string_id<overmap_location>> into_locations;
1476  unsigned priority; // NOLINT(cata-serialize)
1477  const mutable_overmap_join *opposite = nullptr; // NOLINT(cata-serialize)
1478 
1479  void deserialize( const JsonValue &jin ) {
1480  if( jin.test_string() ) {
1481  id = jin.get_string();
1482  } else {
1483  JsonObject jo = jin.get_object();
1484  jo.read( "id", id, true );
1485  jo.read( "into_locations", into_locations, true );
1486  jo.read( "opposite", opposite_id, true );
1487  }
1488  }
1489 };
1490 
1491 enum class join_type {
1492  mandatory,
1493  available,
1494  last
1495 };
1496 
1497 template<>
1498 struct enum_traits<join_type> {
1499  static constexpr join_type last = join_type::last;
1500 };
1501 
1502 namespace io
1503 {
1504 
1505 template<>
1506 std::string enum_to_string<join_type>( join_type data )
1507 {
1508  switch( data ) {
1509  // *INDENT-OFF*
1510  case join_type::mandatory: return "mandatory";
1511  case join_type::available: return "available";
1512  // *INDENT-ON*
1513  case join_type::last:
1514  break;
1515  }
1516  cata_fatal( "Invalid join_type" );
1517 }
1518 
1519 } // namespace io
1520 
1521 struct mutable_overmap_terrain_join {
1522  std::string join_id;
1523  const mutable_overmap_join *join = nullptr; // NOLINT(cata-serialize)
1524  cata::flat_set<std::string> alternative_join_ids;
1525  cata::flat_set<const mutable_overmap_join *> alternative_joins; // NOLINT(cata-serialize)
1526  join_type type = join_type::mandatory;
1527 
1528  void finalize( const std::string &context,
1529  const std::unordered_map<std::string, mutable_overmap_join *> &joins ) {
1530  auto join_it = joins.find( join_id );
1531  if( join_it != joins.end() ) {
1532  join = join_it->second;
1533  } else {
1534  debugmsg( "invalid join id %s in %s", join_id, context );
1535  }
1536  for( const std::string &alt_join_id : alternative_join_ids ) {
1537  auto alt_join_it = joins.find( alt_join_id );
1538  if( alt_join_it != joins.end() ) {
1539  alternative_joins.insert( alt_join_it->second );
1540  } else {
1541  debugmsg( "invalid join id %s in %s", alt_join_id, context );
1542  }
1543  }
1544  }
1545 
1546  void deserialize( const JsonValue &jin ) {
1547  if( jin.test_string() ) {
1548  jin.read( join_id, true );
1549  } else if( jin.test_object() ) {
1550  JsonObject jo = jin.get_object();
1551  jo.read( "id", join_id, true );
1552  jo.read( "type", type, true );
1553  jo.read( "alternatives", alternative_join_ids, true );
1554  } else {
1555  jin.throw_error( "Expected string or object" );
1556  }
1557  }
1558 };
1559 
1560 using join_map = std::unordered_map<cube_direction, mutable_overmap_terrain_join>;
1561 
1562 struct mutable_special_connection {
1563  string_id<overmap_connection> connection;
1564 
1565  void deserialize( const JsonObject &jo ) {
1566  jo.read( "connection", connection );
1567  }
1568 
1569  void check( const std::string &context ) const {
1570  if( !connection.is_valid() ) {
1571  debugmsg( "invalid connection id %s in %s", connection.str(), context );
1572  }
1573  }
1574 };
1575 
1576 struct mutable_overmap_terrain {
1577  oter_str_id terrain;
1578  cata::flat_set<string_id<overmap_location>> locations;
1579  join_map joins;
1580  std::map<cube_direction, mutable_special_connection> connections;
1581 
1582  void finalize( const std::string &context,
1583  const std::unordered_map<std::string, mutable_overmap_join *> &special_joins,
1584  const cata::flat_set<string_id<overmap_location>> &default_locations ) {
1585  if( locations.empty() ) {
1586  locations = default_locations;
1587  }
1588  for( join_map::value_type &p : joins ) {
1589  mutable_overmap_terrain_join &ter_join = p.second;
1590  ter_join.finalize( context, special_joins );
1591  }
1592  }
1593 
1594  void check( const std::string &context ) const {
1595  if( !terrain.is_valid() ) {
1596  debugmsg( "invalid overmap terrain id %s in %s", terrain.str(), context );
1597  }
1598 
1599  if( locations.empty() ) {
1600  debugmsg( "In %s, no locations are defined", context );
1601  }
1602 
1603  for( const string_id<overmap_location> &loc : locations ) {
1604  if( !loc.is_valid() ) {
1605  debugmsg( "invalid overmap location id %s in %s", loc.str(), context );
1606  }
1607  }
1608 
1609  for( const std::pair<const cube_direction, mutable_special_connection> &p :
1610  connections ) {
1611  p.second.check( string_format( "connection %s in %s", io::enum_to_string( p.first ),
1612  context ) );
1613  }
1614  }
1615 
1616  void deserialize( const JsonObject &jo ) {
1617  jo.read( "overmap", terrain, true );
1618  jo.read( "locations", locations );
1619  for( int i = 0; i != static_cast<int>( cube_direction::last ); ++i ) {
1620  cube_direction dir = static_cast<cube_direction>( i );
1621  std::string dir_s = io::enum_to_string( dir );
1622  if( jo.has_member( dir_s ) ) {
1623  jo.read( dir_s, joins[dir], true );
1624  }
1625  }
1626  jo.read( "connections", connections );
1627  }
1628 };
1629 
1630 struct mutable_overmap_piece_candidate {
1631  const mutable_overmap_terrain *overmap; // NOLINT(cata-serialize)
1632  tripoint_om_omt pos;
1633  om_direction::type rot = om_direction::type::north;
1634 };
1635 
1636 struct mutable_overmap_placement_rule_piece {
1637  std::string overmap_id;
1638  const mutable_overmap_terrain *overmap; // NOLINT(cata-serialize)
1639  tripoint_rel_omt pos;
1640  om_direction::type rot = om_direction::type::north;
1641 
1642  void deserialize( const JsonObject &jo ) {
1643  jo.read( "overmap", overmap_id, true );
1644  jo.read( "pos", pos, true );
1645  jo.read( "rot", rot, true );
1646  }
1647 };
1648 
1649 struct mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder;
1650 
1651 struct mutable_overmap_placement_rule {
1652  std::string name;
1653  std::vector<mutable_overmap_placement_rule_piece> pieces;
1654  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-serialize)
1655  std::vector<std::pair<rel_pos_dir, const mutable_overmap_terrain_join *>> outward_joins;
1656  int_distribution max = int_distribution( INT_MAX );
1657  int weight = INT_MAX;
1658 
1659  std::string description() const {
1660  if( !name.empty() ) {
1661  return name;
1662  }
1663  std::string first_om_id = pieces[0].overmap_id;
1664  if( pieces.size() == 1 ) {
1665  return first_om_id;
1666  } else {
1667  return "chunk using overmap " + first_om_id;
1668  }
1669  }
1670 
1671  void finalize( const std::string &context,
1672  const std::unordered_map<std::string, mutable_overmap_terrain> &special_overmaps
1673  ) {
1674  std::unordered_map<tripoint_rel_omt, const mutable_overmap_placement_rule_piece *>
1675  pieces_by_pos;
1676  for( mutable_overmap_placement_rule_piece &piece : pieces ) {
1677  bool inserted = pieces_by_pos.emplace( piece.pos, &piece ).second;
1678  if( !inserted ) {
1679  debugmsg( "phase of %s has chunk with duplicated position %s",
1680  context, piece.pos.to_string() );
1681  }
1682  auto it = special_overmaps.find( piece.overmap_id );
1683  if( it == special_overmaps.end() ) {
1684  cata_fatal( "phase of %s specifies overmap %s which is not defined for that "
1685  "special", context, piece.overmap_id );
1686  } else {
1687  piece.overmap = &it->second;
1688  }
1689  }
1690  for( const mutable_overmap_placement_rule_piece &piece : pieces ) {
1691  const mutable_overmap_terrain &ter = *piece.overmap;
1692  for( const join_map::value_type &p : ter.joins ) {
1693  const cube_direction dir = p.first;
1694  const mutable_overmap_terrain_join &ter_join = p.second;
1695  rel_pos_dir this_side{ piece.pos, dir + piece.rot };
1696  rel_pos_dir other_side = this_side.opposite();
1697  auto opposite_piece = pieces_by_pos.find( other_side.p );
1698  if( opposite_piece == pieces_by_pos.end() ) {
1699  outward_joins.emplace_back( this_side, &ter_join );
1700  } else {
1701  const std::string &opposite_join = ter_join.join->opposite_id;
1702  const mutable_overmap_placement_rule_piece &other_piece =
1703  *opposite_piece->second;
1704  const mutable_overmap_terrain &other_om = *other_piece.overmap;
1705 
1706  auto opposite_om_join =
1707  other_om.joins.find( other_side.dir - other_piece.rot );
1708  if( opposite_om_join == other_om.joins.end() ) {
1709  debugmsg( "in phase of %s, %s has adjacent pieces %s at %s and %s at "
1710  "%s where the former has a join %s pointed towards the latter, "
1711  "but the latter has no join pointed towards the former",
1712  context, description(), piece.overmap_id, piece.pos.to_string(),
1713  other_piece.overmap_id, other_piece.pos.to_string(),
1714  ter_join.join_id );
1715  } else if( opposite_om_join->second.join_id != opposite_join ) {
1716  debugmsg( "in phase of %s, %s has adjacent pieces %s at %s and %s at "
1717  "%s where the former has a join %s pointed towards the latter, "
1718  "expecting a matching join %s whereas the latter has the join %s "
1719  "pointed towards the former",
1720  context, description(), piece.overmap_id, piece.pos.to_string(),
1721  other_piece.overmap_id, other_piece.pos.to_string(),
1722  ter_join.join_id, opposite_join,
1723  opposite_om_join->second.join_id );
1724  }
1725  }
1726  }
1727  }
1728  }
1729  void check( const std::string &context ) const {
1730  if( pieces.empty() ) {
1731  cata_fatal( "phase of %s has chunk with zero pieces" );
1732  }
1733  int min_max = max.minimum();
1734  if( min_max < 0 ) {
1735  debugmsg( "phase of %s specifies max which might be as low as %d; this should "
1736  "be a positive number", context, min_max );
1737  }
1738  }
1739 
1740  mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder realise() const;
1741 
1742  void deserialize( const JsonObject &jo ) {
1743  jo.read( "name", name );
1744  if( jo.has_member( "overmap" ) ) {
1745  pieces.emplace_back();
1746  jo.read( "overmap", pieces.back().overmap_id, true );
1747  } else if( jo.has_member( "chunk" ) ) {
1748  jo.read( "chunk", pieces );
1749  } else {
1750  jo.throw_error( R"(placement rule must specify at least one of "overmap" or "chunk")" );
1751  }
1752  jo.read( "max", max );
1753  jo.read( "weight", weight );
1754  if( !jo.has_member( "max" ) && weight == INT_MAX ) {
1755  jo.throw_error( R"(placement rule must specify at least one of "max" or "weight")" );
1756  }
1757  }
1758 };
1759 
1760 struct mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder {
1761  const mutable_overmap_placement_rule *parent;
1762  int max = INT_MAX;
1763  int weight = INT_MAX;
1764 
1765  std::string description() const {
1766  return parent->description();
1767  }
1768 
1769  int get_weight() const {
1770  return std::min( max, weight );
1771  }
1772 
1773  bool is_exhausted() const {
1774  return get_weight() == 0;
1775  }
1776 
1777  void decrement() {
1778  --max;
1779  }
1780 
1781  std::vector<tripoint_rel_omt> positions( om_direction::type rot ) const {
1782  std::vector<tripoint_rel_omt> result;
1783  result.reserve( parent->pieces.size() );
1784  for( const mutable_overmap_placement_rule_piece &piece : parent->pieces ) {
1785  result.push_back( rotate( piece.pos, rot ) );
1786  }
1787  return result;
1788  }
1789  auto pieces( const tripoint_om_omt &origin, om_direction::type rot ) const {
1790  using orig_t = mutable_overmap_placement_rule_piece;
1791  using dest_t = mutable_overmap_piece_candidate;
1792  return cata::views::transform < decltype( parent->pieces ), dest_t > ( parent->pieces,
1793  [origin, rot]( const orig_t &piece ) -> dest_t {
1794  tripoint_rel_omt rotated_offset = rotate( piece.pos, rot );
1795  return { piece.overmap, origin + rotated_offset, add( rot, piece.rot ) };
1796  } );
1797  }
1798  auto outward_joins( const tripoint_om_omt &origin, om_direction::type rot ) const {
1799  using orig_t = std::pair<rel_pos_dir, const mutable_overmap_terrain_join *>;
1800  using dest_t = std::pair<om_pos_dir, const mutable_overmap_terrain_join *>;
1801  return cata::views::transform < decltype( parent->outward_joins ), dest_t > ( parent->outward_joins,
1802  [origin, rot]( const orig_t &p ) -> dest_t {
1803  tripoint_rel_omt rotated_offset = rotate( p.first.p, rot );
1804  om_pos_dir p_d{ origin + rotated_offset, p.first.dir + rot };
1805  return { p_d, p.second };
1806  } );
1807  }
1808 };
1809 
1810 mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder mutable_overmap_placement_rule::realise() const
1811 {
1812  return mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder{ this, max.sample(), weight };
1813 }
1814 
1815 // When building a mutable overmap special we maintain a collection of
1816 // unresolved joins. We need to be able to index that collection in
1817 // various ways, so it gets its own struct to maintain the relevant invariants.
1818 class joins_tracker
1819 {
1820  public:
1821  struct join {
1822  om_pos_dir where;
1823  const mutable_overmap_join *join;
1824  };
1825  using iterator = std::list<join>::iterator;
1826  using const_iterator = std::list<join>::const_iterator;
1827 
1828  bool any_unresolved() const {
1829  return !unresolved.empty();
1830  }
1831 
1832  std::vector<const join *> all_unresolved_at( const tripoint_om_omt &pos ) const {
1833  std::vector<const join *> result;
1834  for( iterator it : unresolved.all_at( pos ) ) {
1835  result.push_back( &*it );
1836  }
1837  return result;
1838  }
1839 
1840  std::size_t count_unresolved_at( const tripoint_om_omt &pos ) const {
1841  return unresolved.count_at( pos );
1842  }
1843 
1844  bool any_postponed() const {
1845  return !postponed.empty();
1846  }
1847 
1848  bool any_postponed_at( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const {
1849  return postponed.any_at( p );
1850  }
1851 
1852  void consistency_check() const {
1853 #if 0 // Enable this to check the class invariants, at the cost of more runtime
1854  // verify that there are no positions in common between the
1855  // resolved and postponed lists
1856  for( const join &j : postponed ) {
1857  auto j_pos = j.where.p;
1858  if( unresolved.any_at( j_pos ) ) {
1859  std::vector<iterator> unr = unresolved.all_at( j_pos );
1860  if( unr.empty() ) {
1861  cata_fatal( "inconsistency between all_at and any_at" );
1862  } else {
1863  const join &unr_j = *unr.front();
1864  cata_fatal( "postponed and unresolved should be disjoint but are not at "
1865  "%s where unresolved has %s: %s",
1866  j_pos.to_string(), unr_j.where.p.to_string(), unr_j.join_id );
1867  }
1868  }
1869  }
1870 #endif
1871  }
1872 
1873  enum class join_status {
1874  disallowed, // Conflicts with existing join, and at least one was mandatory
1875  matched_available, // Matches an existing non-mandatory join
1876  matched_non_available, // Matches an existing mandatory join
1877  mismatched_available, // Points at an incompatible join, but both are non-mandatory
1878  free, // Doesn't point at another join at all
1879  };
1880 
1881  join_status allows( const om_pos_dir &this_side,
1882  const mutable_overmap_terrain_join &this_ter_join ) const {
1883  om_pos_dir other_side = this_side.opposite();
1884 
1885  auto is_allowed_opposite = [&]( const std::string & candidate ) {
1886  const mutable_overmap_join &this_join = *this_ter_join.join;
1887 
1888  if( this_join.opposite_id == candidate ) {
1889  return true;
1890  }
1891 
1892  for( const mutable_overmap_join *alt_join : this_ter_join.alternative_joins ) {
1893  if( alt_join->opposite_id == candidate ) {
1894  return true;
1895  }
1896  }
1897 
1898  return false;
1899  };
1900 
1901  if( const join *existing = resolved.find( other_side ) ) {
1902  bool other_side_mandatory = unresolved.count( this_side );
1903  if( is_allowed_opposite( existing->join->id ) ) {
1904  return other_side_mandatory
1905  ? join_status::matched_non_available : join_status::matched_available;
1906  } else {
1907  if( other_side_mandatory || this_ter_join.type != join_type::available ) {
1908  return join_status::disallowed;
1909  } else {
1910  return join_status::mismatched_available;
1911  }
1912  }
1913  } else {
1914  return join_status::free;
1915  }
1916  }
1917 
1918  void add_joins_for(
1919  const mutable_overmap_terrain &ter, const tripoint_om_omt &pos,
1920  om_direction::type rot, const std::vector<om_pos_dir> &suppressed_joins ) {
1921  consistency_check();
1922 
1923  std::unordered_set<om_pos_dir> avoid(
1924  suppressed_joins.begin(), suppressed_joins.end() );
1925 
1926  for( const std::pair<const cube_direction, mutable_overmap_terrain_join> &p :
1927  ter.joins ) {
1928  cube_direction dir = p.first + rot;
1929  const mutable_overmap_terrain_join &this_side_join = p.second;
1930 
1931  om_pos_dir this_side{ pos, dir };
1932  om_pos_dir other_side = this_side.opposite();
1933 
1934  if( const join *other_side_join = resolved.find( other_side ) ) {
1935  erase_unresolved( this_side );
1936  if( !avoid.count( this_side ) ) {
1937  used.emplace_back( other_side, other_side_join->join->id );
1938  // Because of the existence of alternative joins, we don't
1939  // simply add this_side_join here, we add the opposite of
1940  // the opposite that was actually present (this saves us
1941  // from heaving to search through the alternates to find
1942  // which one actually matched).
1943  used.emplace_back( this_side, other_side_join->join->opposite_id );
1944  }
1945  } else {
1946  // If there were postponed joins pointing into this point,
1947  // so we need to un-postpone them because it might now be
1948  // possible to satisfy them.
1949  restore_postponed_at( other_side.p );
1950  if( this_side_join.type == join_type::mandatory ) {
1951  if( !overmap::inbounds( other_side.p ) ) {
1952  debugmsg( "out of bounds join" );
1953  continue;
1954  }
1955  const mutable_overmap_join *opposite_join = this_side_join.join->opposite;
1956  add_unresolved( other_side, opposite_join );
1957  }
1958  }
1959  resolved.add( this_side, this_side_join.join );
1960  }
1961  consistency_check();
1962  }
1963 
1964  tripoint_om_omt pick_top_priority() const {
1965  cata_assert( any_unresolved() );
1966  auto priority_it =
1967  std::find_if( unresolved_priority_index.begin(), unresolved_priority_index.end(),
1968  []( const cata::flat_set<iterator, compare_iterators> &its ) {
1969  return !its.empty();
1970  } );
1971  cata_assert( priority_it != unresolved_priority_index.end() );
1972  auto it = random_entry( *priority_it );
1973  const tripoint_om_omt &pos = it->where.p;
1974  cata_assert( !postponed.any_at( pos ) );
1975  return pos;
1976  }
1977  void postpone( const tripoint_om_omt &pos ) {
1978  consistency_check();
1979  for( iterator it : unresolved.all_at( pos ) ) {
1980  postponed.add( *it );
1981  [[maybe_unused]] const bool erased = erase_unresolved( it->where );
1982  cata_assert( erased );
1983  }
1984  consistency_check();
1985  }
1986  void restore_postponed_at( const tripoint_om_omt &pos ) {
1987  for( iterator it : postponed.all_at( pos ) ) {
1988  add_unresolved( it->where, it->join );
1989  postponed.erase( it );
1990  }
1991  consistency_check();
1992  }
1993  void restore_postponed() {
1994  consistency_check();
1995  for( const join &j : postponed ) {
1996  add_unresolved( j.where, j.join );
1997  }
1998  postponed.clear();
1999  }
2000 
2001  const std::vector<std::pair<om_pos_dir, std::string>> &all_used() const {
2002  return used;
2003  }
2004  private:
2005  struct indexed_joins {
2006  std::list<join> joins;
2007  std::unordered_map<om_pos_dir, iterator> position_index;
2008 
2009  iterator begin() {
2010  return joins.begin();
2011  }
2012 
2013  iterator end() {
2014  return joins.end();
2015  }
2016 
2017  const_iterator begin() const {
2018  return joins.begin();
2019  }
2020 
2021  const_iterator end() const {
2022  return joins.end();
2023  }
2024 
2025  bool empty() const {
2026  return joins.empty();
2027  }
2028 
2029  bool count( const om_pos_dir &p ) const {
2030  return position_index.count( p );
2031  }
2032 
2033  const join *find( const om_pos_dir &p ) const {
2034  auto it = position_index.find( p );
2035  if( it == position_index.end() ) {
2036  return nullptr;
2037  }
2038  return &*it->second;
2039  }
2040 
2041  bool any_at( const tripoint_om_omt &pos ) const {
2042  for( cube_direction dir : all_enum_values<cube_direction>() ) {
2043  if( count( om_pos_dir{ pos, dir } ) ) {
2044  return true;
2045  }
2046  }
2047  return false;
2048  }
2049 
2050  std::vector<iterator> all_at( const tripoint_om_omt &pos ) const {
2051  std::vector<iterator> result;
2052  for( cube_direction dir : all_enum_values<cube_direction>() ) {
2053  om_pos_dir key{ pos, dir };
2054  auto pos_it = position_index.find( key );
2055  if( pos_it != position_index.end() ) {
2056  result.push_back( pos_it->second );
2057  }
2058  }
2059  return result;
2060  }
2061 
2062  std::size_t count_at( const tripoint_om_omt &pos ) const {
2063  std::size_t result = 0;
2064  for( cube_direction dir : all_enum_values<cube_direction>() ) {
2065  if( position_index.find( { pos, dir } ) != position_index.end() ) {
2066  ++result;
2067  }
2068  }
2069  return result;
2070  }
2071 
2072  iterator add( const om_pos_dir &p, const mutable_overmap_join *j ) {
2073  return add( { p, j } );
2074  }
2075 
2076  iterator add( const join &j ) {
2077  joins.push_front( j );
2078  auto it = joins.begin();
2079  [[maybe_unused]] const bool inserted = position_index.emplace( j.where, it ).second;
2080  cata_assert( inserted );
2081  return it;
2082  }
2083 
2084  void erase( const iterator it ) {
2085  [[maybe_unused]] const size_t erased = position_index.erase( it->where );
2086  cata_assert( erased );
2087  joins.erase( it );
2088  }
2089 
2090  void clear() {
2091  joins.clear();
2092  position_index.clear();
2093  }
2094  };
2095 
2096  void add_unresolved( const om_pos_dir &p, const mutable_overmap_join *j ) {
2097  iterator it = unresolved.add( p, j );
2098  unsigned priority = it->join->priority;
2099  if( unresolved_priority_index.size() <= priority ) {
2100  unresolved_priority_index.resize( priority + 1 );
2101  }
2102  [[maybe_unused]] const bool inserted = unresolved_priority_index[priority].insert( it ).second;
2103  cata_assert( inserted );
2104  }
2105 
2106  bool erase_unresolved( const om_pos_dir &p ) {
2107  auto pos_it = unresolved.position_index.find( p );
2108  if( pos_it == unresolved.position_index.end() ) {
2109  return false;
2110  }
2111  iterator it = pos_it->second;
2112  unsigned priority = it->join->priority;
2113  cata_assert( priority < unresolved_priority_index.size() );
2114  [[maybe_unused]] const size_t erased = unresolved_priority_index[priority].erase( it );
2115  cata_assert( erased );
2116  unresolved.erase( it );
2117  return true;
2118  }
2119 
2120  struct compare_iterators {
2121  bool operator()( iterator l, iterator r ) {
2122  return l->where < r->where;
2123  }
2124  };
2125 
2126  indexed_joins unresolved;
2127  std::vector<cata::flat_set<iterator, compare_iterators>> unresolved_priority_index;
2128 
2129  indexed_joins resolved;
2130  indexed_joins postponed;
2131 
2132  std::vector<std::pair<om_pos_dir, std::string>> used;
2133 };
2134 
2135 struct mutable_overmap_phase_remainder {
2136  std::vector<mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder> rules;
2137 
2138  struct satisfy_result {
2139  tripoint_om_omt origin;
2140  om_direction::type dir;
2141  mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder *rule;
2142  std::vector<om_pos_dir> suppressed_joins;
2143  // For debugging purposes it's really handy to have a record of exactly
2144  // what happened during placement of a mutable special when it fails,
2145  // so to aid that we provide a human-readable description here which is
2146  // only used in the event of a placement error.
2147  std::string description;
2148 
2149  explicit satisfy_result( const tripoint_om_omt origin, const om_direction::type dir,
2150  mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder *rule,
2151  std::vector<om_pos_dir> suppressed_joins, std::string description ) :
2152  origin( origin ), dir( dir ), rule( rule ),
2153  suppressed_joins( std::move( suppressed_joins ) ), description( std::move( description ) ) {}
2154  };
2155 
2156  bool all_rules_exhausted() const {
2157  return std::all_of( rules.begin(), rules.end(),
2158  []( const mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder & rule ) {
2159  return rule.is_exhausted();
2160  } );
2161  }
2162 
2163  struct can_place_result {
2164  int num_context_mandatory_joins_matched;
2165  int num_my_non_available_matched;
2166  std::vector<om_pos_dir> supressed_joins;
2167 
2168  std::pair<int, int> as_pair() const {
2169  return { num_context_mandatory_joins_matched, num_my_non_available_matched };
2170  }
2171 
2172  friend bool operator==( const can_place_result &l, const can_place_result &r ) {
2173  return l.as_pair() == r.as_pair();
2174  }
2175 
2176  friend bool operator<( const can_place_result &l, const can_place_result &r ) {
2177  return l.as_pair() < r.as_pair();
2178  }
2179  };
2180 
2181  std::optional<can_place_result> can_place(
2182  const overmap &om, const mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder &rule,
2183  const tripoint_om_omt &origin, om_direction::type dir,
2184  const joins_tracker &unresolved
2185  ) const {
2186  int context_mandatory_joins_shortfall = 0;
2187 
2188  for( const mutable_overmap_piece_candidate piece : rule.pieces( origin, dir ) ) {
2189  if( !overmap::inbounds( piece.pos ) ) {
2190  return std::nullopt;
2191  }
2192  if( !is_amongst_locations( om.ter( piece.pos ), piece.overmap->locations ) ) {
2193  return std::nullopt;
2194  }
2195  if( unresolved.any_postponed_at( piece.pos ) ) {
2196  return std::nullopt;
2197  }
2198  context_mandatory_joins_shortfall -= unresolved.count_unresolved_at( piece.pos );
2199  }
2200 
2201  int num_my_non_available_matched = 0;
2202 
2203  std::vector<om_pos_dir> suppressed_joins;
2204 
2205  for( const std::pair<om_pos_dir, const mutable_overmap_terrain_join *> p :
2206  rule.outward_joins( origin, dir ) ) {
2207  const om_pos_dir &pos_d = p.first;
2208  const mutable_overmap_terrain_join &ter_join = *p.second;
2209  const mutable_overmap_join &join = *ter_join.join;
2210  switch( unresolved.allows( pos_d, ter_join ) ) {
2211  case joins_tracker::join_status::disallowed:
2212  return std::nullopt;
2213  case joins_tracker::join_status::matched_non_available:
2214  ++context_mandatory_joins_shortfall;
2215  // fallthrough
2216  case joins_tracker::join_status::matched_available:
2217  if( ter_join.type != join_type::available ) {
2218  ++num_my_non_available_matched;
2219  }
2220  continue;
2221  case joins_tracker::join_status::mismatched_available:
2222  suppressed_joins.push_back( pos_d );
2223  case joins_tracker::join_status::free:
2224  break;
2225  }
2226  if( ter_join.type == join_type::available ) {
2227  continue;
2228  }
2229  // Verify that the remaining joins lead to
2230  // suitable locations
2231  tripoint_om_omt neighbour = pos_d.p + displace( pos_d.dir );
2232  if( !overmap::inbounds( neighbour ) ) {
2233  return std::nullopt;
2234  }
2235  const oter_id &neighbour_terrain = om.ter( neighbour );
2236  if( !is_amongst_locations( neighbour_terrain, join.into_locations ) ) {
2237  return std::nullopt;
2238  }
2239  }
2240  return can_place_result{ context_mandatory_joins_shortfall,
2241  num_my_non_available_matched, suppressed_joins };
2242  }
2243 
2244  satisfy_result satisfy( const overmap &om, const tripoint_om_omt &pos,
2245  const joins_tracker &unresolved ) {
2246  weighted_int_list<satisfy_result> options;
2247 
2248  for( mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder &rule : rules ) {
2249  std::vector<satisfy_result> pos_dir_options;
2250  can_place_result best_result{ 0, 0, {} };
2251 
2252  for( om_direction::type dir : om_direction::all ) {
2253  for( const tripoint_rel_omt &piece_pos : rule.positions( dir ) ) {
2254  tripoint_om_omt origin = pos - piece_pos;
2255 
2256  if( std::optional<can_place_result> result = can_place(
2257  om, rule, origin, dir, unresolved ) ) {
2258  if( best_result < *result ) {
2259  pos_dir_options.clear();
2260  best_result = *result;
2261  }
2262  if( *result == best_result ) {
2263  pos_dir_options.emplace_back( origin, dir, &rule, result.value().supressed_joins, std::string{} );
2264  }
2265  }
2266  }
2267  }
2268 
2269  if( auto chosen_result = random_entry_opt( pos_dir_options ) ) {
2270  options.add( *chosen_result, rule.get_weight() );
2271  }
2272  }
2273  std::string joins_s = enumerate_as_string( unresolved.all_unresolved_at( pos ),
2274  []( const joins_tracker::join * j ) {
2275  return string_format( "%s: %s", io::enum_to_string( j->where.dir ), j->join->id );
2276  } );
2277 
2278  if( satisfy_result *picked = options.pick() ) {
2279  om_direction::type dir = picked->dir;
2280  const mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder &rule = *picked->rule;
2281  picked->description =
2282  string_format(
2283  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-translate-string-literal)
2284  "At %s chose '%s' rot %d with neighbours N:%s E:%s S:%s W:%s and constraints "
2285  "%s",
2286  pos.to_string(), rule.description(), static_cast<int>( dir ),
2287  om.ter( pos + point_north ).id().str(), om.ter( pos + point_east ).id().str(),
2288  om.ter( pos + point_south ).id().str(), om.ter( pos + point_west ).id().str(),
2289  joins_s );
2290  picked->rule->decrement();
2291  return *picked;
2292  } else {
2293  std::string rules_s = enumerate_as_string( rules,
2294  []( const mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder & rule ) {
2295  if( rule.is_exhausted() ) {
2296  return string_format( "(%s)", rule.description() );
2297  } else {
2298  return rule.description();
2299  }
2300  } );
2301  std::string message =
2302  string_format(
2303  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-translate-string-literal)
2304  "At %s FAILED to match on terrain %s with neighbours N:%s E:%s S:%s W:%s and "
2305  "constraints %s from amongst rules %s",
2306  pos.to_string(), om.ter( pos ).id().str(),
2307  om.ter( pos + point_north ).id().str(), om.ter( pos + point_east ).id().str(),
2308  om.ter( pos + point_south ).id().str(), om.ter( pos + point_west ).id().str(),
2309  joins_s, rules_s );
2310  return satisfy_result{ {}, om_direction::type::invalid, nullptr, std::vector<om_pos_dir>{}, std::move( message ) };
2311  }
2312  }
2313 };
2314 
2315 struct mutable_overmap_phase {
2316  std::vector<mutable_overmap_placement_rule> rules;
2317 
2318  mutable_overmap_phase_remainder realise() const {
2319  std::vector<mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder> realised_rules;
2320  realised_rules.reserve( rules.size() );
2321  for( const mutable_overmap_placement_rule &rule : rules ) {
2322  realised_rules.push_back( rule.realise() );
2323  }
2324  return { realised_rules };
2325  }
2326 
2327  void deserialize( const JsonValue &jin ) {
2328  jin.read( rules, true );
2329  }
2330 };
2331 
2332 template<typename Tripoint>
2333 pos_dir<Tripoint> pos_dir<Tripoint>::opposite() const
2334 {
2335  switch( dir ) {
2336  case cube_direction::north:
2337  return { p + tripoint_north, cube_direction::south };
2338  case cube_direction::east:
2339  return { p + tripoint_east, cube_direction::west };
2340  case cube_direction::south:
2341  return { p + tripoint_south, cube_direction::north };
2342  case cube_direction::west:
2343  return { p + tripoint_west, cube_direction::east };
2344  case cube_direction::above:
2345  return { p + tripoint_above, cube_direction::below };
2346  case cube_direction::below:
2347  return { p + tripoint_below, cube_direction::above };
2348  case cube_direction::last:
2349  break;
2350  }
2351  cata_fatal( "Invalid cube_direction" );
2352 }
2353 
2354 template<typename Tripoint>
2355 void pos_dir<Tripoint>::serialize( JsonOut &jsout ) const
2356 {
2357  jsout.start_array();
2358  jsout.write( p );
2359  jsout.write( dir );
2360  jsout.end_array();
2361 }
2362 
2363 template<typename Tripoint>
2364 void pos_dir<Tripoint>::deserialize( const JsonArray &ja )
2365 {
2366  if( ja.size() != 2 ) {
2367  ja.throw_error( "Expected array of size 2" );
2368  }
2369  ja.read( 0, p );
2370  ja.read( 1, dir );
2371 }
2372 
2373 template<typename Tripoint>
2374 bool pos_dir<Tripoint>::operator==( const pos_dir<Tripoint> &r ) const
2375 {
2376  return p == r.p && dir == r.dir;
2377 }
2378 
2379 template<typename Tripoint>
2380 bool pos_dir<Tripoint>::operator<( const pos_dir<Tripoint> &r ) const
2381 {
2382  return std::tie( p, dir ) < std::tie( r.p, r.dir );
2383 }
2384 
2385 template struct pos_dir<tripoint_om_omt>;
2386 template struct pos_dir<tripoint_rel_omt>;
2387 
2388 struct mutable_overmap_special_data : overmap_special_data {
2389  overmap_special_id parent_id;
2390  std::vector<overmap_special_locations> check_for_locations;
2391  std::vector<overmap_special_locations> check_for_locations_area;
2392  std::vector<mutable_overmap_join> joins_vec;
2393  std::unordered_map<std::string, mutable_overmap_join *> joins;
2394  std::unordered_map<std::string, mutable_overmap_terrain> overmaps;
2395  std::string root;
2396  std::vector<mutable_overmap_phase> phases;
2397 
2398  explicit mutable_overmap_special_data( const overmap_special_id &p_id )
2399  : parent_id( p_id )
2400  {}
2401 
2402  void finalize( const std::string &context,
2403  const cata::flat_set<string_id<overmap_location>> &default_locations ) override {
2404  if( check_for_locations.empty() ) {
2405  check_for_locations.push_back( root_as_overmap_special_terrain() );
2406  }
2407  for( size_t i = 0; i != joins_vec.size(); ++i ) {
2408  mutable_overmap_join &join = joins_vec[i];
2409  if( join.into_locations.empty() ) {
2410  join.into_locations = default_locations;
2411  }
2412  join.priority = i;
2413  joins.emplace( join.id, &join );
2414  }
2415  for( mutable_overmap_join &join : joins_vec ) {
2416  if( join.opposite_id.empty() ) {
2417  join.opposite_id = join.id;
2418  join.opposite = &join;
2419  continue;
2420  }
2421  auto opposite_it = joins.find( join.opposite_id );
2422  if( opposite_it == joins.end() ) {
2423  // Error reported later in check()
2424  continue;
2425  }
2426  join.opposite = opposite_it->second;
2427  }
2428  for( std::pair<const std::string, mutable_overmap_terrain> &p : overmaps ) {
2429  mutable_overmap_terrain &ter = p.second;
2430  ter.finalize( string_format( "overmap %s in %s", p.first, context ), joins,
2431  default_locations );
2432  }
2433  for( mutable_overmap_phase &phase : phases ) {
2434  for( mutable_overmap_placement_rule &rule : phase.rules ) {
2435  rule.finalize( context, overmaps );
2436  }
2437  }
2438  }
2439 
2440  void finalize_mapgen_parameters(
2441  mapgen_parameters &params, const std::string &context ) const override {
2442  for( const std::pair<const std::string, mutable_overmap_terrain> &p : overmaps ) {
2443  const mutable_overmap_terrain &t = p.second;
2444  std::string mapgen_id = t.terrain->get_mapgen_id();
2445  params.check_and_merge( get_map_special_params( mapgen_id ), context );
2446  }
2447  }
2448 
2449  void check( const std::string &context ) const override {
2450  if( joins_vec.size() != joins.size() ) {
2451  debugmsg( "duplicate join id in %s", context );
2452  }
2453  for( const mutable_overmap_join &join : joins_vec ) {
2454  if( join.opposite ) {
2455  if( join.opposite->opposite_id != join.id ) {
2456  debugmsg( "in %1$s: join id %2$s specifies its opposite to be %3$s, but "
2457  "the opposite of %3$s is %4$s, when it should match the "
2458  "original id %2$s",
2459  context, join.id, join.opposite_id, join.opposite->opposite_id );
2460  }
2461  } else {
2462  debugmsg( "in %s: join id '%s' specified as opposite of '%s' not valid",
2463  context, join.opposite_id, join.id );
2464  }
2465  }
2466  for( const std::pair<const std::string, mutable_overmap_terrain> &p : overmaps ) {
2467  const mutable_overmap_terrain &ter = p.second;
2468  ter.check( string_format( "overmap %s in %s", p.first, context ) );
2469  }
2470  if( !overmaps.count( root ) ) {
2471  debugmsg( "root %s is not amongst the defined overmaps for %s", root, context );
2472  }
2473  for( const mutable_overmap_phase &phase : phases ) {
2474  for( const mutable_overmap_placement_rule &rule : phase.rules ) {
2475  rule.check( context );
2476  }
2477  }
2478  }
2479 
2480  overmap_special_terrain root_as_overmap_special_terrain() const {
2481  auto it = overmaps.find( root );
2482  if( it == overmaps.end() ) {
2483  debugmsg( "root '%s' is not an overmap in this special", root );
2484  return {};
2485  }
2486  const mutable_overmap_terrain &root_om = it->second;
2487  return { tripoint_zero, root_om.terrain, root_om.locations, {} };
2488  }
2489 
2490  std::vector<overmap_special_terrain> preview_terrains() const override {
2491  return std::vector<overmap_special_terrain> { root_as_overmap_special_terrain() };
2492  }
2493 
2494  std::vector<overmap_special_locations> required_locations() const override {
2495  return check_for_locations;
2496  }
2497 
2498  int score_rotation_at( const overmap &, const tripoint_om_omt &,
2499  om_direction::type ) const override {
2500  // TODO: worry about connections for mutable specials
2501  // For now we just allow all rotations, but will be restricted by
2502  // can_place_special
2503  return 0;
2504  }
2505 
2506  // Returns a list of the points placed and a list of the joins used
2507  special_placement_result place(
2508  overmap &om, const tripoint_om_omt &origin, om_direction::type dir, bool /*blob*/,
2509  const city &cit, bool must_be_unexplored ) const override {
2510  // TODO: respect must_be_unexplored
2511  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> result;
2512 
2513  auto it = overmaps.find( root );
2514  if( it == overmaps.end() ) {
2515  debugmsg( "Invalid root %s", root );
2516  return { result, {} };
2517  }
2518 
2519  joins_tracker unresolved;
2520 
2521  struct placed_connection {
2522  overmap_connection_id connection;
2523  pos_dir<tripoint_om_omt> where;
2524  };
2525 
2526  std::vector<placed_connection> connections_placed;
2527 
2528  // This is for debugging only, it tracks a human-readable description
2529  // of what happened to be put in the debugmsg in the event of failure.
2530  std::vector<std::string> descriptions;
2531 
2532  // Helper function to add a particular mutable_overmap_terrain at a
2533  // particular place.
2534  auto add_ter = [&](
2535  const mutable_overmap_terrain & ter, const tripoint_om_omt & pos,
2536  om_direction::type rot, const std::vector<om_pos_dir> &suppressed_joins ) {
2537  const oter_id tid = ter.terrain->get_rotated( rot );
2538  om.ter_set( pos, tid );
2539  unresolved.add_joins_for( ter, pos, rot, suppressed_joins );
2540  result.push_back( pos );
2541 
2542  // Accumulate connections to be dealt with later
2543  for( const std::pair<const cube_direction, mutable_special_connection> &p :
2544  ter.connections ) {
2545  cube_direction base_dir = p.first;
2546  const mutable_special_connection &conn = p.second;
2547  cube_direction dir = base_dir + rot;
2548  tripoint_om_omt conn_pos = pos + displace( dir );
2549  if( overmap::inbounds( conn_pos ) ) {
2550  connections_placed.push_back( { conn.connection, { conn_pos, dir } } );
2551  }
2552  }
2553  };
2554 
2555  const mutable_overmap_terrain &root_omt = it->second;
2556  add_ter( root_omt, origin, dir, {} );
2557 
2558  auto current_phase = phases.begin();
