2559  mutable_overmap_phase_remainder phase_remaining = current_phase->realise();
2560 
2561  while( unresolved.any_unresolved() ) {
2562  tripoint_om_omt next_pos = unresolved.pick_top_priority();
2563  mutable_overmap_phase_remainder::satisfy_result satisfy_result =
2564  phase_remaining.satisfy( om, next_pos, unresolved );
2565  descriptions.push_back( std::move( satisfy_result.description ) );
2566  const mutable_overmap_placement_rule_remainder *rule = satisfy_result.rule;
2567  if( rule ) {
2568  const tripoint_om_omt &satisfy_origin = satisfy_result.origin;
2569  om_direction::type rot = satisfy_result.dir;
2570  for( const mutable_overmap_piece_candidate piece : rule->pieces( satisfy_origin, rot ) ) {
2571  const mutable_overmap_terrain &ter = *piece.overmap;
2572  add_ter( ter, piece.pos, piece.rot, satisfy_result.suppressed_joins );
2573  }
2574  } else {
2575  unresolved.postpone( next_pos );
2576  }
2577  if( !unresolved.any_unresolved() || phase_remaining.all_rules_exhausted() ) {
2578  ++current_phase;
2579  if( current_phase == phases.end() ) {
2580  break;
2581  }
2582  descriptions.push_back(
2583  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-translate-string-literal)
2584  string_format( "## Entering phase %td", current_phase - phases.begin() ) );
2585  phase_remaining = current_phase->realise();
2586  unresolved.restore_postponed();
2587  }
2588  }
2589 
2590  if( unresolved.any_postponed() ) {
2591  // This is an error in the JSON; extract some useful info to help
2592  // the user debug it
2593  unresolved.restore_postponed();
2594  tripoint_om_omt p = unresolved.pick_top_priority();
2595 
2596  const oter_id &current_terrain = om.ter( p );
2597  std::string joins = enumerate_as_string( unresolved.all_unresolved_at( p ),
2598  []( const joins_tracker::join * dir_join ) {
2599  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-translate-string-literal)
2600  return string_format( "%s: %s", io::enum_to_string( dir_join->where.dir ),
2601  dir_join->join->id );
2602  } );
2603 
2604  debugmsg( "Spawn of mutable special %s had unresolved joins. Existing terrain "
2605  "at %s was %s; joins were %s\nComplete record of placement follows:\n%s",
2606  parent_id.str(), p.to_string(), current_terrain.id().str(), joins,
2607  string_join( descriptions, "\n" ) );
2608 
2609  om.add_note(
2610  p, string_format(
2611  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(cata-translate-string-literal)
2612  "U:R;DEBUG: unresolved joins %s at %s placing %s",
2613  joins, p.to_string(), parent_id.str() ) );
2614  }
2615 
2616  // Deal with connections
2617  for( const placed_connection &elem : connections_placed ) {
2618  const tripoint_om_omt &pos = elem.where.p;
2619  cube_direction connection_dir = elem.where.dir;
2620 
2621  if( cit ) {
2622  om.build_connection( cit.pos, pos.xy(), pos.z(), *elem.connection,
2623  must_be_unexplored, connection_dir );
2624  }
2625  // if no city present, search for nearby road within 50 tiles and make connection to it instead
2626  else {
2627  for( const tripoint_om_omt &nearby_point : closest_points_first( pos, 50 ) ) {
2628  if( om.check_ot( "road", ot_match_type::contains, nearby_point ) ) {
2629  om.build_connection(
2630  nearby_point.xy(), pos.xy(), pos.z(), *elem.connection,
2631  must_be_unexplored, connection_dir );
2632  }
2633  }
2634  }
2635  }
2636 
2637  return { result, unresolved.all_used() };
2638  }
2639 };
2640 
2641 overmap_special::overmap_special( const overmap_special_id &i, const overmap_special_terrain &ter )
2642  : id( i )
2643  , subtype_( overmap_special_subtype::fixed )
2644  , data_{ make_shared_fast<fixed_overmap_special_data>( ter ) }
2645 {}
2646 
2647 bool overmap_special::can_spawn() const
2648 {
2649  if( get_constraints().occurrences.empty() ) {
2650  return false;
2651  }
2652 
2653  const int city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
2654  return city_size != 0 || get_constraints().city_size.min <= city_size;
2655 }
2656 
2657 bool overmap_special::requires_city() const
2658 {
2659  return constraints_.city_size.min > 0 ||
2660  constraints_.city_distance.max < std::max( OMAPX, OMAPY );
2661 }
2662 
2663 bool overmap_special::can_belong_to_city( const tripoint_om_omt &p, const city &cit ) const
2664 {
2665  if( !requires_city() ) {
2666  return true;
2667  }
2668  if( !cit || !constraints_.city_size.contains( cit.size ) ) {
2669  return false;
2670  }
2671  return constraints_.city_distance.contains( cit.get_distance_from( p ) - ( cit.size ) );
2672 }
2673 
2674 bool overmap_special::has_flag( const std::string &flag ) const
2675 {
2676  return flags_.count( flag );
2677 }
2678 
2679 int overmap_special::longest_side() const
2680 {
2681  // Figure out the longest side of the special for purposes of determining our sector size
2682  // when attempting placements.
2683  std::vector<overmap_special_locations> req_locations = required_locations();
2684  auto min_max_x = std::minmax_element( req_locations.begin(), req_locations.end(),
2685  []( const overmap_special_locations & lhs, const overmap_special_locations & rhs ) {
2686  return lhs.p.x < rhs.p.x;
2687  } );
2688 
2689  auto min_max_y = std::minmax_element( req_locations.begin(), req_locations.end(),
2690  []( const overmap_special_locations & lhs, const overmap_special_locations & rhs ) {
2691  return lhs.p.y < rhs.p.y;
2692  } );
2693 
2694  const int width = min_max_x.second->p.x - min_max_x.first->p.x;
2695  const int height = min_max_y.second->p.y - min_max_y.first->p.y;
2696  return std::max( width, height ) + 1;
2697 }
2698 
2699 std::vector<overmap_special_terrain> overmap_special::preview_terrains() const
2700 {
2701  return data_->preview_terrains();
2702 }
2703 
2704 std::vector<overmap_special_locations> overmap_special::required_locations() const
2705 {
2706  return data_->required_locations();
2707 }
2708 
2709 int overmap_special::score_rotation_at( const overmap &om, const tripoint_om_omt &p,
2710  om_direction::type r ) const
2711 {
2712  return data_->score_rotation_at( om, p, r );
2713 }
2714 
2715 special_placement_result overmap_special::place(
2716  overmap &om, const tripoint_om_omt &origin, om_direction::type dir,
2717  const city &cit, bool must_be_unexplored ) const
2718 {
2719  if( has_eoc() ) {
2720  dialogue d( get_talker_for( get_avatar() ), nullptr );
2721  get_eoc()->apply_true_effects( d );
2722  }
2723  const bool blob = has_flag( "BLOB" );
2724  return data_->place( om, origin, dir, blob, cit, must_be_unexplored );
2725 }
2726 
2727 void overmap_special::force_one_occurrence()
2728 {
2729  constraints_.occurrences.min = 1;
2730  constraints_.occurrences.max = 1;
2731 }
2732 
2733 mapgen_arguments overmap_special::get_args( const mapgendata &md ) const
2734 {
2735  return mapgen_params_.get_args( md, mapgen_parameter_scope::overmap_special );
2736 }
2737 
2738 void overmap_special::load( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string &src )
2739 {
2740  const bool strict = src == "dda";
2741  // city_building is just an alias of overmap_special
2742  // TODO: This comparison is a hack. Separate them properly.
2743  const bool is_special = jo.get_string( "type", "" ) == "overmap_special";
2744 
2745  optional( jo, was_loaded, "subtype", subtype_, overmap_special_subtype::fixed );
2746  optional( jo, was_loaded, "locations", default_locations_ );
2747  if( jo.has_member( "eoc" ) ) {
2748  eoc = effect_on_conditions::load_inline_eoc( jo.get_member( "eoc" ), src );
2749  has_eoc_ = true;
2750  }
2751  switch( subtype_ ) {
2752  case overmap_special_subtype::fixed: {
2753  shared_ptr_fast<fixed_overmap_special_data> fixed_data =
2754  make_shared_fast<fixed_overmap_special_data>();
2755  optional( jo, was_loaded, "overmaps", fixed_data->terrains );
2756  if( is_special ) {
2757  optional( jo, was_loaded, "connections", fixed_data->connections );
2758  }
2759  data_ = std::move( fixed_data );
2760  break;
2761  }
2762  case overmap_special_subtype::mutable_: {
2763  shared_ptr_fast<mutable_overmap_special_data> mutable_data =
2764  make_shared_fast<mutable_overmap_special_data>( id );
2765  std::vector<overmap_special_locations> check_for_locations_merged_data;
2766  optional( jo, was_loaded, "check_for_locations", check_for_locations_merged_data );
2767  if( jo.has_array( "check_for_locations_area" ) ) {
2768  JsonArray jar = jo.get_array( "check_for_locations_area" );
2769  while( jar.has_more() ) {
2770  JsonObject joc = jar.next_object();
2771 
2772  cata::flat_set<string_id<overmap_location>> type;
2773  tripoint from;
2774  tripoint to;
2775  mandatory( joc, was_loaded, "type", type );
2776  mandatory( joc, was_loaded, "from", from );
2777  mandatory( joc, was_loaded, "to", to );
2778  if( from.x > to.x ) {
2779  std::swap( from.x, to.x );
2780  }
2781  if( from.y > to.y ) {
2782  std::swap( from.y, to.y );
2783  }
2784  if( from.z > to.z ) {
2785  std::swap( from.z, to.z );
2786  }
2787  for( int x = from.x; x <= to.x; x++ ) {
2788  for( int y = from.y; y <= to.y; y++ ) {
2789  for( int z = from.z; z <= to.z; z++ ) {
2790  overmap_special_locations loc;
2791  loc.p = tripoint( x, y, z );
2792  loc.locations = type;
2793  check_for_locations_merged_data.push_back( loc );
2794  }
2795  }
2796  }
2797  }
2798  }
2799  mutable_data->check_for_locations = check_for_locations_merged_data;
2800  mandatory( jo, was_loaded, "joins", mutable_data->joins_vec );
2801  mandatory( jo, was_loaded, "overmaps", mutable_data->overmaps );
2802  mandatory( jo, was_loaded, "root", mutable_data->root );
2803  mandatory( jo, was_loaded, "phases", mutable_data->phases );
2804  data_ = std::move( mutable_data );
2805  break;
2806  }
2807  default:
2808  jo.throw_error( string_format( "subtype %s not implemented",
2809  io::enum_to_string( subtype_ ) ) );
2810  }
2811 
2812  assign( jo, "city_sizes", constraints_.city_size, strict );
2813 
2814  if( is_special ) {
2815  mandatory( jo, was_loaded, "occurrences", constraints_.occurrences );
2816  assign( jo, "city_distance", constraints_.city_distance, strict );
2817  assign( jo, "priority", priority_, strict );
2818  }
2819 
2820  assign( jo, "spawns", monster_spawns_, strict );
2821 
2822  assign( jo, "rotate", rotatable_, strict );
2823  assign( jo, "flags", flags_, strict );
2824 }
2825 
2826 void overmap_special::finalize()
2827 {
2828  const_cast<overmap_special_data &>( *data_ ).finalize(
2829  "overmap special " + id.str(), default_locations_ );
2830 }
2831 
2832 void overmap_special::finalize_mapgen_parameters()
2833 {
2834  // Extract all the map_special-scoped params from the constituent terrains
2835  // and put them here
2836  std::string context = string_format( "overmap_special %s", id.str() );
2837  data_->finalize_mapgen_parameters( mapgen_params_, context );
2838 }
2839 
2840 void overmap_special::check() const
2841 {
2842  data_->check( string_format( "overmap special %s", id.str() ) );
2843 }
2844 
2845 // *** BEGIN overmap FUNCTIONS ***
2846 overmap::overmap( const point_abs_om &p ) : loc( p )
2847 {
2848  const std::string rsettings_id = get_option<std::string>( "DEFAULT_REGION" );
2849  t_regional_settings_map_citr rsit = region_settings_map.find( rsettings_id );
2850 
2851  if( rsit == region_settings_map.end() ) {
2852  debugmsg( "overmap%s: can't find region '%s'", p.to_string(),
2853  rsettings_id.c_str() ); // gonna die now =[
2854  }
2855  settings = &rsit->second;
2856 
2857  init_layers();
2858 }
2859 
2860 overmap::~overmap() = default;
2861 
2862 void overmap::populate( overmap_special_batch &enabled_specials )
2863 {
2864  try {
2865  open( enabled_specials );
2866  } catch( const std::exception &err ) {
2867  debugmsg( "overmap (%d,%d) failed to load: %s", loc.x(), loc.y(), err.what() );
2868  }
2869 }
2870 
2871 void overmap::populate()
2872 {
2873  overmap_special_batch enabled_specials = overmap_specials::get_default_batch( loc );
2874  const overmap_feature_flag_settings &overmap_feature_flag = settings->overmap_feature_flag;
2875 
2876  const bool should_blacklist = !overmap_feature_flag.blacklist.empty();
2877  const bool should_whitelist = !overmap_feature_flag.whitelist.empty();
2878 
2879  // If this region's settings has blacklisted or whitelisted overmap feature flags, let's
2880  // filter our default batch.
2881 
2882  // Remove any items that have a flag that is present in the blacklist.
2883  if( should_blacklist ) {
2884  for( auto it = enabled_specials.begin(); it != enabled_specials.end(); ) {
2885  if( cata::sets_intersect( overmap_feature_flag.blacklist,
2886  it->special_details->get_flags() ) ) {
2887  it = enabled_specials.erase( it );
2888  } else {
2889  ++it;
2890  }
2891  }
2892  }
2893 
2894  // Remove any items which do not have any of the flags from the whitelist.
2895  if( should_whitelist ) {
2896  for( auto it = enabled_specials.begin(); it != enabled_specials.end(); ) {
2897  if( cata::sets_intersect( overmap_feature_flag.whitelist,
2898  it->special_details->get_flags() ) ) {
2899  ++it;
2900  } else {
2901  it = enabled_specials.erase( it );
2902  }
2903  }
2904  }
2905 
2906  populate( enabled_specials );
2907 }
2908 
2909 oter_id overmap::get_default_terrain( int z ) const
2910 {
2911  return settings->default_oter[OVERMAP_DEPTH + z].id();
2912 }
2913 
2914 void overmap::init_layers()
2915 {
2916  for( int k = 0; k < OVERMAP_LAYERS; ++k ) {
2917  const oter_id tid = get_default_terrain( k - OVERMAP_DEPTH );
2918  map_layer &l = layer[k];
2919  l.terrain.fill( tid );
2920  l.visible.fill( false );
2921  l.explored.fill( false );
2922  }
2923 }
2924 
2925 void overmap::ter_set( const tripoint_om_omt &p, const oter_id &id )
2926 {
2927  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
2928  /// TODO: Add a debug message reporting this, but currently there are way too many place that would trigger it.
2929  return;
2930  }
2931 
2932  oter_id &current_oter = layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].terrain[p.xy()];
2933  const oter_type_str_id &current_type_id = current_oter->get_type_id();
2934  const oter_type_str_id &incoming_type_id = id->get_type_id();
2935  const bool current_type_same = current_type_id == incoming_type_id;
2936 
2937  // Mapgen refinement can push multiple different roads over each other.
2938  // Roads require a predecessor. A road pushed over a road might cause a
2939  // road to be a predecessor to another road. That causes too many spawns
2940  // to happen. So when pushing a predecessor, if the predecessor to-be-pushed
2941  // is linear and the previous predecessor is linear, overwrite it.
2942  // This way only the 'last' rotation/variation generated is kept.
2943  if( id->has_flag( oter_flags::requires_predecessor ) ) {
2944  std::vector<oter_id> &om_predecessors = predecessors_[p];
2945  if( om_predecessors.empty() || ( !current_oter->is_linear() && !current_type_same ) ) {
2946  // If we need a predecessor, we must have a predecessor no matter what.
2947  // Or, if the oter to-be-pushed is not linear, push it only if the incoming oter is different.
2948  om_predecessors.push_back( current_oter );
2949  } else if( !current_type_same ) {
2950  // Current oter is linear, incoming oter is different from current.
2951  // If the last predecessor is the same type as the current type, overwrite.
2952  // Else push the current type.
2953  oter_id &last_predecessor = om_predecessors.back();
2954  if( last_predecessor->get_type_id() == current_type_id ) {
2955  last_predecessor = current_oter;
2956  } else {
2957  om_predecessors.push_back( current_oter );
2958  }
2959  }
2960  // We had a predecessor, and it was the same type as the incoming one
2961  // Don't push another copy.
2962  }
2963  current_oter = id;
2964 }
2965 
2966 const oter_id &overmap::ter( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
2967 {
2968  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
2969  /// TODO: Add a debug message reporting this, but currently there are way too many place that would trigger it.
2970  return ot_null;
2971  }
2972 
2973  return ter_unsafe( p );
2974 }
2975 
2976 const oter_id &overmap::ter_unsafe( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
2977 {
2978  return layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].terrain[p.xy()];
2979 }
2980 
2981 std::optional<mapgen_arguments> *overmap::mapgen_args( const tripoint_om_omt &p )
2982 {
2983  auto it = mapgen_args_index.find( p );
2984  if( it == mapgen_args_index.end() ) {
2985  return nullptr;
2986  }
2987  return it->second;
2988 }
2989 
2990 std::string *overmap::join_used_at( const om_pos_dir &p )
2991 {
2992  auto it = joins_used.find( p );
2993  if( it == joins_used.end() ) {
2994  return nullptr;
2995  }
2996  return &it->second;
2997 }
2998 
2999 std::vector<oter_id> overmap::predecessors( const tripoint_om_omt &p )
3000 {
3001  auto it = predecessors_.find( p );
3002  if( it == predecessors_.end() ) {
3003  return {};
3004  }
3005  return it->second;
3006 }
3007 
3008 void overmap::set_seen( const tripoint_om_omt &p, bool val )
3009 {
3010  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
3011  return;
3012  }
3013 
3014  if( seen( p ) == val ) {
3015  return;
3016  }
3017 
3018  layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].visible[p.xy()] = val;
3019 
3020  if( val ) {
3021  add_extra_note( p );
3022  }
3023 }
3024 
3025 bool overmap::seen( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
3026 {
3027  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
3028  return false;
3029  }
3030  return layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].visible[p.xy()];
3031 }
3032 
3033 bool &overmap::explored( const tripoint_om_omt &p )
3034 {
3035  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
3036  nullbool = false;
3037  return nullbool;
3038  }
3039  return layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].explored[p.xy()];
3040 }
3041 
3042 bool overmap::is_explored( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
3043 {
3044  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
3045  return false;
3046  }
3047  return layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].explored[p.xy()];
3048 }
3049 
3050 bool overmap::mongroup_check( const mongroup &candidate ) const
3051 {
3052  tripoint_om_sm relp = candidate.rel_pos();
3053  const auto matching_range = zg.equal_range( relp );
3054  return std::find_if( matching_range.first, matching_range.second,
3055  [candidate]( const std::pair<tripoint_om_sm, mongroup> &match ) {
3056  // This is extra strict since we're using it to test serialization.
3057  return candidate.type == match.second.type && candidate.abs_pos == match.second.abs_pos &&
3058  candidate.population == match.second.population &&
3059  candidate.target == match.second.target &&
3060  candidate.interest == match.second.interest &&
3061  candidate.dying == match.second.dying &&
3062  candidate.horde == match.second.horde;
3063  } ) != matching_range.second;
3064 }
3065 
3066 bool overmap::monster_check( const std::pair<tripoint_om_sm, monster> &candidate ) const
3067 {
3068  const auto matching_range = monster_map.equal_range( candidate.first );
3069  return std::find_if( matching_range.first, matching_range.second,
3070  [candidate]( const std::pair<tripoint_om_sm, monster> &match ) {
3071  return candidate.second.pos() == match.second.pos() &&
3072  candidate.second.type == match.second.type;
3073  } ) != matching_range.second;
3074 }
3075 
3076 void overmap::insert_npc( const shared_ptr_fast<npc> &who )
3077 {
3078  npcs.push_back( who );
3079  g->set_npcs_dirty();
3080 }
3081 
3082 shared_ptr_fast<npc> overmap::erase_npc( const character_id &id )
3083 {
3084  const auto iter = std::find_if( npcs.begin(),
3085  npcs.end(), [id]( const shared_ptr_fast<npc> &n ) {
3086  return n->getID() == id;
3087  } );
3088  if( iter == npcs.end() ) {
3089  return nullptr;
3090  }
3091  auto ptr = *iter;
3092  npcs.erase( iter );
3093  g->set_npcs_dirty();
3094  return ptr;
3095 }
3096 
3097 std::vector<shared_ptr_fast<npc>> overmap::get_npcs( const
3098  std::function<bool( const npc & )>
3099  &predicate ) const
3100 {
3101  std::vector<shared_ptr_fast<npc>> result;
3102  for( const auto &g : npcs ) {
3103  if( predicate( *g ) ) {
3104  result.push_back( g );
3105  }
3106  }
3107  return result;
3108 }
3109 
3110 bool overmap::has_note( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
3111 {
3112  if( p.z() < -OVERMAP_DEPTH || p.z() > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
3113  return false;
3114  }
3115 
3116  for( const om_note &i : layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].notes ) {
3117  if( i.p == p.xy() ) {
3118  return true;
3119  }
3120  }
3121  return false;
3122 }
3123 
3124 bool overmap::is_marked_dangerous( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
3125 {
3126  for( const om_note &i : layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].notes ) {
3127  if( !i.dangerous ) {
3128  continue;
3129  } else if( p.xy() == i.p ) {
3130  return true;
3131  }
3132  const int radius = i.danger_radius;
3133  if( i.danger_radius == 0 && i.p != p.xy() ) {
3134  continue;
3135  }
3136 
3137  int dist = rl_dist( i.p, p.xy() );
3138  if( dist <= radius ) {
3139  return true;
3140  }
3141  }
3142  return false;
3143 }
3144 
3145 const std::string &overmap::note( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
3146 {
3147  static const std::string fallback {};
3148 
3149  if( p.z() < -OVERMAP_DEPTH || p.z() > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
3150  return fallback;
3151  }
3152 
3153  const auto &notes = layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].notes;
3154  const auto it = std::find_if( begin( notes ), end( notes ), [&]( const om_note & n ) {
3155  return n.p == p.xy();
3156  } );
3157 
3158  return ( it != std::end( notes ) ) ? it->text : fallback;
3159 }
3160 
3161 void overmap::add_note( const tripoint_om_omt &p, std::string message )
3162 {
3163  if( p.z() < -OVERMAP_DEPTH || p.z() > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
3164  debugmsg( "Attempting to add not to overmap for blank layer %d", p.z() );
3165  return;
3166  }
3167 
3168  auto &notes = layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].notes;
3169  const auto it = std::find_if( begin( notes ), end( notes ), [&]( const om_note & n ) {
3170  return n.p == p.xy();
3171  } );
3172 
3173  if( it == std::end( notes ) ) {
3174  notes.emplace_back( om_note{ std::move( message ), p.xy() } );
3175  } else if( !message.empty() ) {
3176  it->text = std::move( message );
3177  } else {
3178  notes.erase( it );
3179  }
3180 }
3181 
3182 void overmap::mark_note_dangerous( const tripoint_om_omt &p, int radius, bool is_dangerous )
3183 {
3184  for( om_note &i : layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].notes ) {
3185  if( p.xy() == i.p ) {
3186  i.dangerous = is_dangerous;
3187  i.danger_radius = radius;
3188  return;
3189  }
3190  }
3191 }
3192 
3193 int overmap::note_danger_radius( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
3194 {
3195  if( p.z() < -OVERMAP_DEPTH || p.z() > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
3196  return -1;
3197  }
3198 
3199  const auto &notes = layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].notes;
3200  const auto it = std::find_if( begin( notes ), end( notes ), [&]( const om_note & n ) {
3201  return n.p == p.xy();
3202  } );
3203 
3204  return ( it != std::end( notes ) ) && it->dangerous ? it->danger_radius : -1;
3205 }
3206 
3207 void overmap::delete_note( const tripoint_om_omt &p )
3208 {
3209  add_note( p, std::string{} );
3210 }
3211 
3212 std::vector<point_abs_omt> overmap::find_notes( const int z, const std::string &text )
3213 {
3214  std::vector<point_abs_omt> note_locations;
3215  map_layer &this_layer = layer[z + OVERMAP_DEPTH];
3216  for( const om_note &note : this_layer.notes ) {
3217  if( match_include_exclude( note.text, text ) ) {
3218  note_locations.push_back( project_combine( pos(), note.p ) );
3219  }
3220  }
3221  return note_locations;
3222 }
3223 
3224 bool overmap::has_extra( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
3225 {
3226  if( p.z() < -OVERMAP_DEPTH || p.z() > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
3227  return false;
3228  }
3229 
3230  for( const om_map_extra &i : layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].extras ) {
3231  if( i.p == p.xy() ) {
3232  return true;
3233  }
3234  }
3235  return false;
3236 }
3237 
3238 const map_extra_id &overmap::extra( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
3239 {
3240  static const map_extra_id fallback{};
3241 
3242  if( p.z() < -OVERMAP_DEPTH || p.z() > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
3243  return fallback;
3244  }
3245 
3246  const auto &extras = layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].extras;
3247  const auto it = std::find_if( begin( extras ),
3248  end( extras ), [&]( const om_map_extra & n ) {
3249  return n.p == p.xy();
3250  } );
3251 
3252  return ( it != std::end( extras ) ) ? it->id : fallback;
3253 }
3254 
3255 void overmap::add_extra( const tripoint_om_omt &p, const map_extra_id &id )
3256 {
3257  if( p.z() < -OVERMAP_DEPTH || p.z() > OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) {
3258  debugmsg( "Attempting to add not to overmap for blank layer %d", p.z() );
3259  return;
3260  }
3261 
3262  auto &extras = layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].extras;
3263  const auto it = std::find_if( begin( extras ),
3264  end( extras ), [&]( const om_map_extra & n ) {
3265  return n.p == p.xy();
3266  } );
3267 
3268  if( it == std::end( extras ) ) {
3269  extras.emplace_back( om_map_extra{ id, p.xy() } );
3270  add_extra_note( p );
3271  } else if( !id.is_null() ) {
3272  it->id = id;
3273  add_extra_note( p );
3274  } else {
3275  extras.erase( it );
3276  }
3277 }
3278 
3279 void overmap::add_extra_note( const tripoint_om_omt &p )
3280 {
3281  if( !seen( p ) ) {
3282  return;
3283  }
3284 
3285  const std::vector<om_map_extra> &layer_extras = layer[p.z() + OVERMAP_DEPTH].extras;
3286  auto extrait = std::find_if( layer_extras.begin(),
3287  layer_extras.end(), [&p]( const om_map_extra & extra ) {
3288  return extra.p == p.xy();
3289  } );
3290  if( extrait == layer_extras.end() ) {
3291  return;
3292  }
3293  const map_extra_id &extra = extrait->id;
3294 
3295  auto_notes::auto_note_settings &auto_note_settings = get_auto_notes_settings();
3296 
3297  // The player has discovered a map extra of this type.
3298  auto_note_settings.set_discovered( extra );
3299 
3300  if( get_option<bool>( "AUTO_NOTES" ) && get_option<bool>( "AUTO_NOTES_MAP_EXTRAS" ) ) {
3301  // Only place note if the user has not disabled it via the auto note manager
3302  if( !auto_note_settings.has_auto_note_enabled( extra, true ) ) {
3303  return;
3304  }
3305 
3306  const std::optional<auto_notes::custom_symbol> &symbol =
3307  auto_note_settings.get_custom_symbol( extra );
3308  const std::string note_symbol = symbol ? ( *symbol ).get_symbol_string() : extra->get_symbol();
3309  const nc_color note_color = symbol ? ( *symbol ).get_color() : extra->color;
3310  const std::string mx_note =
3311  string_format( "%s:%s;<color_yellow>%s</color>: <color_white>%s</color>",
3312  note_symbol,
3313  get_note_string_from_color( note_color ),
3314  extra->name(),
3315  extra->description() );
3316  add_note( p, mx_note );
3317  }
3318 }
3319 
3320 void overmap::delete_extra( const tripoint_om_omt &p )
3321 {
3322  add_extra( p, map_extra_id::NULL_ID() );
3323 }
3324 
3325 std::vector<point_abs_omt> overmap::find_extras( const int z, const std::string &text )
3326 {
3327  std::vector<point_abs_omt> extra_locations;
3328  map_layer &this_layer = layer[z + OVERMAP_DEPTH];
3329  for( const om_map_extra &extra : this_layer.extras ) {
3330  const std::string extra_text = extra.id.c_str();
3331  if( match_include_exclude( extra_text, text ) ) {
3332  extra_locations.push_back( project_combine( pos(), extra.p ) );
3333  }
3334  }
3335  return extra_locations;
3336 }
3337 
3338 bool overmap::inbounds( const tripoint_om_omt &p, int clearance )
3339 {
3340  static constexpr tripoint_om_omt overmap_boundary_min( 0, 0, -OVERMAP_DEPTH );
3341  static constexpr tripoint_om_omt overmap_boundary_max( OMAPX, OMAPY, OVERMAP_HEIGHT + 1 );
3342 
3343  static constexpr half_open_cuboid<tripoint_om_omt> overmap_boundaries(
3344  overmap_boundary_min, overmap_boundary_max );
3345  half_open_cuboid<tripoint_om_omt> stricter_boundaries = overmap_boundaries;
3346  stricter_boundaries.shrink( tripoint( clearance, clearance, 0 ) );
3347 
3348  return stricter_boundaries.contains( p );
3349 }
3350 
3351 const scent_trace &overmap::scent_at( const tripoint_abs_omt &loc ) const
3352 {
3353  static const scent_trace null_scent;
3354  const auto &scent_found = scents.find( loc );
3355  if( scent_found != scents.end() ) {
3356  return scent_found->second;
3357  }
3358  return null_scent;
3359 }
3360 
3361 void overmap::set_scent( const tripoint_abs_omt &loc, const scent_trace &new_scent )
3362 {
3363  // TODO: increase strength of scent trace when applied repeatedly in a short timespan.
3364  scents[loc] = new_scent;
3365 }
3366 
3367 void overmap::generate( const overmap *north, const overmap *east,
3368  const overmap *south, const overmap *west,
3369  overmap_special_batch &enabled_specials )
3370 {
3371  dbg( D_INFO ) << "overmap::generate start…";
3372  const oter_id omt_outside_defined_omap = static_cast<oter_id>
3373  ( get_option<std::string>( "OUTSIDE_DEFINED_OMAP_OMT" ) );
3374  const std::string overmap_pregenerated_path =
3375  get_option<std::string>( "OVERMAP_PREGENERATED_PATH" );
3376  if( !overmap_pregenerated_path.empty() ) {
3377  // HACK: For some reason gz files are automatically unpacked and renamed during Android build process
3378 #if defined(__ANDROID__)
3379  static const std::string fname = "%s/overmap_%d_%d.omap";
3380 #else
3381  static const std::string fname = "%s/overmap_%d_%d.omap.gz";
3382 #endif
3383  const cata_path fpath = PATH_INFO::moddir() / string_format( fname,
3384  overmap_pregenerated_path, pos().x(), pos().y() );
3385  dbg( D_INFO ) << "trying" << fpath;
3386  if( !read_from_file_optional_json( fpath, [this, &fpath]( const JsonValue & jv ) {
3387  unserialize_omap( jv, fpath );
3388  } ) ) {
3389  dbg( D_INFO ) << "failed" << fpath;
3390  int z = 0;
3391  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
3392  // NOLINTNEXTLINE(modernize-loop-convert)
3393  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
3394  layer[z + OVERMAP_DEPTH].terrain[i][j] = omt_outside_defined_omap;
3395  }
3396  }
3397  }
3398  }
3399  calculate_urbanity();
3400  calculate_forestosity();
3401  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_POPULATE_OUTSIDE_CONNECTIONS_FROM_NEIGHBORS" ) ) {
3402  populate_connections_out_from_neighbors( north, east, south, west );
3403  }
3404  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_RIVERS" ) ) {
3405  place_rivers( north, east, south, west );
3406  }
3407  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_LAKES" ) ) {
3408  place_lakes();
3409  }
3410  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_OCEANS" ) ) {
3411  place_oceans();
3412  }
3413  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_FORESTS" ) ) {
3414  place_forests();
3415  }
3416  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_SWAMPS" ) ) {
3417  place_swamps();
3418  }
3419  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_RAVINES" ) ) {
3420  place_ravines();
3421  }
3422  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_CITIES" ) ) {
3423  place_cities();
3424  }
3425  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_FOREST_TRAILS" ) ) {
3426  place_forest_trails();
3427  }
3428  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_RAILROADS_BEFORE_ROADS" ) ) {
3429  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_RAILROADS" ) ) {
3430  place_railroads( north, east, south, west );
3431  }
3432  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_ROADS" ) ) {
3433  place_roads( north, east, south, west );
3434  }
3435  } else {
3436  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_ROADS" ) ) {
3437  place_roads( north, east, south, west );
3438  }
3439  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_RAILROADS" ) ) {
3440  place_railroads( north, east, south, west );
3441  }
3442  }
3443  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_SPECIALS" ) ) {
3444  place_specials( enabled_specials );
3445  }
3446  if( get_option<bool>( "OVERMAP_PLACE_FOREST_TRAILHEADS" ) ) {
3447  place_forest_trailheads();
3448  }
3449 
3450  polish_river();
3451 
3452  // TODO: there is no reason we can't generate the sublevels in one pass
3453  // for that matter there is no reason we can't as we add the entrance ways either
3454 
3455  // Always need at least one sublevel, but how many more
3456  int z = -1;
3457  bool requires_sub = false;
3458  do {
3459  requires_sub = generate_sub( z );
3460  } while( requires_sub && ( --z >= -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) );
3461 
3462  // Always need at least one overlevel, but how many more
3463  z = 1;
3464  bool requires_over = false;
3465  do {
3466  requires_over = generate_over( z );
3467  } while( requires_over && ( ++z <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT ) );
3468 
3469  // Place the monsters, now that the terrain is laid out
3470  place_mongroups();
3471  place_radios();
3472  dbg( D_INFO ) << "overmap::generate done";
3473 }
3474 
3475 bool overmap::generate_sub( const int z )
3476 {
3477  cata_assert( z < 0 );
3478 
3479  bool requires_sub = false;
3480  std::vector<point_om_omt> subway_points;
3481  std::vector<point_om_omt> sewer_points;
3482 
3483  std::vector<city> ant_points;
3484  std::vector<city> goo_points;
3485  std::vector<city> lab_points;
3486  std::vector<city> ice_lab_points;
3487  std::vector<city> central_lab_points;
3488  std::vector<point_om_omt> lab_train_points;
3489  std::vector<point_om_omt> central_lab_train_points;
3490 
3491  const auto add_goo_point = [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & p ) {
3492  const int size = rng( MIN_GOO_SIZE, MAX_GOO_SIZE );
3493  goo_points.emplace_back( p.xy(), size );
3494  };
3495 
3496  std::unordered_map<oter_type_id, std::function<void( const tripoint_om_omt &p )>>
3497  oter_above_actions = {
3498  { oter_type_empty_rock.id(), []( const tripoint_om_omt & ) {} },
3499  { oter_type_forest.id(), []( const tripoint_om_omt & ) {} },
3500  { oter_type_field.id(), []( const tripoint_om_omt & ) {} },
3501  { oter_type_forest_water.id(), []( const tripoint_om_omt & ) {} },
3502  { oter_type_forest_thick.id(), []( const tripoint_om_omt & ) {} },
3503  { oter_type_solid_earth.id(), []( const tripoint_om_omt & ) {} },
3504  {
3505  oter_type_road_nesw_manhole.id(),
3506  [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & p )
3507  {
3508  ter_set( p, oter_sewer_isolated.id() );
3509  sewer_points.emplace_back( p.xy() );
3510  }
3511  },
3512  { oter_type_slimepit_down.id(), add_goo_point },
3513  { oter_type_slimepit_bottom.id(), add_goo_point },
3514  {
3515  oter_type_lab_core.id(),
3516  [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & p )
3517  {
3518  lab_points.emplace_back( p.xy(), rng( 1, 5 + z ) );
3519  }
3520  },
3521  {
3522  oter_type_lab_stairs.id(),
3523  [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & p )
3524  {
3525  if( z == -1 ) {
3526  lab_points.emplace_back( p.xy(), rng( 1, 5 + z ) );
3527  } else {
3528  ter_set( p, oter_lab.id() );
3529  }
3530  }
3531  },
3532  {
3533  oter_type_ice_lab_core.id(),
3534  [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & p )
3535  {
3536  ice_lab_points.emplace_back( p.xy(), rng( 1, 5 + z ) );
3537  }
3538  },
3539  {
3540  oter_type_ice_lab_stairs.id(),
3541  [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & p )
3542  {
3543  if( z == -1 ) {
3544  ice_lab_points.emplace_back( p.xy(), rng( 1, 5 + z ) );
3545  } else {
3546  ter_set( p, oter_ice_lab.id() );
3547  }
3548  }
3549  },
3550  {
3551  oter_type_central_lab_core.id(),
3552  [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & p )
3553  {
3554  central_lab_points.emplace_back( p.xy(), rng( std::max( 1, 7 + z ), 9 + z ) );
3555  }
3556  },
3557  {
3558  oter_type_central_lab_stairs.id(),
3559  [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & p )
3560  {
3561  ter_set( p, oter_central_lab.id() );
3562  }
3563  },
3564  };
3565 
3566  // Avoid constructing strings inside the loop
3567  static const std::string s_hidden_lab_stairs = "hidden_lab_stairs";
3568 
3569  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
3570  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
3571  tripoint_om_omt p( i, j, z );
3572  const oter_id oter_id_here = ter_unsafe( p );
3573  const oter_t &oter_here = *oter_id_here;
3574  const oter_id oter_above = ter_unsafe( p + tripoint_above );
3575  const oter_id oter_ground = ter_unsafe( tripoint_om_omt( p.xy(), 0 ) );
3576 
3577  if( oter_here.get_type_id() == oter_type_sewer_connector ) {
3578  om_direction::type rotation = oter_here.get_dir();
3579  ter_set( p, oter_sewer_end_north.id()->get_rotated( rotation ) );
3580  sewer_points.emplace_back( p.xy() );
3581  }
3582 
3583  if( oter_here.get_type_id() == oter_type_microlab_sub_connector ) {
3584  om_direction::type rotation = oter_here.get_dir();
3585  ter_set( p, oter_subway_end_north.id()->get_rotated( rotation ) );
3586  subway_points.emplace_back( p.xy() );
3587  }
3588 
3589  if( oter_ground->get_type_id() == oter_type_sub_station ) {
3590  if( z == -1 ) {
3591  ter_set( p, oter_sewer_sub_station.id() );
3592  requires_sub = true;
3593  continue;
3594  } else if( z == -2 ) {
3595  ter_set( p, oter_subway_isolated.id() );
3596  subway_points.emplace_back( i, j - 1 );
3597  subway_points.emplace_back( i, j );
3598  subway_points.emplace_back( i, j + 1 );
3599  continue;
3600  }
3601  }
3602 
3603  auto above_action_it = oter_above_actions.find( oter_above->get_type_id().id() );
3604 
3605  if( above_action_it != oter_above_actions.end() ) {
3606  above_action_it->second( p );
3607  } else if( is_ot_match( s_hidden_lab_stairs, oter_above, ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3608  lab_points.emplace_back( p.xy(), rng( 1, 5 + z ) );
3609  }
3610  }
3611  }
3612 
3613  for( city &i : goo_points ) {
3614  requires_sub |= build_slimepit( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ), i.size );
3615  }
3616  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_sewer_tunnel =
3617  settings->overmap_connection.sewer_connection;
3618  connect_closest_points( sewer_points, z, *overmap_connection_sewer_tunnel );
3619 
3620  // A third of overmaps have labs with a 1-in-2 chance of being subway connected.
3621  // If the central lab exists, all labs which go down to z=4 will have a subway to central.
3622  int lab_train_odds = 0;
3623  if( z == -2 && one_in( 3 ) ) {
3624  lab_train_odds = 2;
3625  }
3626  if( z == -4 && !central_lab_points.empty() ) {
3627  lab_train_odds = 1;
3628  }
3629 
3630  for( city &i : lab_points ) {
3631  bool lab = build_lab( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ), i.size, &lab_train_points, "", lab_train_odds );
3632  requires_sub |= lab;
3633  if( !lab && ter( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ) ) == oter_lab_core ) {
3634  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ), oter_lab.id() );
3635  }
3636  }
3637  for( city &i : ice_lab_points ) {
3638  bool ice_lab = build_lab( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ), i.size, &lab_train_points, "ice_",
3639  lab_train_odds );
3640  requires_sub |= ice_lab;
3641  if( !ice_lab && ter( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ) ) == oter_ice_lab_core ) {
3642  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ), oter_ice_lab.id() );
3643  }
3644  }
3645  for( city &i : central_lab_points ) {
3646  bool central_lab = build_lab( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ), i.size, &central_lab_train_points,
3647  "central_", lab_train_odds );
3648  requires_sub |= central_lab;
3649  if( !central_lab && ter( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ) ) == oter_central_lab_core ) {
3650  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( i.pos, z ), oter_central_lab.id() );
3651  }
3652  }
3653 
3654  const auto create_real_train_lab_points = [this, z](
3655  const std::vector<point_om_omt> &train_points,
3656  std::vector<point_om_omt> &real_train_points ) {
3657  bool is_first_in_pair = true;
3658  for( const point_om_omt &p : train_points ) {
3659  tripoint_om_omt i( p, z );
3660  const std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> nearby_locations {
3661  i + point_north,
3662  i + point_south,
3663  i + point_east,
3664  i + point_west };
3665  if( is_first_in_pair ) {
3666  ter_set( i, oter_open_air.id() ); // mark tile to prevent subway gen
3667 
3668  for( const tripoint_om_omt &nearby_loc : nearby_locations ) {
3669  if( is_ot_match( "empty_rock", ter( nearby_loc ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3670  // mark tile to prevent subway gen
3671  ter_set( nearby_loc, oter_open_air.id() );
3672  }
3673  if( is_ot_match( "solid_earth", ter( nearby_loc ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3674  // mark tile to prevent subway gen
3675  ter_set( nearby_loc, oter_field.id() );
3676  }
3677  }
3678  } else {
3679  // change train connection point back to rock to allow gen
3680  if( is_ot_match( "open_air", ter( i ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3681  ter_set( i, oter_empty_rock.id() );
3682  }
3683  if( is_ot_match( "field", ter( i ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3684  ter_set( i, oter_solid_earth.id() );
3685  }
3686  real_train_points.push_back( i.xy() );
3687  }
3688  is_first_in_pair = !is_first_in_pair;
3689  }
3690  };
3691  std::vector<point_om_omt>
3692  subway_lab_train_points; // real points for subway, excluding train depot points
3693  create_real_train_lab_points( lab_train_points, subway_lab_train_points );
3694  create_real_train_lab_points( central_lab_train_points, subway_lab_train_points );
3695 
3696  subway_points.insert( subway_points.end(), subway_lab_train_points.begin(),
3697  subway_lab_train_points.end() );
3698  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_subway_tunnel =
3699  settings->overmap_connection.subway_connection;
3700  connect_closest_points( subway_points, z, *overmap_connection_subway_tunnel );
3701 
3702  for( auto &i : subway_points ) {
3703  if( ( ter( tripoint_om_omt( i, z + 2 ) )->get_type_id() == oter_type_sub_station ) ) {
3704  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( i, z ), oter_underground_sub_station.id() );
3705  }
3706  }
3707 
3708  // The first lab point is adjacent to a lab, set it a depot (as long as track was actually laid).
3709  const auto create_train_depots = [this, z,
3710  overmap_connection_subway_tunnel]( const oter_id & train_type,
3711  const std::vector<point_om_omt> &train_points ) {
3712  bool is_first_in_pair = true;
3713  std::vector<point_om_omt> extra_route;
3714  for( const point_om_omt &p : train_points ) {
3715  tripoint_om_omt i( p, z );
3716  if( is_first_in_pair ) {
3717  const std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> subway_possible_loc {
3718  i + point_north,
3719  i + point_south,
3720  i + point_east,
3721  i + point_west };
3722  extra_route.clear();
3723  ter_set( i, oter_empty_rock.id() ); // this clears marked tiles
3724  bool is_depot_generated = false;
3725  for( const tripoint_om_omt &subway_loc : subway_possible_loc ) {
3726  if( !is_depot_generated &&
3727  is_ot_match( "subway", ter( subway_loc ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3728  extra_route.push_back( i.xy() );
3729  extra_route.push_back( subway_loc.xy() );
3730  connect_closest_points( extra_route, z, *overmap_connection_subway_tunnel );
3731 
3732  ter_set( i, train_type );
3733  is_depot_generated = true; // only one connection to depot
3734  } else if( is_ot_match( "open_air", ter( subway_loc ),
3735  ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3736  // clear marked
3737  ter_set( subway_loc, oter_empty_rock.id() );
3738  } else if( is_ot_match( "field", ter( subway_loc ),
3739  ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
3740  // clear marked
3741  ter_set( subway_loc, oter_solid_earth.id() );
3742  }
3743  }
3744  }
3745  is_first_in_pair = !is_first_in_pair;
3746  }
3747  };
3748  create_train_depots( oter_lab_train_depot.id(), lab_train_points );
3749  create_train_depots( oter_central_lab_train_depot.id(), central_lab_train_points );
3750 
3751  for( city &i : cities ) {
3752  tripoint_om_omt omt_pos( i.pos, z );
3753  tripoint_om_sm sm_pos = project_to<coords::sm>( omt_pos );
3754  tripoint_abs_sm abs_pos = project_combine( pos(), sm_pos );
3755  // Normal subways are present at z == -2, but filtering for the terrain would be much nicer
3756  if( z == -2 ) {
3757  spawn_mon_group( mongroup( GROUP_SUBWAY_CITY, abs_pos, i.size * i.size * 2 ),
3758  i.size * 2 );
3759  }
3760  }
3761 
3762  return requires_sub;
3763 }
3764 
3765 bool overmap::generate_over( const int z )
3766 {
3767  bool requires_over = false;
3768  std::vector<point_om_omt> bridge_points;
3769  std::vector<point_om_omt> railroad_bridge_points;
3770 
3771  // These are so common that it's worth checking first as int.
3772  const std::set<oter_id> skip_below = {
3773  oter_empty_rock.id(), oter_forest.id(), oter_field.id(),
3774  oter_forest_thick.id(), oter_forest_water.id(), oter_solid_earth.id()
3775  };
3776 
3777  if( z == 1 ) {
3778  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
3779  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
3780  tripoint_om_omt p( i, j, z );
3781  const oter_id oter_below = ter( p + tripoint_below );
3782  const oter_id oter_ground = ter( tripoint_om_omt( p.xy(), 0 ) );
3783 
3784  // implicitly skip skip_below oter_ids
3785  if( skip_below.find( oter_below ) != skip_below.end() ) {
3786  continue;
3787  }
3788 
3789  if( oter_ground->get_type_id() == oter_type_bridge ) {
3790  ter_set( p, oter_id( "bridge_road" + oter_get_rotation_string( oter_ground ) ) );
3791  bridge_points.push_back( p.xy() );
3792  tripoint_om_omt support_point = p + tripoint_below;
3793  int support_z = 0;
3794  // place the rest of the support columns
3795  while( ter( support_point ) -> is_water() && --support_z >= -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) {
3796  ter_set( support_point, oter_id( "bridge" + oter_get_rotation_string( oter_ground ) ) );
3797  support_point += tripoint_below;
3798  }
3799  }
3800  if( oter_ground->get_type_id() == oter_type_railroad_bridge ) {
3801  ter_set( p, oter_id( "railroad_bridge_overpass" + oter_get_rotation_string( oter_ground ) ) );
3802  railroad_bridge_points.push_back( p.xy() );
3803  }
3804  }
3805  }
3806  }
3807 
3808  generate_bridgeheads( bridge_points, oter_type_bridge,
3809  "bridgehead_ground", "bridgehead_ramp" );
3810  generate_bridgeheads( railroad_bridge_points, oter_type_railroad_bridge,
3811  "railroad_bridgehead_ground", "railroad_bridgehead_ramp" );
3812 
3813  return requires_over;
3814 }
3815 
3816 void overmap::generate_bridgeheads( const std::vector<point_om_omt> &bridge_points,
3817  const oter_type_str_id bridge_type,
3818  const std::string &bridgehead_ground,
3819  const std::string &bridgehead_ramp )
3820 {
3821  std::vector<std::pair<point_om_omt, std::string>> bridgehead_points;
3822  for( const point_om_omt &bp : bridge_points ) {
3823  //const oter_id oter_ground = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) );
3824  const oter_id oter_ground_north = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) + tripoint_north );
3825  const oter_id oter_ground_south = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) + tripoint_south );
3826  const oter_id oter_ground_east = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) + tripoint_east );
3827  const oter_id oter_ground_west = ter( tripoint_om_omt( bp, 0 ) + tripoint_west );
3828  const bool is_bridge_north = ( oter_ground_north->get_type_id() == bridge_type )
3829  && ( oter_get_rotation( oter_ground_north ) % 2 == 0 );
3830  const bool is_bridge_south = ( oter_ground_south->get_type_id() == bridge_type )
3831  && ( oter_get_rotation( oter_ground_south ) % 2 == 0 );
3832  const bool is_bridge_east = ( oter_ground_east->get_type_id() == bridge_type )
3833  && ( oter_get_rotation( oter_ground_east ) % 2 == 1 );
3834  const bool is_bridge_west = ( oter_ground_west->get_type_id() == bridge_type )
3835  && ( oter_get_rotation( oter_ground_west ) % 2 == 1 );
3836 
3837  if( is_bridge_north ^ is_bridge_south || is_bridge_east ^ is_bridge_west ) {
3838  std::string ramp_facing;
3839  if( is_bridge_north ) {
3840  ramp_facing = "_south";
3841  } else if( is_bridge_south ) {
3842  ramp_facing = "_north";
3843  } else if( is_bridge_east ) {
3844  ramp_facing = "_west";
3845  } else {
3846  ramp_facing = "_east";
3847  }
3848  bridgehead_points.emplace_back( bp, ramp_facing );
3849  }
3850  }
3851  for( const std::pair<point_om_omt, std::string> &bhp : bridgehead_points ) {
3852  tripoint_om_omt p( bhp.first, 0 );
3853  ter_set( p, oter_id( bridgehead_ground + bhp.second ) );
3854  ter_set( p + tripoint_above, oter_id( bridgehead_ramp + bhp.second ) );
3855  }
3856 }
3857 
3858 std::vector<point_abs_omt> overmap::find_terrain( const std::string_view term, int zlevel ) const
3859 {
3860  std::vector<point_abs_omt> found;
3861  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
3862  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
3863  tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, zlevel );
3864  if( seen( p ) &&
3865  lcmatch( ter( p )->get_name(), term ) ) {
3866  found.push_back( project_combine( pos(), p.xy() ) );
3867  }
3868  }
3869  }
3870  return found;
3871 }
3872 
3873 const city &overmap::get_nearest_city( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
3874 {
3875  int distance = 999;
3876  const city *res = nullptr;
3877  for( const city &elem : cities ) {
3878  const int dist = elem.get_distance_from( p );
3879  if( dist < distance ) {
3880  distance = dist;
3881  res = &elem;
3882  }
3883  }
3884  if( res != nullptr ) {
3885  return *res;
3886  }
3887  static city invalid_city;
3888  return invalid_city;
3889 }
3890 
3891 tripoint_om_omt overmap::find_random_omt( const std::pair<std::string, ot_match_type> &target,
3892  std::optional<city> target_city ) const
3893 {
3894  const bool check_nearest_city = target_city.has_value();
3895  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> valid;
3896  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
3897  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
3898  for( int k = -OVERMAP_DEPTH; k <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT; k++ ) {
3899  tripoint_om_omt p( i, j, k );
3900  if( is_ot_match( target.first, ter( p ), target.second ) ) {
3901  if( !check_nearest_city || get_nearest_city( p ) == target_city.value() ) {
3902  valid.push_back( p );
3903  }
3904  }
3905  }
3906  }
3907  }
3908  return random_entry( valid, tripoint_om_omt( tripoint_min ) );
3909 }
3910 
3911 void overmap::process_mongroups()
3912 {
3913  for( auto it = zg.begin(); it != zg.end(); ) {
3914  mongroup &mg = it->second;
3915  if( mg.dying ) {
3916  mg.population = ( mg.population * 4 ) / 5;
3917  }
3918  if( mg.empty() ) {
3919  zg.erase( it++ );
3920  } else {
3921  ++it;
3922  }
3923  }
3924 }
3925 
3926 void overmap::clear_mon_groups()
3927 {
3928  zg.clear();
3929 }
3930 
3931 void overmap::clear_overmap_special_placements()
3932 {
3933  overmap_special_placements.clear();
3934 }
3935 void overmap::clear_cities()
3936 {
3937  cities.clear();
3938 }
3939 void overmap::clear_connections_out()
3940 {
3941  connections_out.clear();
3942 }
3943 
3944 static std::map<std::string, std::string> oter_id_migrations;
3945 
3946 void overmap::load_oter_id_migration( const JsonObject &jo )
3947 {
3948  for( const JsonMember &kv : jo.get_object( "oter_ids" ) ) {
3949  oter_id_migrations.emplace( kv.name(), kv.get_string() );
3950  }
3951 }
3952 
3953 void overmap::reset_oter_id_migrations()
3954 {
3955  oter_id_migrations.clear();
3956 }
3957 
3958 bool overmap::is_oter_id_obsolete( const std::string &oterid )
3959 {
3960  return oter_id_migrations.count( oterid ) > 0;
3961 }
3962 
3963 void overmap::migrate_oter_ids( const std::unordered_map<tripoint_om_omt, std::string> &points )
3964 {
3965  for( const auto&[pos, old_id] : points ) {
3966  const oter_str_id new_id = oter_str_id( oter_id_migrations.at( old_id ) );
3967  const tripoint_abs_sm pos_abs = project_to<coords::sm>( project_combine( this->pos(), pos ) );
3968 
3969  if( new_id.is_valid() ) {
3970  DebugLog( D_WARNING, DC_ALL ) << "migrated oter_id '" << old_id << "' at " << pos_abs
3971  << " to '" << new_id.str() << "'";
3972 
3973  ter_set( pos, new_id );
3974  } else {
3975  debugmsg( "oter_id migration defined from '%s' to invalid ter_id '%s'", old_id, new_id.str() );
3976  }
3977  }
3978 }
3979 
3980 oter_id overmap::get_or_migrate_oter( const std::string &oterid )
3981 {
3982  auto migration = oter_id_migrations.find( oterid );
3983  if( migration != oter_id_migrations.end() ) {
3984  return oter_id( migration->second );
3985  } else {
3986  return oter_id( oterid );
3987  }
3988 }
3989 
3990 void overmap::place_special_forced( const overmap_special_id &special_id,
3991  const tripoint_om_omt &p,
3992  om_direction::type dir )
3993 {
3994  static city invalid_city;
3995  place_special( *special_id, p, dir, invalid_city, false, true );
3996 }
3997 
3998 void mongroup::wander( const overmap &om )
3999 {
4000  const city *target_city = nullptr;
4001  int target_distance = 0;
4002 
4003  point_om_sm rel_p = rel_pos().xy();
4004 
4005  if( behaviour == horde_behaviour::city ) {
4006  // Find a nearby city to return to..
4007  for( const city &check_city : om.cities ) {
4008  // Check if this is the nearest city so far.
4009  int distance = rl_dist( project_to<coords::sm>( check_city.pos ), rel_p );
4010  if( !target_city || distance < target_distance ) {
4011  target_distance = distance;
4012  target_city = &check_city;
4013  }
4014  }
4015  }
4016 
4017  if( target_city ) {
4018  // TODO: somehow use the same algorithm that distributes zombie
4019  // density at world gen to spread the hordes over the actual
4020  // city, rather than the center city tile
4021  point_abs_sm target_abs =
4022  project_to<coords::sm>( project_combine( om.pos(), target_city->pos ) );
4023  int range = target_city->size * 2;
4024  point delta( rng( -range, range ), rng( -range, range ) );
4025  target = target_abs + delta;
4026  interest = 100;
4027  } else {
4028  target = abs_pos.xy() + point( rng( -10, 10 ), rng( -10, 10 ) );
4029  interest = 30;
4030  }
4031 }
4032 
4033 void overmap::move_hordes()
4034 {
4035  // Prevent hordes to be moved twice by putting them in here after moving.
4036  decltype( zg ) tmpzg;
4037  //MOVE ZOMBIE GROUPS
4038  for( auto it = zg.begin(); it != zg.end(); ) {
4039  mongroup &mg = it->second;
4040  if( !mg.horde || mg.behaviour == mongroup::horde_behaviour::nemesis ) {
4041  //nemesis hordes have their own move function
4042  ++it;
4043  continue;
4044  }
4045 
4046  if( mg.behaviour == mongroup::horde_behaviour::none ) {
4047  mg.behaviour =
4048  one_in( 2 ) ? mongroup::horde_behaviour::city : mongroup::horde_behaviour::roam;
4049  }
4050 
4051  // Gradually decrease interest.
4052  mg.dec_interest( 1 );
4053 
4054  if( ( mg.abs_pos.xy() == mg.target ) || mg.interest <= 15 ) {
4055  mg.wander( *this );
4056  }
4057 
4058  // Decrease movement chance according to the terrain we're currently on.
4059  const oter_id &walked_into = ter( project_to<coords::omt>( mg.rel_pos() ) );
4060  int movement_chance = 1;
4061  if( walked_into == oter_forest || walked_into == oter_forest_water ) {
4062  movement_chance = 3;
4063  } else if( walked_into == oter_forest_thick ) {
4064  movement_chance = 6;
4065  } else if( walked_into == oter_river_center ) {
4066  movement_chance = 10;
4067  }
4068 
4069  // If the average horde speed is 50% that of normal, then the chance to
4070  // move should be 1/2 what it would be if the speed was 100%.
4071  // Since the max speed for a horde is one map space per 2.5 minutes,
4072  // choose that to be the speed of the fastest horde monster, which is
4073  // roughly 200 at the time of writing. So a horde with average speed
4074  // 200 or over will move at max speed, and slower hordes will move less
4075  // frequently. The average horde speed for regular Z's is around 100,
4076  // or one space per 5 minutes.
4077  if( one_in( movement_chance ) && rng( 0, 100 ) < mg.interest && rng( 0, 200 ) < mg.avg_speed() ) {
4078  // TODO: Handle moving to adjacent overmaps.
4079  if( mg.abs_pos.x() > mg.target.x() ) {
4080  mg.abs_pos.x()--;
4081  }
4082  if( mg.abs_pos.x() < mg.target.x() ) {
4083  mg.abs_pos.x()++;
4084  }
4085  if( mg.abs_pos.y() > mg.target.y() ) {
4086  mg.abs_pos.y()--;
4087  }
4088  if( mg.abs_pos.y() < mg.target.y() ) {
4089  mg.abs_pos.y()++;
4090  }
4091 
4092  // Erase the group at it's old location, add the group with the new location
4093  tmpzg.emplace( mg.rel_pos(), mg );
4094  zg.erase( it++ );
4095  } else {
4096  ++it;
4097  }
4098  }
4099  // and now back into the monster group map.
4100  zg.insert( tmpzg.begin(), tmpzg.end() );
4101 
4102  if( get_option<bool>( "WANDER_SPAWNS" ) ) {
4103 
4104  // Re-absorb zombies into hordes.
4105  // Scan over monsters outside the player's view and place them back into hordes.
4106  auto monster_map_it = monster_map.begin();
4107  while( monster_map_it != monster_map.end() ) {
4108  const tripoint_om_sm &p = monster_map_it->first;
4109  monster &this_monster = monster_map_it->second;
4110 
4111  // Only zombies on z-level 0 may join hordes.
4112  if( p.z() != 0 ) {
4113  monster_map_it++;
4114  continue;
4115  }
4116 
4117  // Check if the monster is a zombie.
4118  const mtype &type = *this_monster.type;
4119  if(
4120  !type.species.count( species_ZOMBIE ) || // Only add zombies to hordes.
4121  this_monster.get_speed() <= 30 || // So are very slow zombies, like crawling zombies.
4122  !this_monster.will_join_horde( INT_MAX ) || // So are zombies who won't join a horde of any size.
4123  !this_monster.mission_ids.empty() // We mustn't delete monsters that are related to missions.
4124  ) {
4125  // Don't delete the monster, just increment the iterator.
4126  monster_map_it++;
4127  continue;
4128  }
4129 
4130  // Only monsters in the open (fields, forests, roads) are eligible to wander
4131  const oter_id &om_here = ter( project_to<coords::omt>( p ) );
4132  if( !is_ot_match( "field", om_here, ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
4133  if( !is_ot_match( "road", om_here, ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
4134  if( !is_ot_match( "forest", om_here, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4135  if( !is_ot_match( "swamp", om_here, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4136  monster_map_it++;
4137  continue;
4138  }
4139  }
4140  }
4141  }
4142 
4143  // Scan for compatible hordes in this area, selecting the largest.
4144  mongroup *add_to_group = nullptr;
4145  auto group_bucket = zg.equal_range( p );
4146  std::vector<monster>::size_type add_to_horde_size = 0;
4147  std::for_each( group_bucket.first, group_bucket.second,
4148  [&]( std::pair<const tripoint_om_sm, mongroup> &horde_entry ) {
4149  mongroup &horde = horde_entry.second;
4150 
4151  // We only absorb zombies into GROUP_ZOMBIE hordes
4152  if( horde.horde && !horde.monsters.empty() && horde.type == GROUP_ZOMBIE &&
4153  horde.monsters.size() > add_to_horde_size ) {
4154  add_to_group = &horde;
4155  add_to_horde_size = horde.monsters.size();
4156  }
4157  } );
4158 
4159  // Check again if the zombie will join the largest horde, now that we know the accurate size.
4160  if( this_monster.will_join_horde( add_to_horde_size ) ) {
4161  // If there is no horde to add the monster to, create one.
4162  if( add_to_group == nullptr ) {
4163  tripoint_abs_sm abs_pos = project_combine( pos(), p );
4164  mongroup m( GROUP_ZOMBIE, abs_pos, 0 );
4165  m.horde = true;
4166  m.monsters.push_back( this_monster );
4167  m.interest = 0; // Ensures that we will select a new target.
4168  add_mon_group( m );
4169  } else {
4170  add_to_group->monsters.push_back( this_monster );
4171  }
4172  } else { // Bad luck--the zombie would have joined a larger horde, but not this one. Skip.
4173  // Don't delete the monster, just increment the iterator.
4174  monster_map_it++;
4175  continue;
4176  }
4177 
4178  // Delete the monster, continue iterating.
4179  monster_map_it = monster_map.erase( monster_map_it );
4180  }
4181  }
4182 }
4183 
4184 void overmap::move_nemesis()
4185 {
4186  // Prevent hordes to be moved twice by putting them in here after moving.
4187  decltype( zg ) tmpzg;
4188  //cycle through zombie groups, skip non-nemesis hordes
4189  for( std::multimap<tripoint_om_sm, mongroup>::iterator it = zg.begin(); it != zg.end(); ) {
4190  mongroup &mg = it->second;
4191  if( !mg.horde || mg.behaviour != mongroup::horde_behaviour::nemesis ) {
4192  ++it;
4193  continue;
4194  }
4195 
4196  point_abs_om omp;
4197  tripoint_om_sm local_sm;
4198  std::tie( omp, local_sm ) = project_remain<coords::om>( mg.abs_pos );
4199 
4200  // Decrease movement chance according to the terrain we're currently on.
4201  // Hordes will tend toward roads / open fields and path around specials.
4202  const oter_id &walked_into = ter( project_to<coords::omt>( local_sm ) );
4203  int movement_chance = 25;
4204  if( is_ot_match( "road", walked_into, ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
4205  movement_chance = 1;
4206  } else if( is_ot_match( "field", walked_into, ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
4207  movement_chance = 3;
4208  } else if( is_ot_match( "forest", walked_into, ot_match_type::prefix ) ||
4209  is_ot_match( "swamp", walked_into, ot_match_type::prefix ) ||
4210  is_ot_match( "bridge", walked_into, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4211  movement_chance = 6;
4212  } else if( is_ot_match( "river", walked_into, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4213  movement_chance = 10;
4214  }
4215 
4216  //update the nemesis coordinates in abs_sm for movement across overmaps
4217  if( one_in( movement_chance ) && rng( 0, 200 ) < mg.avg_speed() ) {
4218  if( mg.abs_pos.x() > mg.nemesis_target.x() ) {
4219  mg.abs_pos.x()--;
4220  }
4221  if( mg.abs_pos.x() < mg.nemesis_target.x() ) {
4222  mg.abs_pos.x()++;
4223  }
4224  if( mg.abs_pos.y() > mg.nemesis_target.y() ) {
4225  mg.abs_pos.y()--;
4226  }
4227  if( mg.abs_pos.y() < mg.nemesis_target.y() ) {
4228  mg.abs_pos.y()++;
4229  }
4230 
4231  //if the nemesis horde is on the same overmap as its target
4232  //update the horde's om_sm coords from the abs_sm so it can spawn in correctly
4233  if( project_to<coords::om>( mg.nemesis_target ) == omp ) {
4234 
4235  // Erase the group at its old location, add the group with the new location
4236  tmpzg.emplace( mg.rel_pos(), mg );
4237  zg.erase( it++ );
4238 
4239  //there is only one nemesis horde, so we can stop looping after we move it
4240  break;
4241 
4242  }
4243 
4244  //only one nemesis, so we break after moving it
4245  break;
4246 
4247  } else {
4248  //and we also break if it doesnt move
4249  break;
4250  }
4251  }
4252  // and now back into the monster group map.
4253  zg.insert( tmpzg.begin(), tmpzg.end() );
4254 
4255 }
4256 
4257 bool overmap::remove_nemesis()
4258 {
4259  //cycle through zombie groups, find nemesis horde
4260  for( std::multimap<tripoint_om_sm, mongroup>::iterator it = zg.begin(); it != zg.end(); ) {
4261  mongroup &mg = it->second;
4262  if( mg.behaviour == mongroup::horde_behaviour::nemesis ) {
4263  zg.erase( it++ );
4264  return true;
4265  }
4266  it++;
4267  }
4268  return false;
4269 }
4270 
4271 /**
4272 * @param p location of signal relative to this overmap origin
4273 * @param sig_power - power of signal or max distance for reaction of zombies
4274 */
4275 void overmap::signal_hordes( const tripoint_rel_sm &p_rel, const int sig_power )
4276 {
4277  tripoint_om_sm p( p_rel.raw() );
4278  tripoint_abs_sm absp = project_combine( pos(), p );
4279  for( auto &elem : zg ) {
4280  mongroup &mg = elem.second;
4281  if( !mg.horde ) {
4282  continue;
4283  }
4284  const int dist = rl_dist( absp, mg.abs_pos );
4285  if( sig_power < dist ) {
4286  continue;
4287  }
4288  if( mg.behaviour == mongroup::horde_behaviour::nemesis ) {
4289  // nemesis hordes are signaled to the player by their own function and dont react to noise
4290  continue;
4291  }
4292  // TODO: base this in monster attributes, foremost GOODHEARING.
4293  const int inter_per_sig_power = 15; //Interest per signal value
4294  const int min_initial_inter = 30; //Min initial interest for horde
4295  const int calculated_inter = ( sig_power + 1 - dist ) * inter_per_sig_power; // Calculated interest
4296  const int roll = rng( 0, mg.interest );
4297  // Minimum capped calculated interest. Used to give horde enough interest to really investigate the target at start.
4298  const int min_capped_inter = std::max( min_initial_inter, calculated_inter );
4299  if( roll < min_capped_inter ) { //Rolling if horde interested in new signal
4300  // TODO: Z-coordinate for mongroup targets
4301  const int targ_dist = rl_dist( absp.xy(), mg.target );
4302  // TODO: Base this on targ_dist:dist ratio.
4303  if( targ_dist < 5 ) { // If signal source already pursued by horde
4304  mg.set_target( midpoint( mg.target, absp.xy() ) );
4305  const int min_inc_inter = 3; // Min interest increase to already targeted source
4306  const int inc_roll = rng( min_inc_inter, calculated_inter );
4307  mg.inc_interest( inc_roll );
4308  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_OVERMAP, "horde inc interest %d dist %d", inc_roll, dist );
4309  } else { // New signal source
4310  mg.set_target( absp.xy() );
4311  mg.set_interest( min_capped_inter );
4312  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_OVERMAP, "horde set interest %d dist %d", min_capped_inter, dist );
4313  }
4314  }
4315  }
4316 }
4317 
4318 void overmap::signal_nemesis( const tripoint_abs_sm &p_abs_sm )
4319 {
4320  for( std::pair<const tripoint_om_sm, mongroup> &elem : zg ) {
4321  mongroup &mg = elem.second;
4322 
4323  if( mg.behaviour == mongroup::horde_behaviour::nemesis ) {
4324  // if the horde is a nemesis, we set its target directly on the player
4325  mg.set_target( p_abs_sm.xy() );
4326  mg.set_nemesis_target( p_abs_sm.xy() );
4327 
4328  }
4329  }
4330 }
4331 
4332 void overmap::populate_connections_out_from_neighbors( const overmap *north, const overmap *east,
4333  const overmap *south, const overmap *west )
4334 {
4335  const auto populate_for_side =
4336  [&]( const overmap * adjacent,
4337  const std::function<bool( const tripoint_om_omt & )> &should_include,
4338  const std::function<tripoint_om_omt( const tripoint_om_omt & )> &build_point ) {
4339  if( adjacent == nullptr ) {
4340  return;
4341  }
4342 
4343  for( const std::pair<const string_id<overmap_connection>, std::vector<tripoint_om_omt>> &kv :
4344  adjacent->connections_out ) {
4345  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> &out = connections_out[kv.first];
4346  const auto adjacent_out = adjacent->connections_out.find( kv.first );
4347  if( adjacent_out != adjacent->connections_out.end() ) {
4348  for( const tripoint_om_omt &p : adjacent_out->second ) {
4349  if( should_include( p ) ) {
4350  out.push_back( build_point( p ) );
4351  }
4352  }
4353  }
4354  }
4355  };
4356 
4357  populate_for_side( north, []( const tripoint_om_omt & p ) {
4358  return p.y() == OMAPY - 1;
4359  }, []( const tripoint_om_omt & p ) {
4360  return tripoint_om_omt( p.x(), 0, p.z() );
4361  } );
4362  populate_for_side( west, []( const tripoint_om_omt & p ) {
4363  return p.x() == OMAPX - 1;
4364  }, []( const tripoint_om_omt & p ) {
4365  return tripoint_om_omt( 0, p.y(), p.z() );
4366  } );
4367  populate_for_side( south, []( const tripoint_om_omt & p ) {
4368  return p.y() == 0;
4369  }, []( const tripoint_om_omt & p ) {
4370  return tripoint_om_omt( p.x(), OMAPY - 1, p.z() );
4371  } );
4372  populate_for_side( east, []( const tripoint_om_omt & p ) {
4373  return p.x() == 0;
4374  }, []( const tripoint_om_omt & p ) {
4375  return tripoint_om_omt( OMAPX - 1, p.y(), p.z() );
4376  } );
4377 }
4378 
4379 void overmap::place_forest_trails()
4380 {
4381  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> visited;
4382 
4383  const auto is_forest = [&]( const point_om_omt & p ) {
4384  if( !inbounds( p, 1 ) ) {
4385  return false;
4386  }
4387  const oter_id current_terrain = ter( tripoint_om_omt( p, 0 ) );
4388  return current_terrain == oter_forest || current_terrain == oter_forest_thick ||
4389  current_terrain == oter_forest_water;
4390  };
4391  const forest_trail_settings &forest_trail = settings->forest_trail;
4392 
4393  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
4394  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
4395  tripoint_om_omt seed_point( i, j, 0 );
4396 
4397  oter_id oter = ter( seed_point );
4398  if( !is_ot_match( "forest", oter, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4399  continue;
4400  }
4401 
4402  // If we've already visited this point, we don't need to
4403  // process it since it's already part of another forest.
4404  if( visited.find( seed_point.xy() ) != visited.end() ) {
4405  continue;
4406  }
4407 
4408  // Get the contiguous forest from this point.
4409  std::vector<point_om_omt> forest_points =
4410  ff::point_flood_fill_4_connected( seed_point.xy(), visited, is_forest );
4411 
4412  // If we don't have enough points to build a trail, move on.
4413  if( forest_points.empty() ||
4414  forest_points.size() < static_cast<std::vector<point>::size_type>
4415  ( forest_trail.minimum_forest_size ) ) {
4416  continue;
4417  }
4418 
4419  // If we don't rng a forest based on our settings, move on.
4420  if( !one_in( forest_trail.chance ) ) {
4421  continue;
4422  }
4423 
4424  // Get the north and south most points in the forest.
4425  auto north_south_most = std::minmax_element( forest_points.begin(),
4426  forest_points.end(), []( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4427  return lhs.y() < rhs.y();
4428  } );
4429 
4430  // Get the west and east most points in the forest.
4431  auto west_east_most = std::minmax_element( forest_points.begin(),
4432  forest_points.end(), []( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4433  return lhs.x() < rhs.x();
4434  } );
4435 
4436  // We'll use these points later as points that are guaranteed to be
4437  // at a boundary and will form a good foundation for the trail system.
4438  point_om_omt northmost = *north_south_most.first;
4439  point_om_omt southmost = *north_south_most.second;
4440  point_om_omt westmost = *west_east_most.first;
4441  point_om_omt eastmost = *west_east_most.second;
4442 
4443  // Do a simplistic calculation of the center of the forest (rather than
4444  // calculating the actual centroid--it's not that important) to have another
4445  // good point to form the foundation of the trail system.
4446  point_om_omt center( westmost.x() + ( eastmost.x() - westmost.x() ) / 2,
4447  northmost.y() + ( southmost.y() - northmost.y() ) / 2 );
4448 
4449  point_om_omt center_point = center;
4450 
4451  // Because we didn't do the centroid of a concave polygon, there's no
4452  // guarantee that our center point is actually within the bounds of the
4453  // forest. Just find the point within our set that is closest to our
4454  // center point and use that.
4455  point_om_omt actual_center_point =
4456  *std::min_element( forest_points.begin(), forest_points.end(),
4457  [&center_point]( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4458  return square_dist( lhs, center_point ) < square_dist( rhs,
4459  center_point );
4460  } );
4461 
4462  // Figure out how many random points we'll add to our trail system, based on the forest
4463  // size and our configuration.
4464  int max_random_points = forest_trail.random_point_min + forest_points.size() /
4465  forest_trail.random_point_size_scalar;
4466  max_random_points = std::min( max_random_points, forest_trail.random_point_max );
4467 
4468  // Start with the center...
4469  std::vector<point_om_omt> chosen_points = { actual_center_point };
4470 
4471  // ...and then add our random points.
4472  int random_point_count = 0;
4473  std::shuffle( forest_points.begin(), forest_points.end(), rng_get_engine() );
4474  for( auto &random_point : forest_points ) {
4475  if( random_point_count >= max_random_points ) {
4476  break;
4477  }
4478  random_point_count++;
4479  chosen_points.emplace_back( random_point );
4480  }
4481 
4482  // Add our north/south/west/east-most points based on our configuration.
4483  if( one_in( forest_trail.border_point_chance ) ) {
4484  chosen_points.emplace_back( northmost );
4485  }
4486  if( one_in( forest_trail.border_point_chance ) ) {
4487  chosen_points.emplace_back( southmost );
4488  }
4489  if( one_in( forest_trail.border_point_chance ) ) {
4490  chosen_points.emplace_back( westmost );
4491  }
4492  if( one_in( forest_trail.border_point_chance ) ) {
4493  chosen_points.emplace_back( eastmost );
4494  }
4495 
4496  // Finally, connect all the points and make a forest trail out of them.
4497  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_forest_trail =
4498  settings->overmap_connection.trail_connection;
4499  connect_closest_points( chosen_points, 0, *overmap_connection_forest_trail );
4500  }
4501  }
4502 }
4503 
4504 void overmap::place_forest_trailheads()
4505 {
4506  // No trailheads if there are no cities.
4507  const int city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
4508  if( city_size <= 0 ) {
4509  return;
4510  }
4511 
4512  // Trailheads may be placed if all of the following are true:
4513  // 1. we're at a forest_trail_end_north/south/west/east,
4514  // 2. we're within trailhead_road_distance from an existing road
4515  // 3. rng rolls a success for our trailhead_chance from the configuration
4516  // 4. the trailhead special we've picked can be placed in the selected location
4517 
4518  const auto trailhead_close_to_road = [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & trailhead ) {
4519  bool close = false;
4520  for( const tripoint_om_omt &nearby_point : closest_points_first(
4521  trailhead,
4522  settings->forest_trail.trailhead_road_distance
4523  ) ) {
4524  if( check_ot( "road", ot_match_type::contains, nearby_point ) ) {
4525  close = true;
4526  }
4527  }
4528  return close;
4529  };
4530 
4531  const auto try_place_trailhead_special = [&]( const tripoint_om_omt & trail_end,
4532  const om_direction::type & dir ) {
4533  overmap_special_id trailhead = settings->forest_trail.trailheads.pick();
4534  if( one_in( settings->forest_trail.trailhead_chance ) &&
4535  trailhead_close_to_road( trail_end ) &&
4536  can_place_special( *trailhead, trail_end, dir, false ) ) {
4537  const city &nearest_city = get_nearest_city( trail_end );
4538  place_special( *trailhead, trail_end, dir, nearest_city, false, false );
4539  }
4540  };
4541 
4542  for( int i = 2; i < OMAPX - 2; i++ ) {
4543  for( int j = 2; j < OMAPY - 2; j++ ) {
4544  const tripoint_om_omt p( i, j, 0 );
4545  oter_id oter = ter( p );
4546  if( is_ot_match( "forest_trail_end", oter, ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
4547  try_place_trailhead_special( p, static_cast<om_direction::type>( oter->get_rotation() ) );
4548  }
4549  }
4550  }
4551 }
4552 
4553 void overmap::place_forests()
4554 {
4555  const oter_id default_oter_id( settings->default_oter[OVERMAP_DEPTH] );
4556  const om_noise::om_noise_layer_forest f( global_base_point(), g->get_seed() );
4557 
4558  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
4559  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4560  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4561  const oter_id &oter = ter( p );
4562 
4563  // At this point in the process, we only want to consider converting the terrain into
4564  // a forest if it's currently the default terrain type (e.g. a field).
4565  if( oter != default_oter_id ) {
4566  continue;
4567  }
4568 
4569  const float n = f.noise_at( p.xy() );
4570 
4571  // If the noise here meets our threshold, turn it into a forest.
4572  if( n + forest_size_adjust > settings->overmap_forest.noise_threshold_forest_thick ) {
4573  ter_set( p, oter_forest_thick );
4574  } else if( n + forest_size_adjust > settings->overmap_forest.noise_threshold_forest ) {
4575  ter_set( p, oter_forest );
4576  }
4577  }
4578  }
4579 }
4580 
4581 
4582 void overmap::place_lakes()
4583 {
4584  const om_noise::om_noise_layer_lake f( global_base_point(), g->get_seed() );
4585 
4586  const auto is_lake = [&]( const point_om_omt & p ) {
4587  // credit to ehughsbaird for thinking up this inbounds solution to infinite flood fill lag.
4588  bool inbounds = p.x() > -5 && p.y() > -5 && p.x() < OMAPX + 5 && p.y() < OMAPY + 5;
4589  if( !inbounds ) {
4590  return false;
4591  }
4592  return f.noise_at( p ) > settings->overmap_lake.noise_threshold_lake;
4593  };
4594 
4595  const oter_id lake_surface( "lake_surface" );
4596  const oter_id lake_shore( "lake_shore" );
4597  const oter_id lake_water_cube( "lake_water_cube" );
4598  const oter_id lake_bed( "lake_bed" );
4599 
4600  // We'll keep track of our visited lake points so we don't repeat the work.
4601  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> visited;
4602 
4603  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
4604  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
4605  point_om_omt seed_point( i, j );
4606  if( visited.find( seed_point ) != visited.end() ) {
4607  continue;
4608  }
4609 
4610  // It's a lake if it exceeds the noise threshold defined in the region settings.
4611  if( !is_lake( seed_point ) ) {
4612  continue;
4613  }
4614 
4615  // We're going to flood-fill our lake so that we can consider the entire lake when evaluating it
4616  // for placement, even when the lake runs off the edge of the current overmap.
4617  std::vector<point_om_omt> lake_points =
4618  ff::point_flood_fill_4_connected( seed_point, visited, is_lake );
4619 
4620  // If this lake doesn't exceed our minimum size threshold, then skip it. We can use this to
4621  // exclude the tiny lakes that don't provide interesting map features and exist mostly as a
4622  // noise artifact.
4623  if( lake_points.size() < static_cast<std::vector<point>::size_type>
4624  ( settings->overmap_lake.lake_size_min ) ) {
4625  continue;
4626  }
4627 
4628  // Build a set of "lake" points. We're actually going to combine both the lake points
4629  // we just found AND all of the rivers on the map, because we want our lakes to write
4630  // over any rivers that are placed already. Note that the assumption here is that river
4631  // overmap generation (e.g. place_rivers) runs BEFORE lake overmap generation.
4632  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> lake_set;
4633  for( auto &p : lake_points ) {
4634  lake_set.emplace( p );
4635  }
4636 
4637  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
4638  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4639  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4640  if( ter( p )->is_river() ) {
4641  lake_set.emplace( p.xy() );
4642  }
4643  }
4644  }
4645 
4646  // Iterate through all of our lake points, rejecting the ones that are out of bounds. For
4647  // those that are inbounds, look at the 8 adjacent locations and see if they are also part
4648  // of our lake points set. If they are, that means that this location is entirely surrounded
4649  // by lake and should be considered a lake surface. If at least one adjacent location is not
4650  // part of this lake points set, that means this location should be considered a lake shore.
4651  // Either way, make the determination and set the overmap terrain.
4652  for( auto &p : lake_points ) {
4653  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4654  continue;
4655  }
4656 
4657  bool shore = false;
4658  for( int ni = -1; ni <= 1 && !shore; ni++ ) {
4659  for( int nj = -1; nj <= 1 && !shore; nj++ ) {
4660  const point_om_omt n = p + point( ni, nj );
4661  if( lake_set.find( n ) == lake_set.end() ) {
4662  shore = true;
4663  }
4664  }
4665  }
4666 
4667  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, 0 ), shore ? lake_shore : lake_surface );
4668 
4669  // If this is not a shore, we'll make our subsurface lake cubes and beds.
4670  if( !shore ) {
4671  for( int z = -1; z > settings->overmap_lake.lake_depth; z-- ) {
4672  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, z ), lake_water_cube );
4673  }
4674  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, settings->overmap_lake.lake_depth ), lake_bed );
4675  }
4676  }
4677 
4678  // We're going to attempt to connect some points on this lake to the nearest river.
4679  const auto connect_lake_to_closest_river =
4680  [&]( const point_om_omt & lake_connection_point ) {
4681  int closest_distance = -1;
4682  point_om_omt closest_point;
4683  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
4684  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4685  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4686  if( !ter( p )->is_river() ) {
4687  continue;
4688  }
4689  const int distance = square_dist( lake_connection_point, p.xy() );
4690  if( distance < closest_distance || closest_distance < 0 ) {
4691  closest_point = p.xy();
4692  closest_distance = distance;
4693  }
4694  }
4695  }
4696 
4697  if( closest_distance > 0 ) {
4698  place_river( closest_point, lake_connection_point );
4699  }
4700  };
4701 
4702  // Get the north and south most points in our lake.
4703  auto north_south_most = std::minmax_element( lake_points.begin(), lake_points.end(),
4704  []( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4705  return lhs.y() < rhs.y();
4706  } );
4707 
4708  point_om_omt northmost = *north_south_most.first;
4709  point_om_omt southmost = *north_south_most.second;
4710 
4711  // It's possible that our northmost/southmost points in the lake are not on this overmap, because our
4712  // lake may extend across multiple overmaps.
4713  if( inbounds( northmost ) ) {
4714  connect_lake_to_closest_river( northmost );
4715  }
4716 
4717  if( inbounds( southmost ) ) {
4718  connect_lake_to_closest_river( southmost );
4719  }
4720  }
4721  }
4722 }
4723 
4724 // helper function for code deduplication, as it is needed multiple times
4725 float overmap::calculate_ocean_gradient( const point_om_omt &p, const point_abs_om this_om )
4726 {
4727  const int northern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_north;
