4728  const int eastern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_east;
4729  const int western_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_west;
4730  const int southern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_south;
4731 
4732  float ocean_adjust_N = 0.0f;
4733  float ocean_adjust_E = 0.0f;
4734  float ocean_adjust_W = 0.0f;
4735  float ocean_adjust_S = 0.0f;
4736  if( northern_ocean > 0 && this_om.y() <= northern_ocean * -1 ) {
4737  ocean_adjust_N = 0.0005f * static_cast<float>( OMAPY - p.y()
4738  + std::abs( ( this_om.y() + northern_ocean ) * OMAPY ) );
4739  }
4740  if( eastern_ocean > 0 && this_om.x() >= eastern_ocean ) {
4741  ocean_adjust_E = 0.0005f * static_cast<float>( p.x() + ( this_om.x() - eastern_ocean )
4742  * OMAPX );
4743  }
4744  if( western_ocean > 0 && this_om.x() <= western_ocean * -1 ) {
4745  ocean_adjust_W = 0.0005f * static_cast<float>( OMAPX - p.x()
4746  + std::abs( ( this_om.x() + western_ocean ) * OMAPX ) );
4747  }
4748  if( southern_ocean > 0 && this_om.y() >= southern_ocean ) {
4749  ocean_adjust_S = 0.0005f * static_cast<float>( p.y() + ( this_om.y() - southern_ocean ) * OMAPY );
4750  }
4751  return std::max( { ocean_adjust_N, ocean_adjust_E, ocean_adjust_W, ocean_adjust_S } );
4752 }
4753 
4754 void overmap::place_oceans()
4755 {
4756  int northern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_north;
4757  int eastern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_east;
4758  int western_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_west;
4759  int southern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_south;
4760 
4761  const om_noise::om_noise_layer_ocean f( global_base_point(), g->get_seed() );
4762  const point_abs_om this_om = pos();
4763 
4764  const auto is_ocean = [&]( const point_om_omt & p ) {
4765  // credit to ehughsbaird for thinking up this inbounds solution to infinite flood fill lag.
4766  if( northern_ocean == 0 && eastern_ocean == 0 && western_ocean == 0 && southern_ocean == 0 ) {
4767  // you know you could just turn oceans off in global_settings.json right?
4768  return false;
4769  }
4770  bool inbounds = p.x() > -5 && p.y() > -5 && p.x() < OMAPX + 5 && p.y() < OMAPY + 5;
4771  if( !inbounds ) {
4772  return false;
4773  }
4774  float ocean_adjust = calculate_ocean_gradient( p, this_om );
4775  if( ocean_adjust == 0.0f ) {
4776  // It's too soon! Too soon for an ocean!! ABORT!!!
4777  return false;
4778  }
4779  return f.noise_at( p ) + ocean_adjust > settings->overmap_ocean.noise_threshold_ocean;
4780  };
4781 
4782  const oter_id ocean_surface( "ocean_surface" );
4783  const oter_id ocean_shore( "ocean_shore" );
4784  const oter_id ocean_water_cube( "ocean_water_cube" );
4785  const oter_id ocean_bed( "ocean_bed" );
4786 
4787  // This code is repeated from is_lake(), see comments there for explanation.
4788  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> visited;
4789 
4790  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
4791  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
4792  point_om_omt seed_point( i, j );
4793  if( visited.find( seed_point ) != visited.end() ) {
4794  continue;
4795  }
4796 
4797  if( !is_ocean( seed_point ) ) {
4798  continue;
4799  }
4800 
4801  std::vector<point_om_omt> ocean_points =
4802  ff::point_flood_fill_4_connected( seed_point, visited, is_ocean );
4803 
4804  // Ocean size is checked like lake size, but minimum size is much bigger.
4805  // you could change this, if you want little tiny oceans all over the place.
4806  // I'm not sure why you'd want that. Use place_lakes, my friend.
4807  if( ocean_points.size() < static_cast<std::vector<point>::size_type>
4808  ( settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_size_min ) ) {
4809  continue;
4810  }
4811 
4812  std::unordered_set<point_om_omt> ocean_set;
4813  for( auto &p : ocean_points ) {
4814  ocean_set.emplace( p );
4815  }
4816 
4817  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
4818  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4819  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4820  if( ter( p )->is_river() ) {
4821  ocean_set.emplace( p.xy() );
4822  }
4823  }
4824  }
4825 
4826  for( auto &p : ocean_points ) {
4827  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
4828  continue;
4829  }
4830 
4831  bool shore = false;
4832  for( int ni = -1; ni <= 1 && !shore; ni++ ) {
4833  for( int nj = -1; nj <= 1 && !shore; nj++ ) {
4834  const point_om_omt n = p + point( ni, nj );
4835  if( ocean_set.find( n ) == ocean_set.end() ) {
4836  shore = true;
4837  }
4838  }
4839  }
4840 
4841  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, 0 ), shore ? ocean_shore : ocean_surface );
4842 
4843  if( !shore ) {
4844  for( int z = -1; z > settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_depth; z-- ) {
4845  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, z ), ocean_water_cube );
4846  }
4847  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_depth ), ocean_bed );
4848  }
4849  }
4850 
4851  // We're going to attempt to connect some points to the nearest river.
4852  // This isn't a lake but the code is the same, we can reuse it. Water is water.
4853  const auto connect_lake_to_closest_river =
4854  [&]( const point_om_omt & lake_connection_point ) {
4855  int closest_distance = -1;
4856  point_om_omt closest_point;
4857  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
4858  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
4859  const tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
4860  if( !ter( p )->is_river() ) {
4861  continue;
4862  }
4863  const int distance = square_dist( lake_connection_point, p.xy() );
4864  if( distance < closest_distance || closest_distance < 0 ) {
4865  closest_point = p.xy();
4866  closest_distance = distance;
4867  }
4868  }
4869  }
4870 
4871  if( closest_distance > 0 ) {
4872  place_river( closest_point, lake_connection_point );
4873  }
4874  };
4875 
4876  // Get the north and south most points in our ocean.
4877  auto north_south_most = std::minmax_element( ocean_points.begin(), ocean_points.end(),
4878  []( const point_om_omt & lhs, const point_om_omt & rhs ) {
4879  return lhs.y() < rhs.y();
4880  } );
4881 
4882  point_om_omt northmost = *north_south_most.first;
4883  point_om_omt southmost = *north_south_most.second;
4884 
4885  // It's possible that our northmost/southmost points in the lake are not on this overmap, because our
4886  // lake may extend across multiple overmaps.
4887  if( inbounds( northmost ) ) {
4888  connect_lake_to_closest_river( northmost );
4889  }
4890 
4891  if( inbounds( southmost ) ) {
4892  connect_lake_to_closest_river( southmost );
4893  }
4894  }
4895  }
4896 }
4897 
4898 void overmap::place_rivers( const overmap *north, const overmap *east, const overmap *south,
4899  const overmap *west )
4900 {
4901  if( settings->river_scale == 0.0 ) {
4902  return;
4903  }
4904  int river_chance = static_cast<int>( std::max( 1.0, 1.0 / settings->river_scale ) );
4905  int river_scale = static_cast<int>( std::max( 1.0, settings->river_scale ) );
4906  // West/North endpoints of rivers
4907  std::vector<point_om_omt> river_start;
4908  // East/South endpoints of rivers
4909  std::vector<point_om_omt> river_end;
4910 
4911  // Determine points where rivers & roads should connect w/ adjacent maps
4912  // optimized comparison.
4913 
4914  if( north != nullptr ) {
4915  for( int i = 2; i < OMAPX - 2; i++ ) {
4916  const tripoint_om_omt p_neighbour( i, OMAPY - 1, 0 );
4917  const tripoint_om_omt p_mine( i, 0, 0 );
4918 
4919  if( is_river( north->ter( p_neighbour ) ) ) {
4920  ter_set( p_mine, oter_river_center );
4921  }
4922  if( is_river( north->ter( p_neighbour ) ) &&
4923  is_river( north->ter( p_neighbour + point_east ) ) &&
4924  is_river( north->ter( p_neighbour + point_west ) ) ) {
4925  if( one_in( river_chance ) && ( river_start.empty() ||
4926  river_start[river_start.size() - 1].x() < ( i - 6 ) * river_scale ) ) {
4927  river_start.push_back( p_mine.xy() );
4928  }
4929  }
4930  }
4931  }
4932  size_t rivers_from_north = river_start.size();
4933  if( west != nullptr ) {
4934  for( int i = 2; i < OMAPY - 2; i++ ) {
4935  const tripoint_om_omt p_neighbour( OMAPX - 1, i, 0 );
4936  const tripoint_om_omt p_mine( 0, i, 0 );
4937 
4938  if( is_river( west->ter( p_neighbour ) ) ) {
4939  ter_set( p_mine, oter_river_center );
4940  }
4941  if( is_river( west->ter( p_neighbour ) ) &&
4942  is_river( west->ter( p_neighbour + point_north ) ) &&
4943  is_river( west->ter( p_neighbour + point_south ) ) ) {
4944  if( one_in( river_chance ) && ( river_start.size() == rivers_from_north ||
4945  river_start[river_start.size() - 1].y() < ( i - 6 ) * river_scale ) ) {
4946  river_start.push_back( p_mine.xy() );
4947  }
4948  }
4949  }
4950  }
4951  if( south != nullptr ) {
4952  for( int i = 2; i < OMAPX - 2; i++ ) {
4953  const tripoint_om_omt p_neighbour( i, 0, 0 );
4954  const tripoint_om_omt p_mine( i, OMAPY - 1, 0 );
4955 
4956  if( is_river( south->ter( p_neighbour ) ) ) {
4957  ter_set( p_mine, oter_river_center );
4958  }
4959  if( is_river( south->ter( p_neighbour ) ) &&
4960  is_river( south->ter( p_neighbour + point_east ) ) &&
4961  is_river( south->ter( p_neighbour + point_west ) ) ) {
4962  if( river_end.empty() ||
4963  river_end[river_end.size() - 1].x() < i - 6 ) {
4964  river_end.push_back( p_mine.xy() );
4965  }
4966  }
4967  }
4968  }
4969  size_t rivers_to_south = river_end.size();
4970  if( east != nullptr ) {
4971  for( int i = 2; i < OMAPY - 2; i++ ) {
4972  const tripoint_om_omt p_neighbour( 0, i, 0 );
4973  const tripoint_om_omt p_mine( OMAPX - 1, i, 0 );
4974 
4975  if( is_river( east->ter( p_neighbour ) ) ) {
4976  ter_set( p_mine, oter_river_center );
4977  }
4978  if( is_river( east->ter( p_neighbour ) ) &&
4979  is_river( east->ter( p_neighbour + point_north ) ) &&
4980  is_river( east->ter( p_neighbour + point_south ) ) ) {
4981  if( river_end.size() == rivers_to_south ||
4982  river_end[river_end.size() - 1].y() < i - 6 ) {
4983  river_end.push_back( p_mine.xy() );
4984  }
4985  }
4986  }
4987  }
4988 
4989  // Even up the start and end points of rivers. (difference of 1 is acceptable)
4990  // Also ensure there's at least one of each.
4991  std::vector<point_om_omt> new_rivers;
4992  if( north == nullptr || west == nullptr ) {
4993  while( river_start.empty() || river_start.size() + 1 < river_end.size() ) {
4994  new_rivers.clear();
4995  if( north == nullptr && one_in( river_chance ) ) {
4996  new_rivers.emplace_back( rng( 10, OMAPX - 11 ), 0 );
4997  }
4998  if( west == nullptr && one_in( river_chance ) ) {
4999  new_rivers.emplace_back( 0, rng( 10, OMAPY - 11 ) );
5000  }
5001  river_start.push_back( random_entry( new_rivers ) );
5002  }
5003  }
5004  if( south == nullptr || east == nullptr ) {
5005  while( river_end.empty() || river_end.size() + 1 < river_start.size() ) {
5006  new_rivers.clear();
5007  if( south == nullptr && one_in( river_chance ) ) {
5008  new_rivers.emplace_back( rng( 10, OMAPX - 11 ), OMAPY - 1 );
5009  }
5010  if( east == nullptr && one_in( river_chance ) ) {
5011  new_rivers.emplace_back( OMAPX - 1, rng( 10, OMAPY - 11 ) );
5012  }
5013  river_end.push_back( random_entry( new_rivers ) );
5014  }
5015  }
5016 
5017  // Now actually place those rivers.
5018  if( river_start.size() > river_end.size() && !river_end.empty() ) {
5019  std::vector<point_om_omt> river_end_copy = river_end;
5020  while( !river_start.empty() ) {
5021  const point_om_omt start = random_entry_removed( river_start );
5022  if( !river_end.empty() ) {
5023  place_river( start, river_end[0] );
5024  river_end.erase( river_end.begin() );
5025  } else {
5026  place_river( start, random_entry( river_end_copy ) );
5027  }
5028  }
5029  } else if( river_end.size() > river_start.size() && !river_start.empty() ) {
5030  std::vector<point_om_omt> river_start_copy = river_start;
5031  while( !river_end.empty() ) {
5032  const point_om_omt end = random_entry_removed( river_end );
5033  if( !river_start.empty() ) {
5034  place_river( river_start[0], end );
5035  river_start.erase( river_start.begin() );
5036  } else {
5037  place_river( random_entry( river_start_copy ), end );
5038  }
5039  }
5040  } else if( !river_end.empty() ) {
5041  if( river_start.size() != river_end.size() ) {
5042  river_start.emplace_back( rng( OMAPX / 4, ( OMAPX * 3 ) / 4 ),
5043  rng( OMAPY / 4, ( OMAPY * 3 ) / 4 ) );
5044  }
5045  for( size_t i = 0; i < river_start.size(); i++ ) {
5046  place_river( river_start[i], river_end[i] );
5047  }
5048  }
5049 }
5050 
5051 void overmap::place_swamps()
5052 {
5053  // Buffer our river terrains by a variable radius and increment a counter for the location each
5054  // time it's included in a buffer. It's a floodplain that we'll then intersect later with some
5055  // noise to adjust how frequently it occurs.
5056  std::unique_ptr<cata::mdarray<int, point_om_omt>> floodptr =
5057  std::make_unique<cata::mdarray<int, point_om_omt>>( 0 );
5058  cata::mdarray<int, point_om_omt> &floodplain = *floodptr;
5059  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
5060  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
5061  const tripoint_om_omt pos( x, y, 0 );
5062  if( is_ot_match( "river", ter_unsafe( pos ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5063  std::vector<point_om_omt> buffered_points =
5064  closest_points_first(
5065  pos.xy(),
5066  rng( settings->overmap_forest.river_floodplain_buffer_distance_min,
5067  settings->overmap_forest.river_floodplain_buffer_distance_max ) );
5068  for( const point_om_omt &p : buffered_points ) {
5069  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
5070  continue;
5071  }
5072  floodplain[p] += 1;
5073  }
5074  }
5075  }
5076  }
5077 
5078  // Get a layer of noise to use in conjunction with our river buffered floodplain.
5079  const om_noise::om_noise_layer_floodplain f( global_base_point(), g->get_seed() );
5080 
5081  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
5082  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
5083  const tripoint_om_omt pos( x, y, 0 );
5084  // If this location isn't a forest, there's nothing to do here. We'll only grow swamps in existing
5085  // forest terrain.
5086  if( !is_ot_match( "forest", ter( pos ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5087  continue;
5088  }
5089 
5090  // If this was a part of our buffered floodplain, and the noise here meets the threshold, and the one_in rng
5091  // triggers, then we should flood this location and make it a swamp.
5092  const bool should_flood = ( floodplain[x][y] > 0 && !one_in( floodplain[x][y] ) && f.noise_at( { x, y } )
5093  > settings->overmap_forest.noise_threshold_swamp_adjacent_water );
5094 
5095  // If this location meets our isolated swamp threshold, regardless of floodplain values, we'll make it
5096  // into a swamp.
5097  const bool should_isolated_swamp = f.noise_at( pos.xy() ) >
5098  settings->overmap_forest.noise_threshold_swamp_isolated;
5099  if( should_flood || should_isolated_swamp ) {
5100  ter_set( pos, oter_forest_water );
5101  }
5102  }
5103  }
5104 }
5105 
5106 void overmap::place_roads( const overmap *north, const overmap *east, const overmap *south,
5107  const overmap *west )
5108 {
5109  int op_city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
5110  if( op_city_size <= 0 ) {
5111  return;
5112  }
5113  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_inter_city_road =
5114  settings->overmap_connection.inter_city_road_connection;
5115  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> &roads_out = connections_out[overmap_connection_inter_city_road];
5116 
5117  // At least 3 exit points, to guarantee road continuity across overmaps
5118  if( roads_out.size() < 3 ) {
5119 
5120  std::array<const overmap *, 4> neighbors = { east, south, west, north };
5121  static constexpr std::array<point, 4> neighbor_deltas = {
5122  point_east, point_south, point_west, point_north
5123  };
5124 
5125  // x and y coordinates for a point on the edge in each direction
5126  // -1 represents a variable one dimensional coordinate along that edge
5127  // east == point( OMAPX - 1, n ); north == point( n, 0 );
5128  static constexpr std::array<int, 4> edge_coords_x = {OMAPX - 1, -1, 0, -1};
5129  static constexpr std::array<int, 4> edge_coords_y = {-1, OMAPY - 1, -1, 0};
5130 
5131  // all the points on an edge except the 10 on each end
5132  std::array < int, OMAPX - 20 > omap_num;
5133  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX - 20; i++ ) {
5134  omap_num[i] = i + 10;
5135  }
5136 
5137  std::array < size_t, 4 > dirs = {0, 1, 2, 3};
5138  std::shuffle( dirs.begin(), dirs.end(), rng_get_engine() );
5139 
5140  for( size_t dir : dirs ) {
5141  // only potentially add a new random connection toward ungenerated overmaps
5142  if( neighbors[dir] == nullptr ) {
5143  std::shuffle( omap_num.begin(), omap_num.end(), rng_get_engine() );
5144  for( const int &i : omap_num ) {
5145  tripoint_om_omt tmp = tripoint_om_omt(
5146  edge_coords_x[dir] >= 0 ? edge_coords_x[dir] : i,
5147  edge_coords_y[dir] >= 0 ? edge_coords_y[dir] : i,
5148  0 );
5149  // Make sure these points don't conflict with rivers.
5150  if( !( is_river( ter( tmp ) ) ||
5151  // avoid adjacent rivers
5152  // east/west of a point on the north/south edge, and vice versa
5153  is_river( ter( tmp + neighbor_deltas[( dir + 1 ) % 4] ) ) ||
5154  is_river( ter( tmp + neighbor_deltas[( dir + 3 ) % 4] ) ) ) ) {
5155  roads_out.push_back( tmp );
5156  break;
5157  }
5158  }
5159  if( roads_out.size() == 3 ) {
5160  break;
5161  }
5162  }
5163  }
5164  }
5165 
5166  std::vector<point_om_omt> road_points; // cities and roads_out together
5167  // Compile our master list of roads; it's less messy if roads_out is first
5168  road_points.reserve( roads_out.size() + cities.size() );
5169  for( const auto &elem : roads_out ) {
5170  road_points.emplace_back( elem.xy() );
5171  }
5172  for( const city &elem : cities ) {
5173  road_points.emplace_back( elem.pos );
5174  }
5175 
5176  // And finally connect them via roads.
5177  connect_closest_points( road_points, 0, *overmap_connection_inter_city_road );
5178 }
5179 
5180 void overmap::place_railroads( const overmap *north, const overmap *east, const overmap *south,
5181  const overmap *west )
5182 {
5183  // no railroads if there are no cities
5184  int op_city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
5185  if( op_city_size <= 0 ) {
5186  return;
5187  }
5188  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_local_railroad =
5189  settings->overmap_connection.rail_connection;
5190  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> &railroads_out = connections_out[overmap_connection_local_railroad];
5191 
5192  // At least 3 exit points, to guarantee railroad continuity across overmaps
5193  if( railroads_out.size() < 3 ) {
5194 
5195  std::array<const overmap *, 4> neighbors = { east, south, west, north };
5196  static constexpr std::array<point, 4> neighbor_deltas = {
5197  point_east, point_south, point_west, point_north
5198  };
5199 
5200  // x and y coordinates for a point on the edge in each direction
5201  // -1 represents a variable one dimensional coordinate along that edge
5202  // east == point( OMAPX - 1, n ); north == point( n, 0 );
5203  static constexpr std::array<int, 4> edge_coords_x = {OMAPX - 1, -1, 0, -1};
5204  static constexpr std::array<int, 4> edge_coords_y = {-1, OMAPY - 1, -1, 0};
5205 
5206  // all the points on an edge except the 10 on each end
5207  std::array < int, OMAPX - 20 > omap_num;
5208  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX - 20; i++ ) {
5209  omap_num[i] = i + 10;
5210  }
5211 
5212  std::array < size_t, 4 > dirs = {0, 1, 2, 3};
5213  std::shuffle( dirs.begin(), dirs.end(), rng_get_engine() );
5214 
5215  for( size_t dir : dirs ) {
5216  // only potentially add a new random connection toward ungenerated overmaps
5217  if( neighbors[dir] == nullptr ) {
5218  std::shuffle( omap_num.begin(), omap_num.end(), rng_get_engine() );
5219  for( const int &i : omap_num ) {
5220  tripoint_om_omt tmp = tripoint_om_omt(
5221  edge_coords_x[dir] >= 0 ? edge_coords_x[dir] : i,
5222  edge_coords_y[dir] >= 0 ? edge_coords_y[dir] : i,
5223  0 );
5224  // Make sure these points don't conflict with rivers.
5225  if( !( is_river( ter( tmp ) ) ||
5226  // avoid adjacent rivers
5227  // east/west of a point on the north/south edge, and vice versa
5228  is_river( ter( tmp + neighbor_deltas[( dir + 1 ) % 4] ) ) ||
5229  is_river( ter( tmp + neighbor_deltas[( dir + 3 ) % 4] ) ) ) ) {
5230  railroads_out.push_back( tmp );
5231  break;
5232  }
5233  }
5234  if( railroads_out.size() == 3 ) {
5235  break;
5236  }
5237  }
5238  }
5239  }
5240 
5241  std::vector<point_om_omt> railroad_points; // cities and railroads_out together
5242  // Compile our master list of railroads; it's less messy if railroads_out is first
5243  railroad_points.reserve( railroads_out.size() + cities.size() );
5244  for( const auto &elem : railroads_out ) {
5245  railroad_points.emplace_back( elem.xy() );
5246  }
5247  for( const city &elem : cities ) {
5248  // place railroads in random point around the center of the city
5249  railroad_points.emplace_back( random_entry(
5250  points_in_radius( tripoint_om_omt( elem.pos, 0 ), elem.size * 4 ) ).xy()
5251  );
5252  }
5253 
5254  // And finally connect them via railroads.
5255  connect_closest_points( railroad_points, 0, *overmap_connection_local_railroad );
5256 }
5257 
5258 void overmap::place_river( const point_om_omt &pa, const point_om_omt &pb )
5259 {
5260  int river_chance = static_cast<int>( std::max( 1.0, 1.0 / settings->river_scale ) );
5261  int river_scale = static_cast<int>( std::max( 1.0, settings->river_scale ) );
5262  point_om_omt p2( pa );
5263  do {
5264  p2.x() += rng( -1, 1 );
5265  p2.y() += rng( -1, 1 );
5266  if( p2.x() < 0 ) {
5267  p2.x() = 0;
5268  }
5269  if( p2.x() > OMAPX - 1 ) {
5270  p2.x() = OMAPX - 1;
5271  }
5272  if( p2.y() < 0 ) {
5273  p2.y() = 0;
5274  }
5275  if( p2.y() > OMAPY - 1 ) {
5276  p2.y() = OMAPY - 1;
5277  }
5278  for( int i = -1 * river_scale; i <= 1 * river_scale; i++ ) {
5279  for( int j = -1 * river_scale; j <= 1 * river_scale; j++ ) {
5280  tripoint_om_omt p( p2 + point( j, i ), 0 );
5281  if( p.y() >= 0 && p.y() < OMAPY && p.x() >= 0 && p.x() < OMAPX ) {
5282  if( !ter( p )->is_lake() && one_in( river_chance ) ) {
5283  ter_set( p, oter_river_center );
5284  }
5285  }
5286  }
5287  }
5288  if( pb.x() > p2.x() && ( rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPX * 1.2 ) - 1 ) < pb.x() - p2.x() ||
5289  ( rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPX * 0.2 ) - 1 ) > pb.x() - p2.x() &&
5290  rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPY * 0.2 ) - 1 ) > std::abs( pb.y() - p2.y() ) ) ) ) {
5291  p2.x()++;
5292  }
5293  if( pb.x() < p2.x() && ( rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPX * 1.2 ) - 1 ) < p2.x() - pb.x() ||
5294  ( rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPX * 0.2 ) - 1 ) > p2.x() - pb.x() &&
5295  rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPY * 0.2 ) - 1 ) > std::abs( pb.y() - p2.y() ) ) ) ) {
5296  p2.x()--;
5297  }
5298  if( pb.y() > p2.y() && ( rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPY * 1.2 ) - 1 ) < pb.y() - p2.y() ||
5299  ( rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPY * 0.2 ) - 1 ) > pb.y() - p2.y() &&
5300  rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPX * 0.2 ) - 1 ) > std::abs( p2.x() - pb.x() ) ) ) ) {
5301  p2.y()++;
5302  }
5303  if( pb.y() < p2.y() && ( rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPY * 1.2 ) - 1 ) < p2.y() - pb.y() ||
5304  ( rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPY * 0.2 ) - 1 ) > p2.y() - pb.y() &&
5305  rng( 0, static_cast<int>( OMAPX * 0.2 ) - 1 ) > std::abs( p2.x() - pb.x() ) ) ) ) {
5306  p2.y()--;
5307  }
5308  p2.x() += rng( -1, 1 );
5309  p2.y() += rng( -1, 1 );
5310  if( p2.x() < 0 ) {
5311  p2.x() = 0;
5312  }
5313  if( p2.x() > OMAPX - 1 ) {
5314  p2.x() = OMAPX - 2;
5315  }
5316  if( p2.y() < 0 ) {
5317  p2.y() = 0;
5318  }
5319  if( p2.y() > OMAPY - 1 ) {
5320  p2.y() = OMAPY - 1;
5321  }
5322  for( int i = -1 * river_scale; i <= 1 * river_scale; i++ ) {
5323  for( int j = -1 * river_scale; j <= 1 * river_scale; j++ ) {
5324  // We don't want our riverbanks touching the edge of the map for many reasons
5325  tripoint_om_omt p( p2 + point( j, i ), 0 );
5326  if( inbounds( p, 1 ) ||
5327  // UNLESS, of course, that's where the river is headed!
5328  ( std::abs( pb.y() - p.y() ) < 4 && std::abs( pb.x() - p.x() ) < 4 ) ) {
5329  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
5330  continue;
5331  }
5332 
5333  if( !ter( p )->is_lake() && one_in( river_chance ) ) {
5334  ter_set( p, oter_river_center );
5335  }
5336  }
5337  }
5338  }
5339  } while( pb != p2 );
5340 }
5341 
5342 void overmap::calculate_forestosity()
5343 {
5344  float northern_forest_increase = get_option<float>( "OVERMAP_FOREST_INCREASE_NORTH" );
5345  float eastern_forest_increase = get_option<float>( "OVERMAP_FOREST_INCREASE_EAST" );
5346  float western_forest_increase = get_option<float>( "OVERMAP_FOREST_INCREASE_WEST" );
5347  float southern_forest_increase = get_option<float>( "OVERMAP_FOREST_INCREASE_SOUTH" );
5348  const point_abs_om this_om = pos();
5349  if( western_forest_increase != 0 && this_om.x() < 0 ) {
5350  forest_size_adjust -= this_om.x() * western_forest_increase;
5351  }
5352  if( northern_forest_increase != 0 && this_om.y() < 0 ) {
5353  forest_size_adjust -= this_om.y() * northern_forest_increase;
5354  }
5355  if( eastern_forest_increase != 0 && this_om.x() > 0 ) {
5356  forest_size_adjust += this_om.x() * eastern_forest_increase;
5357  }
5358  if( southern_forest_increase != 0 && this_om.y() > 0 ) {
5359  forest_size_adjust += this_om.y() * southern_forest_increase;
5360  }
5361  forestosity = forest_size_adjust * 25.0f;
5362  //debugmsg( "forestosity = %1.2f at OM %i, %i", forestosity, this_om.x(), this_om.y() );
5363  // make sure forest size never totally overwhelms the map
5364  forest_size_adjust = std::min( forest_size_adjust,
5365  get_option<float>( "OVERMAP_FOREST_LIMIT" ) - static_cast<float>
5366  ( settings->overmap_forest.noise_threshold_forest ) );
5367 }
5368 
5369 void overmap::calculate_urbanity()
5370 {
5371  int op_city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
5372  if( op_city_size <= 0 ) {
5373  return;
5374  }
5375  int northern_urban_increase = get_option<int>( "OVERMAP_URBAN_INCREASE_NORTH" );
5376  int eastern_urban_increase = get_option<int>( "OVERMAP_URBAN_INCREASE_EAST" );
5377  int western_urban_increase = get_option<int>( "OVERMAP_URBAN_INCREASE_WEST" );
5378  int southern_urban_increase = get_option<int>( "OVERMAP_URBAN_INCREASE_SOUTH" );
5379  if( northern_urban_increase == 0 && eastern_urban_increase == 0 && western_urban_increase == 0 &&
5380  southern_urban_increase == 0 ) {
5381  return;
5382  }
5383  float urbanity_adj = 0.0f;
5384 
5385  const point_abs_om this_om = pos();
5386  if( northern_urban_increase != 0 && this_om.y() < 0 ) {
5387  urbanity_adj -= this_om.y() * northern_urban_increase / 10.0f;
5388  // add some falloff to the sides, keeping cities larger but breaking up the megacity a bit.
5389  // Doesn't apply if we expect megacity in those directions as well.
5390  if( this_om.x() < 0 && western_urban_increase == 0 ) {
5391  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.x() / -2.0f, 1.0f );
5392  }
5393  if( this_om.x() > 0 && eastern_urban_increase == 0 ) {
5394  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.x() / 2.0f, 1.0f );
5395  }
5396  }
5397  if( eastern_urban_increase != 0 && this_om.x() > 0 ) {
5398  urbanity_adj += this_om.x() * eastern_urban_increase / 10.0f;
5399  if( this_om.y() < 0 && northern_urban_increase == 0 ) {
5400  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.y() / -2.0f, 1.0f );
5401  }
5402  if( this_om.y() > 0 && southern_urban_increase == 0 ) {
5403  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.y() / 2.0f, 1.0f );
5404  }
5405  }
5406  if( western_urban_increase != 0 && this_om.x() < 0 ) {
5407  urbanity_adj -= this_om.x() * western_urban_increase / 10.0f;
5408  if( this_om.y() < 0 && northern_urban_increase == 0 ) {
5409  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.y() / -2.0f, 1.0f );
5410  }
5411  if( this_om.y() > 0 && southern_urban_increase == 0 ) {
5412  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.y() / 2.0f, 1.0f );
5413  }
5414  }
5415  if( southern_urban_increase != 0 && this_om.y() > 0 ) {
5416  urbanity_adj += this_om.y() * southern_urban_increase / 10.0f;
5417  if( this_om.x() < 0 && western_urban_increase == 0 ) {
5418  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.x() / -2.0f, 1.0f );
5419  }
5420  if( this_om.x() > 0 && eastern_urban_increase == 0 ) {
5421  urbanity_adj /= std::max( this_om.x() / 2.0f, 1.0f );
5422  }
5423  }
5424  urbanity = static_cast<int>( urbanity_adj );
5425  //debugmsg( "urbanity = %i at OM %i, %i", urbanity, this_om.x(), this_om.y() );
5426 }
5427 
5428 /*: the root is overmap::place_cities()
5429 20:50 <kevingranade>: which is at overmap.cpp:1355 or so
5430 20:51 <kevingranade>: the key is cs = rng(4, 17), setting the "size" of the city
5431 20:51 <kevingranade>: which is roughly it's radius in overmap tiles
5432 20:52 <kevingranade>: then later overmap::place_mongroups() is called
5433 20:52 <kevingranade>: which creates a mongroup with radius city_size * 2.5 and population city_size * 80
5434 20:53 <kevingranade>: tadaa
5435 
5436 spawns happen at... <cue Clue music>
5437 20:56 <kevingranade>: game:pawn_mon() in game.cpp:7380*/
5438 void overmap::place_cities()
5439 {
5440  int op_city_spacing = get_option<int>( "CITY_SPACING" );
5441  int op_city_size = get_option<int>( "CITY_SIZE" );
5442  int max_urbanity = get_option<int>( "OVERMAP_MAXIMUM_URBANITY" );
5443  if( op_city_size <= 0 ) {
5444  return;
5445  }
5446  // make sure city size adjust is never high enough to drop op_city_size below 2
5447  int city_size_adjust = std::min( urbanity - static_cast<int>( forestosity / 2.0f ),
5448  -1 * op_city_size + 2 );
5449  int city_space_adjust = urbanity / 2;
5450  int max_city_size = std::min( op_city_size + city_size_adjust, op_city_size * max_urbanity );
5451  if( max_city_size < op_city_size ) {
5452  // funny things happen if max_city_size is less than op_city_size.
5453  max_city_size = op_city_size;
5454  }
5455  if( op_city_spacing > 0 ) {
5456  city_space_adjust = std::min( city_space_adjust, op_city_spacing - 2 );
5457  op_city_spacing = op_city_spacing - city_space_adjust + static_cast<int>( forestosity );
5458  }
5459  // make sure not to get too extreme on the spacing if you go way far.
5460  op_city_spacing = std::min( op_city_spacing, 10 );
5461 
5462  // spacing dictates how much of the map is covered in cities
5463  // city | cities | size N cities per overmap
5464  // spacing | % of map | 2 | 4 | 8 | 12 | 16
5465  // 0 | ~99 |2025 | 506 | 126 | 56 | 31
5466  // 1 | 50 |1012 | 253 | 63 | 28 | 15
5467  // 2 | 25 | 506 | 126 | 31 | 14 | 7
5468  // 3 | 12 | 253 | 63 | 15 | 7 | 3
5469  // 4 | 6 | 126 | 31 | 7 | 3 | 1
5470  // 5 | 3 | 63 | 15 | 3 | 1 | 0
5471  // 6 | 1 | 31 | 7 | 1 | 0 | 0
5472  // 7 | 0 | 15 | 3 | 0 | 0 | 0
5473  // 8 | 0 | 7 | 1 | 0 | 0 | 0
5474 
5475  const double omts_per_overmap = OMAPX * OMAPY;
5476  const double city_map_coverage_ratio = 1.0 / std::pow( 2.0, op_city_spacing );
5477  const double omts_per_city = ( op_city_size * 2 + 1 ) * ( max_city_size * 2 + 1 ) * 3 / 4.0;
5478 
5479  // how many cities on this overmap?
5480  int num_cities_on_this_overmap = 0;
5481  std::vector<city> cities_to_place;
5482  for( const city &c : city::get_all() ) {
5483  if( c.pos_om == pos() ) {
5484  num_cities_on_this_overmap++;
5485  cities_to_place.emplace_back( c );
5486  }
5487  }
5488 
5489  const bool use_random_cities = city::get_all().empty();
5490 
5491  // Random cities if no cities were defined in regional settings
5492  if( use_random_cities ) {
5493  num_cities_on_this_overmap = roll_remainder( omts_per_overmap * city_map_coverage_ratio /
5494  omts_per_city );
5495  }
5496 
5497  const overmap_connection_id &overmap_connection_intra_city_road =
5498  settings->overmap_connection.intra_city_road_connection;
5499  const overmap_connection &local_road( *overmap_connection_intra_city_road );
5500 
5501  // if there is only a single free tile, the probability of NOT finding it after MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS attempts
5502  // is (1 - 1/(OMAPX * OMAPY))^MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS ≈ 36% for the OMAPX=OMAPY=180 and MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS=OMAPX * OMAPY
5503  const int MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS = 50;//OMAPX * OMAPY;
5504  int placement_attempts = 0;
5505 
5506  // place a seed for num_cities_on_this_overmap cities, and maybe one more
5507  while( cities.size() < static_cast<size_t>( num_cities_on_this_overmap ) &&
5508  placement_attempts < MAX_PLACEMENT_ATTEMPTS ) {
5509  placement_attempts++;
5510 
5511  tripoint_om_omt p;
5512  city tmp;
5513  tmp.pos_om = pos();
5514  if( use_random_cities ) {
5515  // randomly make some cities smaller or larger
5516  int size = rng( op_city_size - 1, max_city_size );
5517  if( one_in( 3 ) ) { // 33% tiny
5518  size = size * 1 / 3;
5519  } else if( one_in( 2 ) ) { // 33% small
5520  size = size * 2 / 3;
5521  } else if( one_in( 2 ) ) { // 17% large
5522  size = size * 3 / 2;
5523  } else { // 17% huge
5524  size = size * 2;
5525  }
5526  // Ensure that cities are at least size 2, as city of size 1 is just a crossroad with no buildings at all
5527  size = std::max( size, 2 );
5528  size = std::min( size, 55 );
5529  // TODO: put cities closer to the edge when they can span overmaps
5530  // don't draw cities across the edge of the map, they will get clipped
5531  point_om_omt c( rng( size - 1, OMAPX - size ), rng( size - 1, OMAPY - size ) );
5532  p = tripoint_om_omt( c, 0 );
5533  if( ter( p ) == settings->default_oter[OVERMAP_DEPTH] ) {
5534  placement_attempts = 0;
5535  ter_set( p, oter_road_nesw ); // every city starts with an intersection
5536  tmp.pos = p.xy();
5537  tmp.size = size;
5538  }
5539  } else {
5540  placement_attempts = 0;
5541  tmp = random_entry( cities_to_place );
5542  p = tripoint_om_omt( tmp.pos, 0 );
5543  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( tmp.pos, 0 ), oter_road_nesw );
5544  }
5545  if( placement_attempts == 0 ) {
5546  cities.push_back( tmp );
5547  const om_direction::type start_dir = om_direction::random();
5548  om_direction::type cur_dir = start_dir;
5549 
5550  do {
5551  build_city_street( local_road, tmp.pos, tmp.size, cur_dir, tmp );
5552  } while( ( cur_dir = om_direction::turn_right( cur_dir ) ) != start_dir );
5553  }
5554  }
5555 }
5556 
5557 overmap_special_id overmap::pick_random_building_to_place( int town_dist, int town_size ) const
5558 {
5559  const city_settings &city_spec = settings->city_spec;
5560  int shop_radius = city_spec.shop_radius;
5561  int park_radius = city_spec.park_radius;
5562 
5563  int shop_sigma = city_spec.shop_sigma;
5564  int park_sigma = city_spec.park_sigma;
5565 
5566  //Normally distribute shops and parks
5567  //Clamp at 1/2 radius to prevent houses from spawning in the city center.
5568  //Parks are nearly guaranteed to have a non-zero chance of spawning anywhere in the city.
5569  int shop_normal = shop_radius;
5570  if( shop_sigma > 0 ) {
5571  shop_normal = std::max( shop_normal, static_cast<int>( normal_roll( shop_radius, shop_sigma ) ) );
5572  }
5573  int park_normal = park_radius;
5574  if( park_sigma > 0 ) {
5575  park_normal = std::max( park_normal, static_cast<int>( normal_roll( park_radius, park_sigma ) ) );
5576  }
5577  auto building_type_to_pick = [&]() {
5578  if( shop_normal > town_dist ) {
5579  return std::mem_fn( &city_settings::pick_shop );
5580  } else if( park_normal > town_dist ) {
5581  return std::mem_fn( &city_settings::pick_park );
5582  } else {
5583  return std::mem_fn( &city_settings::pick_house );
5584  }
5585  };
5586  auto pick_building = building_type_to_pick();
5587  overmap_special_id ret;
5588  do {
5589  ret = pick_building( city_spec );
5590  } while( !ret->get_constraints().city_size.contains( town_size ) );
5591  return ret;
5592 }
5593 
5594 void overmap::place_building( const tripoint_om_omt &p, om_direction::type dir,
5595  const city &town )
5596 {
5597  const tripoint_om_omt building_pos = p + om_direction::displace( dir );
5598  const om_direction::type building_dir = om_direction::opposite( dir );
5599 
5600  const int town_dist = ( trig_dist( building_pos.xy(), town.pos ) * 100 ) / std::max( town.size, 1 );
5601 
5602  for( size_t retries = 10; retries > 0; --retries ) {
5603  const overmap_special_id building_tid = pick_random_building_to_place( town_dist, town.size );
5604  if( can_place_special( *building_tid, building_pos, building_dir, false ) ) {
5605  place_special( *building_tid, building_pos, building_dir, town, false, false );
5606  break;
5607  }
5608  }
5609 }
5610 
5611 void overmap::build_city_street(
5612  const overmap_connection &connection, const point_om_omt &p, int cs,
5613  om_direction::type dir, const city &town, int block_width )
5614 {
5615  int c = cs;
5616  int croad = cs;
5617 
5618  if( dir == om_direction::type::invalid ) {
5619  debugmsg( "Invalid road direction." );
5620  return;
5621  }
5622 
5623  const pf::directed_path<point_om_omt> street_path = lay_out_street( connection, p, dir, cs + 1 );
5624 
5625  if( street_path.nodes.size() <= 1 ) {
5626  return; // Don't bother.
5627  }
5628  // Build the actual street.
5629  build_connection( connection, street_path, 0 );
5630  // Grow in the stated direction, sprouting off sub-roads and placing buildings as we go.
5631  const auto from = std::next( street_path.nodes.begin() );
5632  const auto to = street_path.nodes.end();
5633 
5634  //Alternate wide and thin blocks
5635  int new_width = block_width == 2 ? rng( 3, 5 ) : 2;
5636 
5637  for( auto iter = from; iter != to; ++iter ) {
5638  --c;
5639 
5640  const tripoint_om_omt rp( iter->pos, 0 );
5641  if( c >= 2 && c < croad - block_width ) {
5642  croad = c;
5643  int left = cs - rng( 1, 3 );
5644  int right = cs - rng( 1, 3 );
5645 
5646  //Remove 1 length road nubs
5647  if( left == 1 ) {
5648  left++;
5649  }
5650  if( right == 1 ) {
5651  right++;
5652  }
5653 
5654  build_city_street( connection, iter->pos, left, om_direction::turn_left( dir ),
5655  town, new_width );
5656 
5657  build_city_street( connection, iter->pos, right, om_direction::turn_right( dir ),
5658  town, new_width );
5659 
5660  const oter_id &oter = ter( rp );
5661  // TODO: Get rid of the hardcoded terrain ids.
5662  if( one_in( 2 ) && oter->get_line() == 15 && oter->type_is( oter_type_id( "road" ) ) ) {
5663  ter_set( rp, oter_road_nesw_manhole.id() );
5664  }
5665  }
5666 
5667  if( !one_in( BUILDINGCHANCE ) ) {
5668  place_building( rp, om_direction::turn_left( dir ), town );
5669  }
5670  if( !one_in( BUILDINGCHANCE ) ) {
5671  place_building( rp, om_direction::turn_right( dir ), town );
5672  }
5673  }
5674 
5675  // If we're big, make a right turn at the edge of town.
5676  // Seems to make little neighborhoods.
5677  cs -= rng( 1, 3 );
5678 
5679  if( cs >= 2 && c == 0 ) {
5680  const auto &last_node = street_path.nodes.back();
5681  const om_direction::type rnd_dir = om_direction::turn_random( dir );
5682  build_city_street( connection, last_node.pos, cs, rnd_dir, town );
5683  if( one_in( 5 ) ) {
5684  build_city_street( connection, last_node.pos, cs, om_direction::opposite( rnd_dir ),
5685  town, new_width );
5686  }
5687  }
5688 }
5689 
5690 bool overmap::build_lab(
5691  const tripoint_om_omt &p, int s, std::vector<point_om_omt> *lab_train_points,
5692  const std::string &prefix, int train_odds )
5693 {
5694  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> generated_lab;
5695  const oter_id labt( prefix + "lab" );
5696  const oter_id labt_stairs( labt.id().str() + "_stairs" );
5697  const oter_id labt_core( labt.id().str() + "_core" );
5698  const oter_id labt_finale( labt.id().str() + "_finale" );
5699  const oter_id labt_ants( "ants_lab" );
5700  const oter_id labt_ants_stairs( "ants_lab_stairs" );
5701 
5702  ter_set( p, labt );
5703  generated_lab.push_back( p );
5704 
5705  // maintain a list of potential new lab maps
5706  // grows outwards from previously placed lab maps
5707  std::set<tripoint_om_omt> candidates;
5708  candidates.insert( { p + point_north, p + point_east, p + point_south, p + point_west } );
5709  while( !candidates.empty() ) {
5710  const tripoint_om_omt cand = *candidates.begin();
5711  candidates.erase( candidates.begin() );
5712  if( !inbounds( cand ) ) {
5713  continue;
5714  }
5715  const int dist = manhattan_dist( p.xy(), cand.xy() );
5716  if( dist <= s * 2 ) { // increase radius to compensate for sparser new algorithm
5717  int dist_increment = s > 3 ? 3 : 2; // Determines at what distance the odds of placement decreases
5718  if( one_in( dist / dist_increment + 1 ) ) { // odds diminish farther away from the stairs
5719  // make an ants lab if it's a basic lab and ants were there before.
5720  if( prefix.empty() && check_ot( "ants", ot_match_type::type, cand ) ) {
5721  // skip over a queen's chamber.
5722  if( ter( cand )->get_type_id() != oter_type_ants_queen ) {
5723  ter_set( cand, labt_ants );
5724  }
5725  } else {
5726  ter_set( cand, labt );
5727  }
5728  generated_lab.push_back( cand );
5729  // add new candidates, don't backtrack
5730  for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
5731  const tripoint_om_omt new_cand = cand + offset;
5732  const int new_dist = manhattan_dist( p.xy(), new_cand.xy() );
5733  if( ter( new_cand ) != labt && new_dist > dist ) {
5734  candidates.insert( new_cand );
5735  }
5736  }
5737  }
5738  }
5739  }
5740 
5741  bool generate_stairs = true;
5742  for( tripoint_om_omt &elem : generated_lab ) {
5743  // Use a check for "_stairs" to catch the hidden_lab_stairs tiles.
5744  if( is_ot_match( "_stairs", ter( elem + tripoint_above ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5745  generate_stairs = false;
5746  }
5747  }
5748  if( generate_stairs && !generated_lab.empty() ) {
5749  std::shuffle( generated_lab.begin(), generated_lab.end(), rng_get_engine() );
5750 
5751  // we want a spot where labs are above, but we'll settle for the last element if necessary.
5752  tripoint_om_omt lab_pos;
5753  for( tripoint_om_omt elem : generated_lab ) {
5754  lab_pos = elem;
5755  if( ter( lab_pos + tripoint_above ) == labt ) {
5756  break;
5757  }
5758  }
5759  ter_set( lab_pos + tripoint_above, labt_stairs );
5760  }
5761 
5762  ter_set( p, labt_core );
5763  int numstairs = 0;
5764  if( s > 0 ) { // Build stairs going down
5765  while( !one_in( 6 ) ) {
5766  tripoint_om_omt stair;
5767  int tries = 0;
5768  do {
5769  stair = p + point( rng( -s, s ), rng( -s, s ) );
5770  tries++;
5771  } while( ( ter( stair ) != labt && ter( stair ) != labt_ants ) && tries < 15 );
5772  if( tries < 15 ) {
5773  if( ter( stair ) == labt_ants ) {
5774  ter_set( stair, labt_ants_stairs );
5775  } else {
5776  ter_set( stair, labt_stairs );
5777  }
5778  numstairs++;
5779  }
5780  }
5781  }
5782 
5783  // We need a finale on the bottom of labs. Central labs have a chance of additional finales.
5784  if( numstairs == 0 || ( prefix == "central_" && one_in( -p.z() - 1 ) ) ) {
5785  tripoint_om_omt finale;
5786  int tries = 0;
5787  do {
5788  finale = p + point( rng( -s, s ), rng( -s, s ) );
5789  tries++;
5790  } while( tries < 15 && ter( finale ) != labt && ter( finale ) != labt_core );
5791  ter_set( finale, labt_finale );
5792  }
5793 
5794  if( train_odds > 0 && one_in( train_odds ) ) {
5795  tripoint_om_omt train;
5796  int tries = 0;
5797  int adjacent_labs;
5798 
5799  do {
5800  train = p + point( rng( -s * 1.5 - 1, s * 1.5 + 1 ), rng( -s * 1.5 - 1, s * 1.5 + 1 ) );
5801  tries++;
5802 
5803  adjacent_labs = 0;
5804  for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
5805  if( is_ot_match( "lab", ter( train + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) &&
5806  !is_ot_match( "lab_subway", ter( train + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5807  ++adjacent_labs;
5808  }
5809  }
5810  } while( tries < 50 && (
5811  ter( train ) == labt ||
5812  ter( train ) == labt_stairs ||
5813  ter( train ) == labt_finale ||
5814  adjacent_labs != 1 ) );
5815  if( tries < 50 ) {
5816  lab_train_points->push_back( train.xy() ); // possible train depot
5817  // next is rail connection
5818  for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
5819  if( is_ot_match( "lab", ter( train + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) &&
5820  !is_ot_match( "lab_subway", ter( train + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5821  lab_train_points->push_back( train.xy() - offset );
5822  break;
5823  }
5824  }
5825  }
5826  }
5827 
5828  // 4th story of labs is a candidate for lab escape, as long as there's no train or finale.
5829  if( prefix.empty() && p.z() == -4 && train_odds == 0 && numstairs > 0 ) {
5830  tripoint_om_omt cell;
5831  int tries = 0;
5832  int adjacent_labs = 0;
5833 
5834  // Find a space bordering just one lab to the south.
5835  do {
5836  cell = p + point( rng( -s * 1.5 - 1, s * 1.5 + 1 ), rng( -s * 1.5 - 1, s * 1.5 + 1 ) );
5837  tries++;
5838 
5839  adjacent_labs = 0;
5840  for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
5841  if( is_ot_match( "lab", ter( cell + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) &&
5842  !is_ot_match( "lab_subway", ter( cell + offset ), ot_match_type::contains ) ) {
5843  ++adjacent_labs;
5844  }
5845  }
5846  } while( tries < 50 && (
5847  ter( cell ) == labt_stairs ||
5848  ter( cell ) == labt_finale ||
5849  ter( cell + point_south ) != labt ||
5850  adjacent_labs != 1 ) );
5851  if( tries < 50 ) {
5852  ter_set( cell, oter_lab_escape_cells.id() );
5853  ter_set( cell + point_south, oter_lab_escape_entrance.id() );
5854  }
5855  }
5856 
5857  return numstairs > 0;
5858 }
5859 
5860 bool overmap::build_slimepit( const tripoint_om_omt &origin, int s )
5861 {
5862  const oter_id slimepit_down( "slimepit_down" );
5863  const oter_id slimepit( "slimepit" );
5864 
5865  bool requires_sub = false;
5866  for( auto p : points_in_radius( origin, s + origin.z() + 1, 0 ) ) {
5867  int dist = square_dist( origin.xy(), p.xy() );
5868  if( one_in( 2 * dist ) ) {
5869  chip_rock( p );
5870  if( one_in( 8 ) && origin.z() > -OVERMAP_DEPTH ) {
5871  ter_set( p, slimepit_down );
5872  requires_sub = true;
5873  } else {
5874  ter_set( p, slimepit );
5875  }
5876  }
5877  }
5878 
5879  return requires_sub;
5880 }
5881 
5882 void overmap::place_ravines()
5883 {
5884  if( settings->overmap_ravine.num_ravines == 0 ) {
5885  return;
5886  }
5887 
5888  const oter_id rift( "ravine" );
5889  const oter_id rift_edge( "ravine_edge" );
5890  const oter_id rift_floor( "ravine_floor" );
5891  const oter_id rift_floor_edge( "ravine_floor_edge" );
5892 
5893  std::set<point_om_omt> rift_points;
5894 
5895  // We dont really care about the paths each ravine takes, so this can be whatever
5896  // The random return value was chosen because it easily produces decent looking windy ravines
5897  const pf::two_node_scoring_fn<point_om_omt> estimate =
5898  [&]( pf::directed_node<point_om_omt>, const std::optional<pf::directed_node<point_om_omt>> & ) {
5899  return pf::node_score( 0, rng( 1, 2 ) );
5900  };
5901  // A path is generated for each of ravine, and all its constituent points are stored within the
5902  // rift_points set. In the code block below, the set is then used to determine edges and place the
5903  // actual terrain pieces of the ravine.
5904  for( int n = 0; n < settings->overmap_ravine.num_ravines; n++ ) {
5905  const point_rel_omt offset( rng( -settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_range,
5906  settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_range ),
5907  rng( -settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_range, settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_range ) );
5908  const point_om_omt origin( rng( 0, OMAPX ), rng( 0, OMAPY ) );
5909  const point_om_omt destination = origin + offset;
5910  if( !inbounds( destination, settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width * 3 ) ) {
5911  continue;
5912  }
5913  const auto path = pf::greedy_path( origin, destination, point_om_omt( OMAPX, OMAPY ), estimate );
5914  for( const auto &node : path.nodes ) {
5915  for( int i = 1 - settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width; i < settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width;
5916  i++ ) {
5917  for( int j = 1 - settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width; j < settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_width;
5918  j++ ) {
5919  const point_om_omt n = node.pos + point( j, i );
5920  if( inbounds( n, 1 ) ) {
5921  rift_points.emplace( n );
5922  }
5923  }
5924  }
5925  }
5926  }
5927  // We look at the 8 adjacent locations of each ravine point and see if they are also part of a
5928  // ravine, if at least one of them isn't, the location is part of the ravine's edge. Whatever the
5929  // case, the chosen ravine terrain is then propagated downwards until the ravine_depth specified
5930  // by the region settings.
5931  for( const point_om_omt &p : rift_points ) {
5932  bool edge = false;
5933  for( int ni = -1; ni <= 1 && !edge; ni++ ) {
5934  for( int nj = -1; nj <= 1 && !edge; nj++ ) {
5935  const point_om_omt n = p + point_rel_omt( ni, nj );
5936  if( rift_points.find( n ) == rift_points.end() || !inbounds( n ) ) {
5937  edge = true;
5938  }
5939  }
5940  }
5941  for( int z = 0; z >= settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_depth; z-- ) {
5942  if( z == settings->overmap_ravine.ravine_depth ) {
5943  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, z ), edge ? rift_floor_edge : rift_floor );
5944  } else {
5945  ter_set( tripoint_om_omt( p, z ), edge ? rift_edge : rift );
5946  }
5947  }
5948  }
5949 
5950 }
5951 
5952 pf::directed_path<point_om_omt> overmap::lay_out_connection(
5953  const overmap_connection &connection, const point_om_omt &source, const point_om_omt &dest,
5954  int z, const bool must_be_unexplored ) const
5955 {
5956  const pf::two_node_scoring_fn<point_om_omt> estimate =
5957  [&]( pf::directed_node<point_om_omt> cur, std::optional<pf::directed_node<point_om_omt>> prev ) {
5958  const oter_id id = ter( tripoint_om_omt( cur.pos, z ) );
5959 
5960  const overmap_connection::subtype *subtype = connection.pick_subtype_for( id );
5961 
5962  if( !subtype ) {
5963  return pf::node_score::rejected; // No option for this terrain.
5964  }
5965 
5966  const bool existing_connection = connection.has( id );
5967 
5968  // Only do this check if it needs to be unexplored and there isn't already a connection.
5969  if( must_be_unexplored && !existing_connection ) {
5970  // If this must be unexplored, check if we've already got a submap generated.
5971  const bool existing_submap = is_omt_generated( tripoint_om_omt( cur.pos, z ) );
5972 
5973  // If there is an existing submap, this area has already been explored and this
5974  // isn't a valid placement.
5975  if( existing_submap ) {
5976  return pf::node_score::rejected;
5977  }
5978  }
5979 
5980  if( existing_connection && id->is_rotatable() && cur.dir != om_direction::type::invalid &&
5981  !om_direction::are_parallel( id->get_dir(), cur.dir ) ) {
5982  return pf::node_score::rejected; // Can't intersect.
5983  }
5984 
5985  if( prev && prev->dir != om_direction::type::invalid && prev->dir != cur.dir ) {
5986  // Direction has changed.
5987  const oter_id &prev_id = ter( tripoint_om_omt( prev->pos, z ) );
5988  const overmap_connection::subtype *prev_subtype = connection.pick_subtype_for( prev_id );
5989 
5990  if( !prev_subtype || !prev_subtype->allows_turns() ) {
5991  return pf::node_score::rejected;
5992  }
5993  }
5994 
5995  const int dist = subtype->is_orthogonal() ?
5996  manhattan_dist( dest, cur.pos ) :
5997  trig_dist( dest, cur.pos );
5998  const int existency_mult = existing_connection ? 1 : 5; // Prefer existing connections.
5999 
6000  return pf::node_score( subtype->basic_cost, existency_mult * dist );
6001  };
6002 
6003  return pf::greedy_path( source, dest, point_om_omt( OMAPX, OMAPY ), estimate );
6004 }
6005 
6006 static pf::directed_path<point_om_omt> straight_path( const point_om_omt &source,
6007  om_direction::type dir, size_t len )
6008 {
6009  pf::directed_path<point_om_omt> res;
6010  if( len == 0 ) {
6011  return res;
6012  }
6013  point_om_omt p = source;
6014  res.nodes.reserve( len );
6015  for( size_t i = 0; i + 1 < len; ++i ) {
6016  res.nodes.emplace_back( p, dir );
6017  p += om_direction::displace( dir );
6018  }
6019  res.nodes.emplace_back( p, om_direction::type::invalid );
6020  return res;
6021 }
6022 
6023 pf::directed_path<point_om_omt> overmap::lay_out_street( const overmap_connection &connection,
6024  const point_om_omt &source, om_direction::type dir, size_t len ) const
6025 {
6026  const tripoint_om_omt from( source, 0 );
6027  // See if we need to make another one "step" further.
6028  const tripoint_om_omt en_pos = from + om_direction::displace( dir, len + 1 );
6029  if( inbounds( en_pos, 1 ) && connection.has( ter( en_pos ) ) ) {
6030  ++len;
6031  }
6032 
6033  size_t actual_len = 0;
6034 
6035  while( actual_len < len ) {
6036  const tripoint_om_omt pos = from + om_direction::displace( dir, actual_len );
6037 
6038  if( !inbounds( pos, 1 ) ) {
6039  break; // Don't approach overmap bounds.
6040  }
6041 
6042  const oter_id &ter_id = ter( pos );
6043 
6044  if( ter_id->is_river() || ter_id->is_ravine() || ter_id->is_ravine_edge() ||
6045  !connection.pick_subtype_for( ter_id ) ) {
6046  break;
6047  }
6048 
6049  bool collided = false;
6050  int collisions = 0;
6051  for( int i = -1; i <= 1; i++ ) {
6052  if( collided ) {
6053  break;
6054  }
6055  for( int j = -1; j <= 1; j++ ) {
6056  const tripoint_om_omt checkp = pos + tripoint( i, j, 0 );
6057 
6058  if( checkp != pos + om_direction::displace( dir, 1 ) &&
6059  checkp != pos + om_direction::displace( om_direction::opposite( dir ), 1 ) &&
6060  checkp != pos ) {
6061  if( ter( checkp )->get_type_id() == oter_type_road ) {
6062  collisions++;
6063  }
6064  }
6065  }
6066 
6067  //Stop roads from running right next to each other
6068  if( collisions >= 3 ) {
6069  collided = true;
6070  break;
6071  }
6072  }
6073  if( collided ) {
6074  break;
6075  }
6076 
6077  ++actual_len;
6078 
6079  if( actual_len > 1 && connection.has( ter_id ) ) {
6080  break; // Stop here.
6081  }
6082  }
6083 
6084  return straight_path( source, dir, actual_len );
6085 }
6086 
6087 void overmap::build_connection(
6088  const overmap_connection &connection, const pf::directed_path<point_om_omt> &path, int z,
6089  const cube_direction initial_dir )
6090 {
6091  if( path.nodes.empty() ) {
6092  return;
6093  }
6094 
6095  om_direction::type prev_dir =
6096  om_direction::from_cube( initial_dir, "Up and down connections not yet supported" );
6097 
6098  const pf::directed_node<point_om_omt> start = path.nodes.front();
6099  const pf::directed_node<point_om_omt> end = path.nodes.back();
6100 
6101  for( const auto &node : path.nodes ) {
6102  const tripoint_om_omt pos( node.pos, z );
6103  const oter_id &ter_id = ter( pos );
6104  const om_direction::type new_dir = node.dir;
6105  const overmap_connection::subtype *subtype = connection.pick_subtype_for( ter_id );
6106 
6107  if( !subtype ) {
6108  debugmsg( "No suitable subtype of connection \"%s\" found for \"%s\".", connection.id.c_str(),
6109  ter_id.id().c_str() );
6110  return;
6111  }
6112 
6113  if( subtype->terrain->is_linear() ) {
6114  size_t new_line = connection.has( ter_id ) ? ter_id->get_line() : 0;
6115 
6116  if( new_dir != om_direction::type::invalid ) {
6117  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, new_dir );
6118  }
6119 
6120  if( prev_dir != om_direction::type::invalid ) {
6121  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, om_direction::opposite( prev_dir ) );
6122  }
6123 
6124  for( const om_direction::type dir : om_direction::all ) {
6125  const tripoint_om_omt np( pos + om_direction::displace( dir ) );
6126 
6127  if( inbounds( np ) ) {
6128  const oter_id &near_id = ter( np );
6129 
6130  if( connection.has( near_id ) ) {
6131  if( near_id->is_linear() ) {
6132  const size_t near_line = near_id->get_line();
6133 
6134  if( om_lines::is_straight( near_line ) || om_lines::has_segment( near_line, new_dir ) ) {
6135  // Mutual connection.
6136  const size_t new_near_line = om_lines::set_segment( near_line, om_direction::opposite( dir ) );
6137  ter_set( np, near_id->get_type_id()->get_linear( new_near_line ) );
6138  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, dir );
6139  }
6140  } else if( near_id->is_rotatable() && om_direction::are_parallel( dir, near_id->get_dir() ) ) {
6141  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, dir );
6142  }
6143  }
6144  } else if( pos.xy() == start.pos || pos.xy() == end.pos ) {
6145  // Only automatically connect to out of bounds locations if we're the start or end of this path.
6146  new_line = om_lines::set_segment( new_line, dir );
6147 
6148  // Add this connection point to our connections out.
6149  std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> &outs = connections_out[connection.id];
6150  const auto existing_out = std::find_if( outs.begin(),
6151  outs.end(), [pos]( const tripoint_om_omt & c ) {
6152  return c == pos;
6153  } );
6154  if( existing_out == outs.end() ) {
6155  outs.emplace_back( pos );
6156  }
6157  }
6158  }
6159 
6160  if( new_line == om_lines::invalid ) {
6161  debugmsg( "Invalid path for connection \"%s\".", connection.id.c_str() );
6162  return;
6163  }
6164 
6165  ter_set( pos, subtype->terrain->get_linear( new_line ) );
6166  } else if( new_dir != om_direction::type::invalid ) {
6167  ter_set( pos, subtype->terrain->get_rotated( new_dir ) );
6168  }
6169 
6170  prev_dir = new_dir;
6171  }
6172 }
6173 
6174 void overmap::build_connection(
6175  const point_om_omt &source, const point_om_omt &dest, int z,
6176  const overmap_connection &connection, const bool must_be_unexplored,
6177  const cube_direction initial_dir )
6178 {
6179  build_connection(
6180  connection, lay_out_connection( connection, source, dest, z, must_be_unexplored ),
6181  z, initial_dir );
6182 }
6183 
6184 // connect the points to each other using a minimum spanning tree
6185 // plus rare extra connections to make loops
6186 void overmap::connect_closest_points( const std::vector<point_om_omt> &points, int z,
6187  const overmap_connection &connection )
6188 {
6189  // { weight, {i, j} }
6190  using edge = std::pair<float, std::pair<size_t, size_t>>;
6191 
6192  if( points.size() < 2 ) {
6193  return;
6194  }
6195 
6196  std::vector<edge> edges;
6197 
6198  // enumerate every possible connection between the points
6199  edges.reserve( points.size() * ( points.size() - 1 ) / 2 );
6200  for( size_t i = 0; i < points.size() - 1; ++i ) {
6201  for( size_t j = i + 1; j < points.size(); j++ ) {
6202  const float distance = trig_dist( points[i], points[j] );
6203  edges.push_back( {distance, {i, j}} );
6204  }
6205  }
6206 
6207  // sort from shortest to longest
6208  sort( edges.begin(), edges.end() );
6209 
6210  // track which subgraph each point belongs to
6211  std::vector<int> subgraphs( points.size(), -1 );
6212 
6213  for( edge candidate : edges ) {
6214  const size_t i = candidate.second.first;
6215  const size_t j = candidate.second.second;
6216  bool connect = false;
6217  if( subgraphs[i] < 0 && subgraphs[j] < 0 ) {
6218  // neither point of this connection has been connected yet
6219  // identify them each as the root of a new subgraph
6220  subgraphs[i] = i;
6221  subgraphs[j] = j;
6222  // and connect them
6223  connect = true;
6224  } else if( subgraphs[i] < 0 ) {
6225  // j is already connected to something
6226  // add i to j's subgraph
6227  subgraphs[i] = subgraphs[j];
6228  // and connect them
6229  connect = true;
6230  } else if( subgraphs[j] < 0 ) {
6231  // i is already connected to something
6232  // add j to i's subgraph
6233  subgraphs[j] = subgraphs[i];
6234  // and connect them
6235  connect = true;
6236  } else if( subgraphs[i] != subgraphs[j] ) {
6237  // i and j are both connected to different subgraphs
6238  // join the subgraphs
6239  int dead_subtree = subgraphs[j];
6240  for( size_t k = 0; k < points.size(); k++ ) {
6241  if( subgraphs[k] == dead_subtree ) {
6242  subgraphs[k] = subgraphs[i];
6243  }
6244  }
6245  // and connect them
6246  connect = true;
6247  } else if( one_in( 10 ) ) {
6248  // the remaining case is that i and j are already in the same subgraph
6249  // making this connection creates a loop
6250  connect = true;
6251  }
6252 
6253  if( connect ) {
6254  build_connection( points[i], points[j], z, connection, false );
6255  }
6256  }
6257 }
6258 
6259 void overmap::polish_river()
6260 {
6261  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x++ ) {
6262  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y++ ) {
6263  good_river( { x, y, 0 } );
6264  }
6265  }
6266 }
6267 
6268 // Changes neighboring empty rock to partial rock
6269 void overmap::chip_rock( const tripoint_om_omt &p )
6270 {
6271  const oter_id rock( "rock" );
6272  const oter_id empty_rock( "empty_rock" );
6273 
6274  for( const point &offset : four_adjacent_offsets ) {
6275  if( ter( p + offset ) == empty_rock ) {
6276  ter_set( p + offset, rock );
6277  }
6278  }
6279 }
6280 
6281 bool overmap::check_ot( const std::string &otype, ot_match_type match_type,
6282  const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
6283 {
6284  /// TODO: this check should be done by the caller. Probably.
6285  if( !inbounds( p ) ) {
6286  return false;
6287  }
6288  const oter_id &oter = ter( p );
6289  return is_ot_match( otype, oter, match_type );
6290 }
6291 
6292 bool overmap::check_overmap_special_type( const overmap_special_id &id,
6293  const tripoint_om_omt &location ) const
6294 {
6295  // Try and find the special associated with this location.
6296  auto found_id = overmap_special_placements.find( location );
6297 
6298  // There was no special here, so bail.
6299  if( found_id == overmap_special_placements.end() ) {
6300  return false;
6301  }
6302 
6303  // Return whether the found special was a match with our requested id.
6304  return found_id->second == id;
6305 }
6306 
6307 std::optional<overmap_special_id> overmap::overmap_special_at( const tripoint_om_omt &p ) const
6308 {
6309  auto it = overmap_special_placements.find( p );
6310 
6311  if( it == overmap_special_placements.end() ) {
6312  return std::nullopt;
6313  }
6314 
6315  return it->second;
6316 }
6317 
6318 void overmap::good_river( const tripoint_om_omt &p )
6319 {
6320  if( !is_ot_match( "river", ter( p ), ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
6321  return;
6322  }
6323  if( ( p.x() == 0 ) || ( p.x() == OMAPX - 1 ) ) {
6324  if( !is_water_body( ter( p + point_north ) ) ) {
6325  ter_set( p, oter_river_north.id() );
6326  } else if( !is_water_body( ter( p + point_south ) ) ) {
6327  ter_set( p, oter_river_south.id() );
6328  } else {
6329  ter_set( p, oter_river_center.id() );
6330  }
6331  return;
6332  }
6333  if( ( p.y() == 0 ) || ( p.y() == OMAPY - 1 ) ) {
6334  if( !is_water_body( ter( p + point_west ) ) ) {
6335  ter_set( p, oter_river_west.id() );
6336  } else if( !is_water_body( ter( p + point_east ) ) ) {
6337  ter_set( p, oter_river_east.id() );
6338  } else {
6339  ter_set( p, oter_river_center.id() );
6340  }
6341  return;
6342  }
6343  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_west ) ) ) {
6344  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_north ) ) ) {
6345  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_south ) ) ) {
6346  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_east ) ) ) {
6347  // River on N, S, E, W;
6348  // but we might need to take a "bite" out of the corner
6349  if( !is_water_body( ter( p + point_north_west ) ) ) {
6350  ter_set( p, oter_river_c_not_nw.id() );
6351  } else if( !is_water_body( ter( p + point_north_east ) ) ) {
6352  ter_set( p, oter_river_c_not_ne.id() );
6353  } else if( !is_water_body( ter( p + point_south_west ) ) ) {
6354  ter_set( p, oter_river_c_not_sw.id() );
6355  } else if( !is_water_body( ter( p + point_south_east ) ) ) {
6356  ter_set( p, oter_river_c_not_se.id() );
6357  } else {
6358  ter_set( p, oter_river_center.id() );
6359  }
6360  } else {
6361  ter_set( p, oter_river_east.id() );
6362  }
6363  } else {
6364  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_east ) ) ) {
6365  ter_set( p, oter_river_south.id() );
6366  } else {
6367  ter_set( p, oter_river_se.id() );
6368  }
6369  }
6370  } else {
6371  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_south ) ) ) {
6372  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_east ) ) ) {
6373  ter_set( p, oter_river_north.id() );
6374  } else {
6375  ter_set( p, oter_river_ne.id() );
6376  }
6377  } else {
6378  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_east ) ) ) { // Means it's swampy
6379  ter_set( p, oter_forest_water.id() );
6380  }
6381  }
6382  }
6383  } else {
6384  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_north ) ) ) {
6385  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_south ) ) ) {
6386  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_east ) ) ) {
6387  ter_set( p, oter_river_west.id() );
6388  } else { // Should never happen
6389  ter_set( p, oter_forest_water.id() );
6390  }
6391  } else {
6392  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_east ) ) ) {
6393  ter_set( p, oter_river_sw.id() );
6394  } else { // Should never happen
6395  ter_set( p, oter_forest_water.id() );
6396  }
6397  }
6398  } else {
6399  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_south ) ) ) {
6400  if( is_water_body( ter( p + point_east ) ) ) {
6401  ter_set( p, oter_river_nw.id() );
6402  } else { // Should never happen
6403  ter_set( p, oter_forest_water.id() );
6404  }
6405  } else { // Should never happen
6406  ter_set( p, oter_forest_water.id() );
6407  }
6408  }
6409  }
6410 }
6411 
6412 std::string om_direction::name( type dir )
6413 {
6414  static const std::array < std::string, size + 1 > names = {{
6415  translate_marker( "invalid" ), translate_marker( "north" ),
6416  translate_marker( "east" ), translate_marker( "south" ),
6417  translate_marker( "west" )
6418  }
6419  };
6420  return _( names[static_cast<size_t>( dir ) + 1] );
6421 }
6422 
6423 // new x = (x-c.x)*cos() - (y-c.y)*sin() + c.x
6424 // new y = (x-c.x)*sin() + (y-c.y)*cos() + c.y
6425 // r1x = 0*x - 1*y = -1*y, r1y = 1*x + y*0 = x
6426 // r2x = -1*x - 0*y = -1*x , r2y = x*0 + y*-1 = -1*y
6427 // r3x = x*0 - (-1*y) = y, r3y = x*-1 + y*0 = -1*x
6428 // c=0,0, rot90 = (-y, x); rot180 = (-x, y); rot270 = (y, -x)
6429 /*
6430  (0,0)(1,0)(2,0) 90 (0,0)(0,1)(0,2) (-2,0)(-1,0)(0,0)
6431  (0,1)(1,1)(2,1) -> (-1,0)(-1,1)(-1,2) -> (-2,1)(-1,1)(0,1)
6432  (0,2)(1,2)(2,2) (-2,0)(-2,1)(-2,2) (-2,2)(-1,2)(0,2)
6433 */
6434 
6435 point om_direction::rotate( const point &p, type dir )
6436 {
6437  switch( dir ) {
6438  case om_direction::type::invalid:
6439  case om_direction::type::last:
6440  debugmsg( "Invalid overmap rotation (%d).", static_cast<int>( dir ) );
6441  // Intentional fallthrough.
6442  case om_direction::type::north:
6443  break; // No need to do anything.
6444  case om_direction::type::east:
6445  return point( -p.y, p.x );
6446  case om_direction::type::south:
6447  return point( -p.x, -p.y );
6448  case om_direction::type::west:
6449  return point( p.y, -p.x );
6450  }
6451  return p;
6452 }
6453 
6454 tripoint om_direction::rotate( const tripoint &p, type dir )
6455 {
6456  return tripoint( rotate( { p.xy() }, dir ), p.z );
6457 }
6458 
6459 uint32_t om_direction::rotate_symbol( uint32_t sym, type dir )
6460 {
6461  return rotatable_symbols::get( sym, static_cast<int>( dir ) );
6462 }
6463 
6464 point om_direction::displace( type dir, int dist )
6465 {
6466  return rotate( { 0, -dist }, dir );
6467 }
6468 
6469 static om_direction::type rotate_internal( om_direction::type dir, int step )
6470 {
6471  if( dir == om_direction::type::invalid ) {
6472  debugmsg( "Can't rotate an invalid overmap rotation." );
6473  return dir;
6474  }
6475  step = step % om_direction::size;
6476  return static_cast<om_direction::type>( ( static_cast<int>( dir ) + step ) % om_direction::size );
6477 }
6478 
6479 om_direction::type om_direction::add( type dir1, type dir2 )
6480 {
6481  return rotate_internal( dir1, static_cast<int>( dir2 ) );
6482 }
6483 
6484 om_direction::type om_direction::turn_left( type dir )
6485 {
6486  return rotate_internal( dir, -static_cast<int>( size ) / 4 );
6487 }
6488 
6489 om_direction::type om_direction::turn_right( type dir )
6490 {
6491  return rotate_internal( dir, static_cast<int>( size ) / 4 );
6492 }
6493 
6494 om_direction::type om_direction::turn_random( type dir )
6495 {
6496  return rng( 0, 1 ) ? turn_left( dir ) : turn_right( dir );
6497 }
6498 
6499 om_direction::type om_direction::opposite( type dir )
6500 {
6501  return rotate_internal( dir, static_cast<int>( size ) / 2 );
6502 }
6503 
6504 om_direction::type om_direction::random()
6505 {
6506  return static_cast<type>( rng( 0, size - 1 ) );
6507 }
6508 
6509 bool om_direction::are_parallel( type dir1, type dir2 )
6510 {
6511  return dir1 == dir2 || dir1 == opposite( dir2 );
6512 }
6513 
6514 om_direction::type om_direction::from_cube( cube_direction c, const std::string &error_msg )
6515 {
6516  switch( c ) {
6517  case cube_direction::north:
6518  return om_direction::type::north;
6519  case cube_direction::east:
6520  return om_direction::type::east;
6521  case cube_direction::south:
6522  return om_direction::type::south;
6523  case cube_direction::west:
6524  return om_direction::type::west;
6525  case cube_direction::above:
6526  case cube_direction::below:
6527  debugmsg( error_msg );
6528  // fallthrough
6529  case cube_direction::last:
6530  return om_direction::type::invalid;
6531  }
6532  debugmsg( "Invalid cube_direction" );
6533  return om_direction::type::invalid;
6534 }
6535 
6536 om_direction::type overmap::random_special_rotation( const overmap_special &special,
6537  const tripoint_om_omt &p, const bool must_be_unexplored ) const
6538 {
6539  std::vector<om_direction::type> rotations( om_direction::size );
6540  const auto first = rotations.begin();
6541  auto last = first;
6542 
6543  int top_score = 0; // Maximal number of existing connections (roads).
6544  // Try to find the most suitable rotation: satisfy as many connections
6545  // as possible with the existing terrain.
6546  for( om_direction::type r : om_direction::all ) {
6547  int score = special.score_rotation_at( *this, p, r );
6548 
6549  if( score >= top_score ) {
6550  if( score > top_score ) {
6551  top_score = score;
6552  last = first; // New top score. Forget previous rotations.
6553  }
6554  *last = r;
6555  ++last;
6556  }
6557 
6558  if( !special.is_rotatable() ) {
6559  break;
6560  }
6561  }
6562  // Pick first valid rotation at random.
6563  std::shuffle( first, last, rng_get_engine() );
6564  const auto rotation = std::find_if( first, last, [&]( om_direction::type elem ) {
6565  return can_place_special( special, p, elem, must_be_unexplored );
6566  } );
6567 
6568  return rotation != last ? *rotation : om_direction::type::invalid;
6569 }
6570 
6571 bool overmap::can_place_special( const overmap_special &special, const tripoint_om_omt &p,
6572  om_direction::type dir, const bool must_be_unexplored ) const
6573 {
6574  cata_assert( dir != om_direction::type::invalid );
6575 
6576  if( !special.id ) {
6577  return false;
6578  }
6579  if( special.has_flag( "GLOBALLY_UNIQUE" ) &&
6580  overmap_buffer.contains_unique_special( special.id ) ) {
6581  return false;
6582  }
6583 
6584  if( special.has_eoc() ) {
6585  dialogue d( get_talker_for( get_avatar() ), nullptr );
6586  if( !special.get_eoc()->test_condition( d ) ) {
6587  return false;
6588  }
6589  }
6590 
6591  const std::vector<overmap_special_locations> fixed_terrains = special.required_locations();
6592 
6593  return std::all_of( fixed_terrains.begin(), fixed_terrains.end(),
6594  [&]( const overmap_special_locations & elem ) {
6595  const tripoint_om_omt rp = p + om_direction::rotate( elem.p, dir );
6596 
6597  if( !inbounds( rp, 1 ) ) {
6598  return false;
6599  }
6600 
6601  if( must_be_unexplored ) {
6602  // If this must be unexplored, check if we've already got a submap generated.
6603  const bool existing_submap = is_omt_generated( rp );
6604 
6605  // If there is an existing submap, this area has already been explored and this
6606  // isn't a valid placement.
6607  if( existing_submap ) {
6608  return false;
6609  }
6610  }
6611 
6612  const oter_id &tid = ter( rp );
6613 
6614  return elem.can_be_placed_on( tid ) || ( rp.z() != 0 && tid == get_default_terrain( rp.z() ) );
6615  } );
6616 }
6617 
6618 // checks around the selected point to see if the special can be placed there
6619 std::vector<tripoint_om_omt> overmap::place_special(
6620  const overmap_special &special, const tripoint_om_omt &p, om_direction::type dir,
6621  const city &cit, const bool must_be_unexplored, const bool force )
6622 {
6623  cata_assert( dir != om_direction::type::invalid );
6624  if( !force ) {
6625  cata_assert( can_place_special( special, p, dir, must_be_unexplored ) );
6626  }
6627  if( special.has_flag( "GLOBALLY_UNIQUE" ) ) {
6628  overmap_buffer.add_unique_special( special.id );
6629  }
6630  if( special.has_flag( "UNIQUE" ) ) {
6631  overmap_buffer.log_unique_special( special.id );
6632  }
6633 
6634  const bool is_safe_zone = special.has_flag( "SAFE_AT_WORLDGEN" );
6635 
6636  std::optional<mapgen_arguments> *mapgen_args_p = &*mapgen_arg_storage.emplace();
6637  special_placement_result result = special.place( *this, p, dir, cit, must_be_unexplored );
6638  for( const std::pair<om_pos_dir, std::string> &join : result.joins_used ) {
6639  joins_used[join.first] = join.second;
6640  }
6641  for( const tripoint_om_omt &location : result.omts_used ) {
6642  overmap_special_placements[location] = special.id;
6643  mapgen_args_index[location] = mapgen_args_p;
6644  if( is_safe_zone ) {
6645  safe_at_worldgen.emplace( location );
6646  }
6647  }
6648  // Place spawns.
6649  const overmap_special_spawns &spawns = special.get_monster_spawns();
6650  if( spawns.group ) {
6651  const int pop = rng( spawns.population.min, spawns.population.max );
6652  const int rad = rng( spawns.radius.min, spawns.radius.max );
6653  spawn_mon_group(
6654  mongroup( spawns.group, project_to<coords::sm>( project_combine( pos(), p ) ), pop ),
6655  rad );
6656  }
6657  // If it's a safe zone, remove existing spawns
6658  if( is_safe_zone ) {
6659  for( auto it = zg.begin(); it != zg.end(); ) {
6660  tripoint_om_omt pos = project_to<coords::omt>( it->second.rel_pos() );
6661  if( safe_at_worldgen.find( pos ) != safe_at_worldgen.end() ) {
6662  zg.erase( it++ );
6663  } else {
6664  ++it;
6665  }
6666  }
6667  }
6668 
6669  return result.omts_used;
6670 }
6671 
6672 om_special_sectors get_sectors( const int sector_width )
6673 {
6674  std::vector<point_om_omt> res;
6675 
6676  res.reserve( static_cast<size_t>( OMAPX / sector_width ) * static_cast<size_t>
6677  ( OMAPY / sector_width ) );
6678  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX; x += sector_width ) {
6679  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY; y += sector_width ) {
6680  res.emplace_back( x, y );
6681  }
6682  }
6683  std::shuffle( res.begin(), res.end(), rng_get_engine() );
6684  return om_special_sectors{ res, sector_width };
6685 }
6686 
6687 bool overmap::place_special_attempt(
6688  overmap_special_batch &enabled_specials, const point_om_omt &sector,
6689  const int sector_width, const bool place_optional, const bool must_be_unexplored )
6690 {
6691  const point_om_omt p2( sector );
6692 
6693  const tripoint_om_omt p( rng( p2.x(), p2.x() + sector_width - 1 ),
6694  rng( p2.y(), p2.y() + sector_width - 1 ), 0 );
6695  const city &nearest_city = get_nearest_city( p );
6696 
6697  std::shuffle( enabled_specials.begin(), enabled_specials.end(), rng_get_engine() );
6698  std::set<int> priorities;
6699  for( const overmap_special_placement &os : enabled_specials ) {
6700  priorities.emplace( os.special_details->get_priority() );
6701  }
6702  for( auto pri_iter = priorities.rbegin(); pri_iter != priorities.rend(); ++pri_iter ) {
6703  for( auto iter = enabled_specials.begin(); iter != enabled_specials.end(); ++iter ) {
6704  const overmap_special &special = *iter->special_details;
6705  if( *pri_iter != special.get_priority() ) {
6706  continue;
6707  }
6708  const overmap_special_placement_constraints &constraints = special.get_constraints();
6709  // If we haven't finished placing minimum instances of all specials,
6710  // skip specials that are at their minimum count already.
6711  if( !place_optional && iter->instances_placed >= constraints.occurrences.min ) {
6712  continue;
6713  }
6714  // City check is the fastest => it goes first.
6715  if( !special.can_belong_to_city( p, nearest_city ) ) {
6716  continue;
6717  }
6718  // See if we can actually place the special there.
6719  const om_direction::type rotation = random_special_rotation( special, p, must_be_unexplored );
6720  if( rotation == om_direction::type::invalid ) {
6721  continue;
6722  }
6723 
6724  place_special( special, p, rotation, nearest_city, false, must_be_unexplored );
6725 
6726  if( ++iter->instances_placed >= constraints.occurrences.max ) {
6727  enabled_specials.erase( iter );
6728  }
6729 
6730  return true;
6731  }
6732  }
6733 
6734  return false;
6735 }
6736 
6737 void overmap::place_specials_pass(
6738  overmap_special_batch &enabled_specials, om_special_sectors &sectors,
6739  const bool place_optional, const bool must_be_unexplored )
6740 {
6741  // Walk over sectors in random order, to minimize "clumping".
6742  std::shuffle( sectors.sectors.begin(), sectors.sectors.end(), rng_get_engine() );
6743  for( auto it = sectors.sectors.begin(); it != sectors.sectors.end(); ) {
6744  const size_t attempts = 10;
6745  bool placed = false;
6746  for( size_t i = 0; i < attempts; ++i ) {
6747  if( place_special_attempt( enabled_specials, *it, sectors.sector_width, place_optional,
6748  must_be_unexplored ) ) {
6749  placed = true;
6750  it = sectors.sectors.erase( it );
6751  if( enabled_specials.empty() ) {
6752  return; // Job done. Bail out.
6753  }
6754  break;
6755  }
6756  }
6757 
6758  if( !placed ) {
6759  it++;
6760  }
6761  }
6762 }
6763 
6764 // Split map into sections, iterate through sections iterate through specials,
6765 // check if special is valid pick & place special.
6766 // When a sector is populated it's removed from the list,
6767 // and when a special reaches max instances it is also removed.
6768 void overmap::place_specials( overmap_special_batch &enabled_specials )
6769 {
6770  // Calculate if this overmap has any lake terrain--if it doesn't, we should just
6771  // completely skip placing any lake specials here since they'll never place and if
6772  // they're mandatory they just end up causing us to spiral out into adjacent overmaps
6773  // which probably don't have lakes either.
6774  bool overmap_has_lake = false;
6775  bool overmap_has_ocean = false;
6776  for( int z = -OVERMAP_DEPTH; z <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT && !overmap_has_lake; z++ ) {
6777  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX && !overmap_has_lake; x++ ) {
6778  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY && !overmap_has_lake; y++ ) {
6779  overmap_has_lake = ter_unsafe( { x, y, z } )->is_lake();
6780  }
6781  }
6782  }
6783  for( int z = -OVERMAP_DEPTH; z <= OVERMAP_HEIGHT && !overmap_has_ocean; z++ ) {
6784  for( int x = 0; x < OMAPX && !overmap_has_ocean; x++ ) {
6785  for( int y = 0; y < OMAPY && !overmap_has_ocean; y++ ) {
6786  overmap_has_ocean = ter_unsafe( { x, y, z } )->is_ocean();
6787  }
6788  }
6789  }
6790 
6791  for( auto iter = enabled_specials.begin(); iter != enabled_specials.end(); ) {
6792  // If this special has the LAKE flag and the overmap doesn't have any
6793  // lake terrain, then remove this special from the candidates for this
6794  // overmap.
6795  if( iter->special_details->has_flag( "LAKE" ) && !overmap_has_lake ) {
6796  iter = enabled_specials.erase( iter );
6797  continue;
6798  }
6799  if( iter->special_details->has_flag( "OCEAN" ) && !overmap_has_ocean ) {
6800  iter = enabled_specials.erase( iter );
6801  continue;
6802  }
6803 
6804  const bool unique = iter->special_details->has_flag( "UNIQUE" );
6805  const bool globally_unique = iter->special_details->has_flag( "GLOBALLY_UNIQUE" );
6806  if( unique || globally_unique ) {
6807  const overmap_special_id &id = iter->special_details->id;
6808  const overmap_special_placement_constraints &constraints = iter->special_details->get_constraints();
6809  const float special_count = overmap_buffer.get_unique_special_count( id );
6810  const float overmap_count = overmap_buffer.get_overmap_count();
6811  const float min = special_count > 0 ? constraints.occurrences.min / special_count :
6812  constraints.occurrences.min;
6813  const float max = std::max( overmap_count > 0 ? constraints.occurrences.max / overmap_count :
6814  constraints.occurrences.max, min );
6815  if( x_in_y( min, max ) && ( !globally_unique || !overmap_buffer.contains_unique_special( id ) ) ) {
6816  // Min and max are overloaded to be the chance of occurrence,
