6817  // so reset instances placed to one short of max so we don't place several.
6818  iter->instances_placed = constraints.occurrences.max - 1;
6819  } else {
6820  iter = enabled_specials.erase( iter );
6821  continue;
6822  }
6823  }
6824  ++iter;
6825  }
6826  // Bail out early if we have nothing to place.
6827  if( enabled_specials.empty() ) {
6828  return;
6829  }
6830  om_special_sectors sectors = get_sectors( OMSPEC_FREQ );
6831 
6832  // First, place the mandatory specials to ensure that all minimum instance
6833  // counts are met.
6834  place_specials_pass( enabled_specials, sectors, false, false );
6835 
6836  // Snapshot remaining specials, which will be the optional specials and
6837  // any unplaced mandatory specials. By passing a copy into the creation of
6838  // the adjacent overmaps, we ensure that when we unwind the overmap creation
6839  // back to filling in our non-mandatory specials for this overmap, we won't
6840  // count the placement of the specials in those maps when looking for optional
6841  // specials to place here.
6842  overmap_special_batch custom_overmap_specials = enabled_specials;
6843 
6844  // Check for any unplaced mandatory specials, and if there are any, attempt to
6845  // place them on adjacent uncreated overmaps.
6846  bool any_below_minimum =
6847  std::any_of( custom_overmap_specials.begin(), custom_overmap_specials.end(),
6848  []( const overmap_special_placement & placement ) {
6849  return placement.instances_placed <
6850  placement.special_details->get_constraints().occurrences.min;
6851  } );
6852 
6853  if( any_below_minimum ) {
6854  // Randomly select from among the nearest uninitialized overmap positions.
6855  int previous_distance = 0;
6856  std::vector<point_abs_om> nearest_candidates;
6857  // Since this starts at enabled_specials::origin, it will only place new overmaps
6858  // in the 5x5 area surrounding the initial overmap, bounding the amount of work we will do.
6859  for( const point_abs_om &candidate_addr : closest_points_first(
6860  custom_overmap_specials.get_origin(), 2 ) ) {
6861  if( !overmap_buffer.has( candidate_addr ) ) {
6862  int current_distance = square_dist( pos(), candidate_addr );
6863  if( nearest_candidates.empty() || current_distance == previous_distance ) {
6864  nearest_candidates.push_back( candidate_addr );
6865  previous_distance = current_distance;
6866  } else {
6867  break;
6868  }
6869  }
6870  }
6871  if( !nearest_candidates.empty() ) {
6872  point_abs_om new_om_addr = random_entry( nearest_candidates );
6873  overmap_buffer.create_custom_overmap( new_om_addr, custom_overmap_specials );
6874  } else {
6875  std::string msg =
6876  "The following specials could not be placed, some missions may fail to initialize: ";
6877  int n = 0;
6878  for( auto iter = custom_overmap_specials.begin(); iter != custom_overmap_specials.end(); ) {
6879  if( iter->instances_placed < iter->special_details->get_constraints().occurrences.min ) {
6880  msg.append( iter->special_details->id.c_str() ).append( ", " );
6881  n++;
6882  }
6883  ++iter;
6884  }
6885  if( n > 0 ) {
6886  msg = msg.substr( 0, msg.length() - 2 );
6887  } else {
6888  msg = msg.append( "<unknown>" );
6889  }
6890  add_msg( _( msg ) );
6891  }
6892  }
6893  // Then fill in non-mandatory specials.
6894  place_specials_pass( enabled_specials, sectors, true, false );
6895 
6896  // Clean up...
6897  // Because we passed a copy of the specials for placement in adjacent overmaps rather than
6898  // the original, but our caller is concerned with whether or not they were placed at all,
6899  // regardless of whether we placed them or our callee did, we need to reconcile the placement
6900  // that we did of the optional specials with the placement our callee did of optional
6901  // and mandatory.
6902 
6903  // Make a lookup of our callee's specials after processing.
6904  // Because specials are removed from the list once they meet their maximum
6905  // occurrences, this will only contain those which have not yet met their
6906  // maximum.
6907  std::map<overmap_special_id, int> processed_specials;
6908  for( overmap_special_placement &elem : custom_overmap_specials ) {
6909  processed_specials[elem.special_details->id] = elem.instances_placed;
6910  }
6911 
6912  // Loop through the specials we started with.
6913  for( auto it = enabled_specials.begin(); it != enabled_specials.end(); ) {
6914  // Determine if this special is still in our callee's list of specials...
6915  std::map<overmap_special_id, int>::iterator iter = processed_specials.find(
6916  it->special_details->id );
6917  if( iter != processed_specials.end() ) {
6918  // ... and if so, increment the placement count to reflect the callee's.
6919  it->instances_placed += ( iter->second - it->instances_placed );
6920 
6921  // If, after incrementing the placement count, we're at our max, remove
6922  // this special from our list.
6923  if( it->instances_placed >= it->special_details->get_constraints().occurrences.max ) {
6924  it = enabled_specials.erase( it );
6925  } else {
6926  it++;
6927  }
6928  } else {
6929  // This special is no longer in our callee's list, which means it was completely
6930  // placed, and we can remove it from our list.
6931  it = enabled_specials.erase( it );
6932  }
6933  }
6934 }
6935 
6936 void overmap::place_mongroups()
6937 {
6938  // Cities can be full of zombies
6939  int city_spawn_threshold = get_option<int>( "SPAWN_CITY_HORDE_THRESHOLD" );
6940  if( city_spawn_threshold > -1 ) {
6941  int city_spawn_chance = get_option<int>( "SPAWN_CITY_HORDE_SMALL_CITY_CHANCE" );
6942  float city_spawn_scalar = get_option<float>( "SPAWN_CITY_HORDE_SCALAR" );
6943  float city_spawn_spread = get_option<float>( "SPAWN_CITY_HORDE_SPREAD" );
6944  float spawn_density = get_option<float>( "SPAWN_DENSITY" );
6945 
6946  for( city &elem : cities ) {
6947  if( elem.size > city_spawn_threshold || !one_in( city_spawn_chance ) ) {
6948 
6949  // with the default numbers (80 scalar, 1 density), a size 16 city
6950  // will produce 1280 zombies.
6951  int desired_zombies = elem.size * city_spawn_scalar * spawn_density;
6952 
6953  float city_effective_radius = elem.size * city_spawn_spread;
6954 
6955  int city_distance_increment = std::ceil( city_effective_radius / 4 );
6956 
6957  tripoint_abs_omt city_center = project_combine( elem.pos_om, tripoint_om_omt( elem.pos, 0 ) );
6958 
6959  std::vector<tripoint_abs_sm> submap_list;
6960 
6961  // gather all of the points in range to test for viable placement of hordes.
6962  for( tripoint_om_omt const &temp_omt : points_in_radius( tripoint_om_omt( elem.pos, 0 ),
6963  static_cast<int>( city_effective_radius ), 0 ) ) {
6964 
6965  // running too close to the edge of the overmap can get us cascading mapgen
6966  if( inbounds( temp_omt, 2 ) ) {
6967 
6968  tripoint_abs_omt target_omt = project_combine( elem.pos_om, temp_omt );
6969 
6970  // right now we're only placing city horde spawns on roads, for simplicity.
6971  // this can be replaced with an OMT flag for later for better flexibility.
6972  if( overmap_buffer.ter( target_omt )->get_type_id() == oter_type_road ) {
6973  tripoint_abs_sm this_sm = project_to<coords::sm>( target_omt );
6974 
6975  // for some reason old style spawns are submap-aligned.
6976  // get all four quadrants for better distribution.
6977  std::vector<tripoint_abs_sm> local_sm_list;
6978  local_sm_list.push_back( this_sm );
6979  local_sm_list.push_back( this_sm + point_east );
6980  local_sm_list.push_back( this_sm + point_south );
6981  local_sm_list.push_back( this_sm + point_south_east );
6982 
6983  // shuffle, then prune submaps based on distance from city center
6984  // this should let us concentrate hordes closer to the center.
6985  // the shuffling is so they aren't all aligned consistently.
6986  int new_size = 4 - ( trig_dist( target_omt, city_center ) / city_distance_increment );
6987  if( new_size > 0 ) {
6988  std::shuffle( local_sm_list.begin(), local_sm_list.end(), rng_get_engine() );
6989  local_sm_list.resize( new_size );
6990 
6991  submap_list.insert( submap_list.end(), local_sm_list.begin(), local_sm_list.end() );
6992  }
6993 
6994  }
6995  }
6996  }
6997 
6998  if( submap_list.empty() ) {
6999  // somehow the city has no roads. this shouldn't happen.
7000  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_OVERMAP,
7001  "tried to add zombie hordes to city %s centered at omt %s, but there were no roads!",
7002  elem.name, city_center.to_string_writable() );
7003  continue;
7004  }
7005 
7006  add_msg_debug( debugmode::DF_OVERMAP, "adding %i zombies in hordes to city %s centered at omt %s.",
7007  desired_zombies, elem.name, city_center.to_string_writable() );
7008 
7009  // if there aren't enough roads, we'll just reuse them, re-shuffled.
7010  while( desired_zombies > 0 ) {
7011  std::shuffle( submap_list.begin(), submap_list.end(), rng_get_engine() );
7012  for( tripoint_abs_sm const &s : submap_list ) {
7013  if( desired_zombies <= 0 ) {
7014  break;
7015  }
7016  mongroup m( GROUP_ZOMBIE, s, desired_zombies > 10 ? 10 : desired_zombies );
7017 
7018  // with wander_spawns (aka wandering hordes) off, these become 'normal'
7019  // zombie spawns and behave like ants, triffids, fungals, etc.
7020  // they won't try very hard to get placed in the world, so there will
7021  // probably be fewer zombies than expected.
7022  m.horde = true;
7023  if( get_option<bool>( "WANDER_SPAWNS" ) ) {
7024  m.wander( *this );
7025  }
7026  add_mon_group( m );
7027  desired_zombies -= 10;
7028  }
7029  }
7030  }
7031  }
7032  }
7033 
7034  if( get_option<bool>( "DISABLE_ANIMAL_CLASH" ) ) {
7035  // Figure out where swamps are, and place swamp monsters
7036  for( int x = 3; x < OMAPX - 3; x += 7 ) {
7037  for( int y = 3; y < OMAPY - 3; y += 7 ) {
7038  int swamp_count = 0;
7039  for( int sx = x - 3; sx <= x + 3; sx++ ) {
7040  for( int sy = y - 3; sy <= y + 3; sy++ ) {
7041  if( ter( { sx, sy, 0 } ) == oter_forest_water ) {
7042  swamp_count += 2;
7043  }
7044  }
7045  }
7046  if( swamp_count >= 25 ) {
7047  tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
7048  float norm_factor = std::abs( GROUP_SWAMP->freq_total / 1000.0f );
7049  unsigned int pop =
7050  std::round( norm_factor * rng( swamp_count * 8, swamp_count * 25 ) );
7051  spawn_mon_group(
7052  mongroup(
7053  GROUP_SWAMP, project_combine( pos(), project_to<coords::sm>( p ) ),
7054  pop ), 3 );
7055  }
7056  }
7057  }
7058  }
7059 
7060  // Figure out where rivers and lakes are, and place appropriate critters
7061  for( int x = 3; x < OMAPX - 3; x += 7 ) {
7062  for( int y = 3; y < OMAPY - 3; y += 7 ) {
7063  int river_count = 0;
7064  for( int sx = x - 3; sx <= x + 3; sx++ ) {
7065  for( int sy = y - 3; sy <= y + 3; sy++ ) {
7066  if( is_lake_or_river( ter( { sx, sy, 0 } ) ) ) {
7067  river_count++;
7068  }
7069  }
7070  }
7071  if( river_count >= 25 && is_lake_or_river( ter( { x, y, 0 } ) ) ) {
7072  tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
7073  float norm_factor = std::abs( GROUP_RIVER->freq_total / 1000.0f );
7074  unsigned int pop =
7075  std::round( norm_factor * rng( river_count * 8, river_count * 25 ) );
7076  spawn_mon_group(
7077  mongroup( GROUP_RIVER, project_combine( pos(), project_to<coords::sm>( p ) ),
7078  pop ), 3 );
7079  }
7080  }
7081  }
7082 
7083  // Now place ocean mongroup. Weights may need to be altered.
7084  const om_noise::om_noise_layer_ocean f( global_base_point(), g->get_seed() );
7085  const point_abs_om this_om = pos();
7086  const int northern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_north;
7087  const int eastern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_east;
7088  const int western_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_west;
7089  const int southern_ocean = settings->overmap_ocean.ocean_start_south;
7090 
7091  // noise threshold adjuster for deep ocean. Increase to make deep ocean move further from the shore.
7092  constexpr float DEEP_OCEAN_THRESHOLD_ADJUST = 1.25;
7093 
7094  // code taken from place_oceans, but noise threshold increased to determine "deep ocean".
7095  const auto is_deep_ocean = [&]( const point_om_omt & p ) {
7096  // credit to ehughsbaird for thinking up this inbounds solution to infinite flood fill lag.
7097  if( northern_ocean == 0 && eastern_ocean == 0 && western_ocean == 0 && southern_ocean == 0 ) {
7098  // you know you could just turn oceans off in global_settings.json right?
7099  return false;
7100  }
7101  bool inbounds = p.x() > -5 && p.y() > -5 && p.x() < OMAPX + 5 && p.y() < OMAPY + 5;
7102  if( !inbounds ) {
7103  return false;
7104  }
7105  float ocean_adjust = calculate_ocean_gradient( p, this_om );
7106  if( ocean_adjust == 0.0f ) {
7107  // It's too soon! Too soon for an ocean!! ABORT!!!
7108  return false;
7109  }
7110  return f.noise_at( p ) + ocean_adjust > settings->overmap_ocean.noise_threshold_ocean *
7111  DEEP_OCEAN_THRESHOLD_ADJUST;
7112  };
7113 
7114  for( int x = 3; x < OMAPX - 3; x += 7 ) {
7115  for( int y = 3; y < OMAPY - 3; y += 7 ) {
7116  int ocean_count = 0;
7117  for( int sx = x - 3; sx <= x + 3; sx++ ) {
7118  for( int sy = y - 3; sy <= y + 3; sy++ ) {
7119  if( is_ocean( ter( { sx, sy, 0 } ) ) ) {
7120  ocean_count++;
7121  }
7122  }
7123  }
7124  bool am_deep = is_deep_ocean( { x, y } );
7125  if( ocean_count >= 25 ) {
7126  tripoint_om_omt p( x, y, 0 );
7127  if( am_deep ) {
7128  float norm_factor = std::abs( GROUP_OCEAN_DEEP->freq_total / 1000.0f );
7129  unsigned int pop =
7130  std::round( norm_factor * rng( ocean_count * 8, ocean_count * 25 ) );
7131  spawn_mon_group(
7132  mongroup( GROUP_OCEAN_DEEP, project_combine( pos(), project_to<coords::sm>( p ) ),
7133  pop ), 3 );
7134  } else {
7135  float norm_factor = std::abs( GROUP_OCEAN_SHORE->freq_total / 1000.0f );
7136  unsigned int pop =
7137  std::round( norm_factor * rng( ocean_count * 8, ocean_count * 25 ) );
7138  spawn_mon_group(
7139  mongroup( GROUP_OCEAN_SHORE, project_combine( pos(), project_to<coords::sm>( p ) ),
7140  pop ), 3 );
7141  }
7142  }
7143  }
7144  }
7145 }
7146 
7147 void overmap::place_nemesis( const tripoint_abs_omt &p )
7148 {
7149  tripoint_abs_sm pos_sm = project_to<coords::sm>( p );
7150 
7151  mongroup nemesis = mongroup( GROUP_NEMESIS, pos_sm, 1 );
7152  nemesis.horde = true;
7153  nemesis.behaviour = mongroup::horde_behaviour::nemesis;
7154  add_mon_group( nemesis );
7155 }
7156 
7157 point_abs_omt overmap::global_base_point() const
7158 {
7159  return project_to<coords::omt>( loc );
7160 }
7161 
7162 void overmap::place_radios()
7163 {
7164  auto strength = []() {
7165  return rng( RADIO_MIN_STRENGTH, RADIO_MAX_STRENGTH );
7166  };
7167  std::string message;
7168  for( int i = 0; i < OMAPX; i++ ) {
7169  for( int j = 0; j < OMAPY; j++ ) {
7170  tripoint_om_omt pos_omt( i, j, 0 );
7171  point_om_sm pos_sm = project_to<coords::sm>( pos_omt.xy() );
7172  // Since location have id such as "radio_tower_1_north", we must check the beginning of the id
7173  if( is_ot_match( "radio_tower", ter( pos_omt ), ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
7174  if( one_in( 3 ) ) {
7175  radios.emplace_back( pos_sm, strength(), "", radio_type::WEATHER_RADIO );
7176  } else {
7177  message = SNIPPET.expand( SNIPPET.random_from_category( "radio_archive" ).value_or(
7178  translation() ).translated() );
7179  radios.emplace_back( pos_sm, strength(), message );
7180  }
7181  } else if( is_ot_match( "lmoe", ter( pos_omt ), ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
7182  message = string_format( _( "This is automated emergency shelter beacon %d%d."
7183  " Supplies, amenities and shelter are stocked." ), i, j );
7184  radios.emplace_back( pos_sm, strength() / 2, message );
7185  } else if( is_ot_match( "fema_entrance", ter( pos_omt ), ot_match_type::prefix ) ) {
7186  message = string_format( _( "This is FEMA camp %d%d."
7187  " Supplies are limited, please bring supplemental food, water, and bedding."
7188  " This is FEMA camp %d%d. A designated long-term emergency shelter." ), i, j, i, j );
7189  radios.emplace_back( pos_sm, strength(), message );
7190  }
7191  }
7192  }
7193 }
7194 
7195 void overmap::open( overmap_special_batch &enabled_specials )
7196 {
7197  const cata_path terfilename = overmapbuffer::terrain_filename( loc );
7198 
7199  if( read_from_file_optional( terfilename, [this, &terfilename]( std::istream & is ) {
7200  unserialize( terfilename, is );
7201  } ) ) {
7202  const cata_path plrfilename = overmapbuffer::player_filename( loc );
7203  read_from_file_optional( plrfilename, [this, &plrfilename]( std::istream & is ) {
7204  unserialize_view( plrfilename, is );
7205  } );
7206  } else { // No map exists! Prepare neighbors, and generate one.
7207  std::vector<const overmap *> pointers;
7208  // Fetch south and north
7209  for( int i = -1; i <= 1; i += 2 ) {
7210  pointers.push_back( overmap_buffer.get_existing( loc + point( 0, i ) ) );
7211  }
7212  // Fetch east and west
7213  for( int i = -1; i <= 1; i += 2 ) {
7214  pointers.push_back( overmap_buffer.get_existing( loc + point( i, 0 ) ) );
7215  }
7216 
7217  // pointers looks like (north, south, west, east)
7218  generate( pointers[0], pointers[3], pointers[1], pointers[2], enabled_specials );
7219  }
7220 }
7221 
7222 // Note: this may throw io errors from std::ofstream
7223 void overmap::save() const
7224 {
7225  write_to_file( overmapbuffer::player_filename( loc ), [&]( std::ostream & stream ) {
7226  serialize_view( stream );
7227  } );
7228 
7229  write_to_file( overmapbuffer::terrain_filename( loc ), [&]( std::ostream & stream ) {
7230  serialize( stream );
7231  } );
7232 }
7233 
7234 void overmap::spawn_mon_group( const mongroup &group, int radius )
7235 {
7236  tripoint_om_omt pos = project_to<coords::omt>( group.rel_pos() );
7237  if( safe_at_worldgen.find( pos ) != safe_at_worldgen.end() ) {
7238  return;
7239  }
7240  add_mon_group( group, radius );
7241 }
7242 
7243 void overmap::add_mon_group( const mongroup &group )
7244 {
7245  zg.emplace( group.rel_pos(), group );
7246 }
7247 
7248 void overmap::add_mon_group( const mongroup &group, int radius )
7249 {
7250  // We only spread the groups out when radius is greater than 1
7251  if( radius <= 1 ) {
7252  add_mon_group( group );
7253  return;
7254  }
7255  const int rad = std::max<int>( 0, radius );
7256  const double total_area = rad * rad * M_PI + 1;
7257  const double pop = std::max<int>( 0, group.population );
7258  for( int x = -rad; x <= rad; x++ ) {
7259  for( int y = -rad; y <= rad; y++ ) {
7260  const int dist = trig_dist( point( x, y ), point_zero );
7261  if( dist > rad ) {
7262  continue;
7263  }
7264  // Population on a single submap, *not* a integer
7265  double pop_here;
7266  if( rad == 0 ) {
7267  pop_here = pop;
7268  } else {
7269  // This computation is delicate, be careful and see
7270  // https://github.com/CleverRaven/Cataclysm-DDA/issues/26941
7271  pop_here = ( static_cast<double>( rad - dist ) / rad ) * pop / total_area;
7272  }
7273  if( pop_here > pop || pop_here < 0 ) {
7274  DebugLog( D_ERROR, D_GAME ) << group.type.str() << ": invalid population here: " << pop_here;
7275  }
7276  int p = std::max( 0, static_cast<int>( std::floor( pop_here ) ) );
7277  if( pop_here - p != 0 ) {
7278  // in case the population is something like 0.2, randomly add a
7279  // single population unit, this *should* on average give the correct
7280  // total population.
7281  const int mod = static_cast<int>( 10000.0 * ( pop_here - p ) );
7282  if( x_in_y( mod, 10000 ) ) {
7283  p++;
7284  }
7285  }
7286  if( p == 0 ) {
7287  continue;
7288  }
7289  // Exact copy to keep all important values, only change what's needed
7290  // for a single-submap group.
7291  mongroup tmp( group );
7292  tmp.abs_pos += point( x, y );
7293  tmp.population = p;
7294  // This *can* create groups outside of the area of this overmap.
7295  // As this function is called during generating the overmap, the
7296  // neighboring overmaps might not have been generated and one can't access
7297  // them through the overmapbuffer as this would trigger generating them.
7298  // This would in turn to lead to a call to this function again.
7299  // To avoid this, the overmapbuffer checks the monster groups when loading
7300  // an overmap and moves groups with out-of-bounds position to another overmap.
7301  add_mon_group( tmp );
7302  }
7303  }
7304 }
7305 
7306 shared_ptr_fast<npc> overmap::find_npc( const character_id &id ) const
7307 {
7308  for( const auto &guy : npcs ) {
7309  if( guy->getID() == id ) {
7310  return guy;
7311  }
7312  }
7313  return nullptr;
7314 }
7315 
7316 shared_ptr_fast<npc> overmap::find_npc_by_unique_id( const std::string &id ) const
7317 {
7318  for( const auto &guy : npcs ) {
7319  if( guy->get_unique_id() == id ) {
7320  return guy;
7321  }
7322  }
7323  return nullptr;
7324 }
7325 
7326 std::optional<basecamp *> overmap::find_camp( const point_abs_omt &p )
7327 {
7328  for( basecamp &v : camps ) {
7329  if( v.camp_omt_pos().xy() == p ) {
7330  return &v;
7331  }
7332  }
7333  return std::nullopt;
7334 }
7335 
7336 bool overmap::is_omt_generated( const tripoint_om_omt &loc ) const
7337 {
7338  if( !inbounds( loc ) ) {
7339  return false;
7340  }
7341 
7342  // Location is local to this overmap, but we need global submap coordinates
7343  // for the mapbuffer lookup.
7344  tripoint_abs_sm global_sm_loc =
7345  project_to<coords::sm>( project_combine( pos(), loc ) );
7346 
7347  const bool is_generated = MAPBUFFER.lookup_submap( global_sm_loc ) != nullptr;
7348 
7349  return is_generated;
7350 }
7351 
7352 overmap_special_id overmap_specials::create_building_from( const string_id<oter_type_t> &base )
7353 {
7354  // TODO: Get rid of the hard-coded ids.
7355  overmap_special_terrain ter;
7356  ter.terrain = base.obj().get_first().id();
7357  ter.locations.insert( overmap_location_land );
7358  ter.locations.insert( overmap_location_swamp );
7359 
7360  overmap_special_id new_id( "FakeSpecial_" + base.str() );
7361  overmap_special new_special( new_id, ter );
7362  mod_tracker::assign_src( new_special, base->src.back().second.str() );
7363 
7364  return specials.insert( new_special ).id;
7365 }
7366 
7367 namespace io
7368 {
7369 template<>
7370 std::string enum_to_string<ot_match_type>( ot_match_type data )
7371 {
7372  switch( data ) {
7373  // *INDENT-OFF*
7374  case ot_match_type::exact: return "EXACT";
7375  case ot_match_type::type: return "TYPE";
7376  case ot_match_type::subtype: return "SUBTYPE";
7377  case ot_match_type::prefix: return "PREFIX";
7378  case ot_match_type::contains: return "CONTAINS";
7379  // *INDENT-ON*
7380  case ot_match_type::num_ot_match_type:
7381  break;
7382  }
7383  cata_fatal( "Invalid ot_match_type" );
7384 }
7385 } // namespace io
7386 
7387 static const std::array<std::string, 4> suffixes = {{ "_north", "_west", "_south", "_east" }};
7388 
7389 std::string_view oter_no_dir( const oter_id &oter )
7390 {
7391  std::string_view base_oter_id = oter.id().str();
7392  for( const std::string &suffix : suffixes ) {
7393  if( string_ends_with( base_oter_id, suffix ) ) {
7394  base_oter_id = base_oter_id.substr( 0, base_oter_id.size() - suffix.size() );
7395  }
7396  }
7397  return base_oter_id;
7398 }
7399 
7400 int oter_get_rotation( const oter_id &oter )
7401 {
7402  std::string base_oter_id = oter.id().c_str();
7403  for( size_t i = 0; i < suffixes.size(); ++i ) {
7404  if( string_ends_with( base_oter_id, suffixes[i] ) ) {
7405  return i;
7406  }
7407  }
7408  return 0;
7409 }
7410 
7411 std::string oter_get_rotation_string( const oter_id &oter )
7412 {
7413  std::string base_oter_id = oter.id().c_str();
7414  for( const std::string &suffix : suffixes ) {
7415  if( string_ends_with( base_oter_id, suffix ) ) {
7416  return suffix;
7417  }
7418  }
7419  return "";
7420 }
7421 
7422 void overmap_special_migration::load_migrations( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string &src )
7423 {
7424  migrations.load( jo, src );
7425 }
7426 
7427 void overmap_special_migration::reset()
7428 {
7429  migrations.reset();
7430 }
7431 
7432 void overmap_special_migration::load( const JsonObject &jo, const std::string_view )
7433 {
7434  mandatory( jo, was_loaded, "id", id );
7435  optional( jo, was_loaded, "new_id", new_id, overmap_special_id() );
7436 }
7437 
7438 void overmap_special_migration::check()
7439 {
7440  for( const overmap_special_migration &mig : migrations.get_all() ) {
7441  if( !mig.new_id.is_null() && !mig.new_id.is_valid() ) {
7442  debugmsg( "Invalid new_id \"%s\" for overmap special migration \"%s\"", mig.new_id.c_str(),
7443  mig.id.c_str() );
7444  }
7445  }
7446 }
7447 
7448 bool overmap_special_migration::migrated( const overmap_special_id &os_id )
7449 {
7450  std::vector<overmap_special_migration> migs = migrations.get_all();
7451  return std::find_if( migs.begin(), migs.end(), [&os_id]( overmap_special_migration & m ) {
7452  return os_id == overmap_special_id( m.id.str() );
7453  } ) != migs.end();
7454 }
7455 
7456 overmap_special_id overmap_special_migration::migrate( const overmap_special_id &old_id )
7457 {
7458  for( const overmap_special_migration &mig : migrations.get_all() ) {
7459  if( overmap_special_id( mig.id.str() ) == old_id ) {
7460  return mig.new_id;
7461  }
7462  }
7463  return old_id;
7464 }
